ααρων.definition: Aaron, pr. name, indecl., the brother of Moses (Exod. 4:14), Lk. 1:15; Acts 7:40; Heb. 5:4; 7:11; 9:4*

αβαδδων.definition: Abaddon, pr. name, indecl., alternate spelling: Ἀββαδών, the angel who rules in hell, Rev. 9:11*

αβαρης.definition: literally: weightless; figuratively: not burdensome, 2 Cor. 11:9*

αβελ.definition: Abel, pr. name, indecl., Mt. 23:35; Lk. 11:51; Heb. 11:4; 12:24

αβια.definition: Abiajah, pr. name, indecl. Hebrew is Abijah. (1) the son of Rehoboam (1 Chr. 3:10) Mt. 1:7; (2) the division of priests to which Zechariah belonged (1 Chr. 24:10) Lk. 1:5*

αβιληνη.definition: Abilene, a district of the Syrian Decapolis; from Abila, the chief town, Lk. 3:1*

αβυσσος.definition: bottomless; place of the dead, Lk. 8:31; Rom. 10:7

αγαθοεργεω.definition: to do good, confer benefits, Acts 14:17; 1 Tim. 6:18*

αγαθοποιεω.definition: to do good, do well; to do what is morally correct (1 Pet. 2:15, 20)

αγαθοποιος.definition: doing good or right; subst., a well-doer, 1 Pet. 2:14*

αγαθωσυνη.definition: goodness, virtue, beneficence, Rom. 5:14; Eph. 5:9; 2 Thess. 1:11; generosity, Gal. 5:22*

αγαλλιαω.definition: to celebrate, praise; usually in the middle in the NT (ἀγαλλιάομαι) to exult, rejoice exceedingly; to desire ardently, Jn. 8:56

αγανακτεω.definition: to be pained; to be angry, vexed, indignant; to manifest indignation, Mk. 14:4; Lk. 13:14

αγαπαω.definition: to love, value, esteem, feel or manifest generous concern for, be faithful towards; to delight in, to set store upon, Rev. 12:11

αγαπη.definition: love, generosity, kindly concern, devotedness; pl. love-feasts, Jude 12

αγγαρευω.definition: to press, or compel another to go somewhere, or carry some burden, Mt. 5:41; 27:32; Mk. 15:21*

αγγελια.definition: a messsage, doctrine, or precept, delivered in the name of any one; command, 1 Jn. 1:5; 3:11*

αγενεαλογητος.definition: not included in a genealogy; independent of genealogy, Heb. 7:3*

αγενης.definition: lit., without kin; fig., base, low, insignificant, 1 Cor. 1:28*

αγιαζω.definition: to separate, consecrate; cleanse, purify, sanctify; regard or reverence as holy

g40.definition: separate from common condition and use; dedicated. Lk. 2:23; hallowed; used of things, τὰ ἅγια, the sanctuary; and of persons, saints, e.g., members of the first Christian communities; pure, righteous, ceremonially or morally; holy

αγιωσυνη.definition: sanctification, sanctity, holiness, Rom. 1:4; 2 Cor. 7:1; 1 Thess. 3:13*

αγνιζω.definition: to purify; to purify morally, reform, to live like one under a vow of abstinence, as the Nazarites

αγνοεω.definition: to be ignorant; not to understand; sin through ignorance

αγορα.definition: a place of public concourse, forum, market-place; things said in the market, provision

αγοραζω.definition: to buy; redeem, acquire by a ransom or price paid

αγοραιος.definition: one who visits the forum; a lounger, one who idles away his time in public places, a low fellow, Acts 17:5; pertaining to the forum, judicial; ἀγόραιοι, court days, Acts 19:38*

αγρα.definition: a catching, thing taken, draught of fishes, Lk. 5:4, 9*

αγραυλεω.definition: to remain in the open air, to live outside, especially by night, Lk. 2:8*

αγρευω.definition: to take in hunting, catch, Mk. 12:13*

αγριος.definition: belonging to the field, wild; fierce, raging, Mt. 3:4; Mk. 1:6; Jude 13*

αγρος.definition: a field, especially a cultivated field; pl. the country; lands, farms, villages

αγρυπνεω.definition: to be awake, watch; to be watchful, vigilant

g71.definition: to lead. bring; lead away, drive off, as a booty of cattle; conduct, accompany; lead out, produce; conduct with force, drag, hurry away; guide, incite, entice; convey one’s self, go, go away; pass or spend as time; celebrate

αγωγη.definition: guidance, mode of instruction, discipline, course of life, 2 Tim. 3:10*

αγων.definition: place of contest, race-course, stadium; a contest, strife, contention; peril, toil

αγωνια.definition: contest, violent struggle; agony, anguish, Lk. 22:44*

αγωνιζομαι.definition: to be a combatant in the public games; to contend, fight, strive earnestly

αδελφη.definition: a sister; near kinswoman, or female relative, a female member of the Christian community

αδελφος.definition: a brother, near kinsman or relative; one of the same nation or nature; one of equal rank and dignity; an associate, a member of the Christian community

αδελφοτης.definition: brotherhood, the body of the Christian brotherhood, 1 Pet. 2:17; 5:9*

αδηλος.definition: not apparent or obvious; uncertain, not distinct, Lk. 11:44; 1 Cor. 14:8*

αδημονεω.definition: to be depressed or dejected, full of anguish or sorrow, Mt. 26:37; Mk. 14:33; Phil. 2:26*

αδης.definition: the invisible abode or mansion of the dead; the place of punishment, hell; the lowest place or condition, Mt. 11:23; Lk. 10:15

αδιαλειπτως.definition: unceasingly, by an unvarying practice, Rom. 1:9; 1 Thess. 1:2; 2:13; 5:17*

αδικεω.definition: to act unjustly; wrong; injure; violate a law

αδικημα.definition: an act of injustice, crime, Acts 18:14; 24:20; Rev. 18:5*

αδικος.definition: unjust, unrighteous, iniquitous, vicious; deceitful, fallacious

αδοκιμος.definition: unable to stand test, rejected, refuse, worthless

αδραμυττηνος.definition: of Adramyttium, a Greek city on the coast of Aeolia, in Asia Minor, Acts 27:2*

αδυνατεω.definition: not to be able; to be impossible, Mt. 17:20; Lk. 1:37*

αετος.definition: an eagle, Rev. 12:14; or vulture, Lk. 17:37

αζυμος.definition: unleavened; τὰ ἄζυμα, the feast of unleavened bread; met. pure from foreign matter, unadulterated, genuine; τὸ ἄζυμον, genuineness, 1 Cor. 5:7, 8

αζωτος.definition: Azotus, Ashdod, a seaport in Palestine, Acts 8:40*. See PhotoGuide.

αθεος.definition: an atheist; godless, estranged from the knowledge and worship of the true God, Eph. 2:12*

αθετεω.definition: pr. to displace, set aside; to abrogate, annul, violate, swerve from; reject, condemn

αθηναιος.definition: Athenian, inhabiting or belonging to Athens, Acts 17:21, 22*

αθλεω.definition: to strive, contend, be a champion in the public games, 2 Tim. 2:5*

αθυμεω.definition: to be discouraged, lose heart, Col. 3:21*

αιμα.definition: blood; of the color of blood; bloodshed; blood-guiltiness; natural descent

αιματεκχυσια.definition: an effusion or shedding of blood, Heb. 9:22*

αιμορροεω.definition: to have a flow of blood, Mt. 9:20*

αινιγμα.definition: an enigma, riddle, any thing obscurely expressed or intimated, 1 Cor. 13:12*

αινων.definition: Enon, pr. name, indecl., where Jn. was baptizing, Jn. 3:23*. See PhotoGuide.

αιρεω.definition: some list as deponent αἱρέομαι, to take; mid. to choose

αιρεσις.definition: strictly, a choice or option; hence, a religious sect, faction; by implication, discord, contention

αιρετιζω.definition: to choose, choose with delight or love, Mt. 12:18*

αιρετικος.definition: one who creates or fosters factions, Tit. 3:10*

αιρω.definition: to take up, lift, raise; bear, carry; take away, remove; destroy, kill

αισθητηριον.definition: an organ of perception; internal sense, Heb. 5:14*

αισχροκερδης.definition: eager for dishonorable gain, greedy, 1 Tim. 3:8; Tit. 1:7*

αισχροκερδως.definition: for the sake of base gain, greedily, 1 Pet. 5:2*

αισχρολογια.definition: vile or obscene language, foul talk, Col. 3:8*

g150.definition: strictly, deformed, opposed to καλός; met. shameful, indecent, dishonorable, vile, 1 Cor. 11:6; 14:35; Eph. 5:12; Tit. 1:11*

αισχυνη.definition: shame, disgrace; cause of shame, dishonorable conduct

αιτεω.definition: to ask, request; demand; desire, Acts 7:46

αιτημα.definition: a thing asked or sought for; petition, request, Lk. 23:24; Phil. 4:6; 1 Jn. 5:15*

αιτια.definition: cause, motive, incitement; accusation, crime, case

g159.definition: causative; αἴτιος, an author or causer, Heb. 5:9; τὸ αἴτιον, equivalent to αἰτία

αιχμαλωσια.definition: captivity, state of captivity; captive multitude, Eph. 4:8; Rev. 13:10*

αιχμαλωτευω.definition: to lead captive; met. to captivate, Eph. 4:8*

αιχμαλωτιζω.definition: to lead captive; by impl. to subject, Lk. 21:24; Rom. 7:23; 2 Cor. 10:5; 2 Tim. 3:6*

αιων.definition: pr. a period of time of significant character; life; an era; an age: hence, a state of things marking an age or era; the present order of nature; the natural condition of man, the world; ὁ αἰών, illimitable duration, eternity; as also, οἱ αἰῶνες, ὁ αἰῶν τῶν αἰώνων, οἱ αἰῶνες τῶν αἰώνων; by an Aramaism οἱ αἰῶνες, the material universe, Heb. 1:2

αιωνιος.definition: indeterminate as to duration, eternal, everlasting

ακαθαρσια.definition: uncleanness; lewdness; impurity of motive, 1 Thess. 2:3

ακαιρεομαι.definition: to be without opportunity or occasion, Phil. 4:10*

ακακος.definition: free from evil, innocent, blameless; simple, Rom. 16:18; Heb. 7:26*

ακανθινος.definition: thorny, made of thorns, Mk. 15:17; Jn. 19:5*

ακαρπος.definition: without fruit, unfruitful, barren; by impl. noxious

ακαταγνωστος.definition: pr. not worthy of condemnation by a judge; hence, irreprehensible, Tit. 2:8*

ακατακριτος.definition: uncondemned in a public trial, Acts 16:37; 22:25*

ακαταλυτος.definition: incapable of dissolution, indissoluble; hence, enduring, everlasting, Heb. 7:16*

ακαταπαυστος.definition: also spelled ἀκατάπαστος, which cannot be restrained from a thing, unceasing, 2 Pet. 2:14*

ακαταστασια.definition: pr. instability; hence, an unsettled state; disorder, commotion, tumult, sedition, Lk. 21:9; 1 Cor. 14:33; 2 Cor. 6:5; 12:20; Jas. 3:16*

ακεραιος.definition: pr. unmixed: hence, without mixture of vice or deceit, sincere, blameless, Mt. 10:16; Rom. 16:19; Phil. 2:15*

ακμαζω.definition: to flourish, ripen, be in one’s prime, Rev. 14:18*

ακμην.definition: pr. the point of a weapon; point of time: ἀκμήν, for κατἀκμήν, adv., yet, still, even now, Mt. 15:16*

ακοη.definition: hearing; the act or sense of hearing, 1 Cor. 12:17; 2 Pet. 2:8; the instrument of hearing, the ear, Mk. 7:35; a thing heard; announcement, instruction, doctrine, Jn. 12:38; Rom. 10:16; report, Mt. 4:24, et al

ακολουθεω.definition: to follow; follow as a disciple; imitate

ακουω.definition: some list the future active as a middle deponent, ἀκούσομαι, to hear; to hearken, listen to, Mk. 4:3; Lk. 19:48; to heed, obey, Mt. 18:15; Acts 4:19; to understand, 1 Cor. 14:2; to take in or admit to mental acceptance, Mk. 4:33; Jn. 8:43, 47

ακρασια.definition: intemperance, self-indulgence, Mt. 23:25; unruly appetite, lustfulness, 1 Cor. 7:5*

ακριβεια.definition: accuracy, exactness; preciseness, or rigor, severe discipline, Acts 22:3*

ακριβοω.definition: to inquire accurately or diligently, Mt. 2:7, 16 (see v. 8)*

g197.definition: accurately, diligently, Mt. 2:8; Lk. 1:3; Acts 18:25; circumspectly, strictly, Eph. 5:15; precisely, distinctly, 1 Thess. 5:2

ακροβυστια.definition: foreskin; uncircumcision, the state of being uncircumcised, Rom. 4:10; the abstract being put for the concrete, uncircumcised men, i.e., Gentiles, Rom. 4:9, et al

ακρογωνιαιος.definition: literally: lying at the extreme corner; with λίθος, corner or foundation stone, Eph. 2:20; 1 Pet. 2:6*

ακροθινιον.definition: the first-fruits of the produce of the ground, which were taken from the top of the heap and offered to the gods; the best and choicest of the spoils of war, usually collected in a heap, Heb. 7:4*

ακρον.definition: the top, tip, end, extremity, Mk. 13:27; Lk. 16:24; Heb. 11:21

ακυλας.definition: Aquila, pr. name, Paul’s friend and Priscilla’s husband, Acts 18:2, 18, 26; Rom. 16:3; 1 Cor. 16:19; 2 Tim. 4:19*

ακυροω.definition: to deprive of authority, annul, cancel, Mt. 15:6; Mk. 7:13; Gal. 3:17*

αλαβαστρος.definition: can be masculine, feminine (2x), or neuter (ἀλάβαστρον, 2x), an alabaster vase, Mk. 14:3 (2x); 26:7; Lk. 7:37*

αλαζονεια.definition: arrogance; presumptuous speech, Jas. 4:16; haughtiness, 1 Jn. 2:16*

αλαλαζω.definition: pr. to raise the war-cry, ἀλαλά: hence, to utter other loud sounds; to wail, Mk. 5:38; to tinkle, ring, 1 Cor. 13:1*

αλαλος.definition: unable to speak or artilculate, Mk. 7:37; 9:17, 25*

αλας.definition: variant spellings of ἅλα and ἁλός, salt, Mt. 5:13; Mk. 9:50; met. the salt of wisdom and prudence, Col. 4:6

αλειφω.definition: to anoint with oil or ointment

αλεκτοροφωνια.definition: the cock-crowing, the third watch of the night, intermediate to mid-night and daybreak, and termed cock-crow, Mk. 13:35*

αλεκτωρ.definition: a cock, rooster, Mt. 26:34; Mk. 14:30; Lk. 22:34; Jn. 13:38

αλεξανδρευς.definition: a native of Alexandria, an Alexandrine, Acts 6:9; 18:24

αλεξανδρος.definition: Alexander, pr. name. (1) The High Priest’s kinsman, Acts 4:6. (2) A Jew of Ephesus, Acts 19:33. (3) The coppersmith, 1 Tim. 1:20; 2 Tim. 4:14. (4) Son of Simon of Cyrene, Mk. 15:21*

αληθεια.definition: truth, Mk. 5:33; love of truth, sincerity, 1 Cor. 5:8; divine truth revealed to man, Jn. 1:17; practice in accordance with Gospel truth, Jn. 3:21; 2 Jn. 4

αληθευω.definition: to speak or maintain the truth; to act truly or sincerely, Gal. 4:16; Eph. 4:15*

αληθης.definition: true, Jn. 4:18; worthy of credit, Jn. 5:31; truthful, Jn. 7:18

αληθινος.definition: sterling, Lk. 16:11; real, Jn. 6:32; 1 Thess. 1:9; unfeigned, trustworthy, true, Jn. 19:35

αληθως.definition: truly, really, Mt. 14:33; certainly, of a truth, Jn. 17:8; Acts 12:11: truly, actually, Jn. 4:18

αλιζω.definition: to salt, season with salt, preserve by salting, Mt. 5:13; Mk. 9:49*

αλλα.definition: but; however; but still more; ἀλλάγε, at all events; ἀλλή, unless, except. Ἀλλά also serves to introduce a sentence with keenness and emphasis, Jn. 16:2; Rom. 6:5; 7:7; Phil. 3:8

αλλασσω.definition: to change, alter, transform, Acts 6:14; Rom. 1:23; 1 Cor. 15:51, 52; Gal. 4:20; Heb. 1:12

αλλαχοθεν.definition: from another place or elsewhere, Jn. 10:1*

αλληγορεω.definition: to say what is either designed or fitted to convey a meaning other than the literal one, to allegorize; ἀλληγορούμενος, adapted to another meaning, otherwise significant, Gal. 4:24*

αλληλουια.definition: (Hebrew) hallelujah, praise Yahweh or the Lord, Rev. 19:1, 3, 4, 6*

αλλογενης.definition: of another race or nation, i.e., not a Jew; a stranger, foreigner, Lk. 17:18*

αλλομαι.definition: to leap, jump, leap up, Acts 3:8; 14:10; to spring, as water, Jn. 4:14*

αλλος.definition: another, some other; ὁ ἄλλος, the other; οἱ ἄλλοι, the others, the rest

αλλοτριεπισκοπος.definition: pr. one who meddles with the affairs of others, a busybody in other men’s matters; factious, 1 Pet. 4:15*

αλλοτριος.definition: belonging to another, Lk. 16:12; foreign, Acts 7:6; Heb. 11:9; a foreigner, alien, Mt. 17:25

αλλοφυλος.definition: of another race or nation, i.e., not a Jew, a foreigner, Acts 10:28*

αλοαω.definition: to thresh; to tread, 1 Cor. 9:9, 10; 1 Tim. 5:18*

αλογος.definition: without speech or reason, irrational, brute, 2 Pet. 2:12; Jude 10; unreasonable, absurd, Acts 25:27*

αλοη.definition: aloe, lign-aloe, a tree which grows in India and Cochin-China, the wood of which is soft and bitter, though highly aromatic. It is used by the Orientals as a perfume; and employed for the purposes of embalming, Jn. 19:39*

αλυπος.definition: free from grief or sorrow, Phil. 2:28*

αλυσιτελης.definition: pr. bringing in no revenue or profit; hence, unprofitable, useless; detrimental; ruinous, disastrous, Heb. 13:17*

αλφα.definition: first letter of Greek alphabet, Alpha, Rev. 1:8.; 21:6; 22:13*

αλφαιος.definition: Alphaeus, pr. name (1) Father of Jas. the less, Mt. 10:3; Mk. 3:18; Lk. 6:15; Acts 1:13. (2) Father of Levi, (or Matthew) Mk. 2:14*

αλων.definition: a threshing-floor, a place where corn is trodden out; meton. the corn which is trodden out, Mt. 3:12; Lk. 3:17*

αλωπηξ.definition: a fox, Mt. 8:20; Lk. 9:58; met. a fox-like, crafty man, Lk. 13:32*

αμα.definition: also functions as an improper preposition with the genitive (2x), with, together with; at the same time

αμαρτανω.definition: pr. to miss a mark; to be in error, 1 Cor. 15:34; Tit. 3:11; to sin, Jn. 5:14; to be guilty of wrong, Mt. 18:15

αμαρτημα.definition: an error; sin, offence, Mk. 3:28; 4:12; Rom. 3:25; 1 Cor. 6:18

αμαρτια.definition: error; offence, sin, Mt. 1:21; a principle or cause of sin, Rom. 7:7; proneness to sin, sinful propensity, Rom. 7:17, 20; guilt or imputation of sin, Jn. 9:41; Heb. 9:26; a guilty subject, sin-offering, expiatory victim, 2 Cor. 5:21

αμαρτυρος.definition: without testimony or witness, without evidence, Acts 14:17*

αμαρτωλος.definition: one who deviates from the path of virtue, a sinner, Mk. 2:17; depraved, Mk. 8:38; sinful, detestable, Rom. 7:13

αμαχος.definition: not disposed to fight; not quarrelsome or contentious, 1 Tim. 3:3; Tit. 3:2*

αμαω.definition: to collect; to reap, mow or cut down, Jas. 5:4*

αμεθυστος.definition: an amethyst, a gem of a deep purple or violet color, so called from its supposed efficacy in keeping off drunkenness, Rev. 21:20*

αμελεω.definition: not to care for, to neglect, disregard, Mt. 22:5; 1 Tim. 4:14; Heb. 2:3; 8:9*

αμεμπτος.definition: blameless, irreprehensible, without defect, Lk. 1:6; Phil. 2:15; 3:6; 1 Thess. 3:13; Heb. 8:7*

αμεριμνος.definition: free from care or solicitude, Mt. 28:14; 1 Cor. 7:32*

αμεταμελητος.definition: not to be repented of; by impl. irrevocable, enduring, Rom. 11:29; 2 Cor. 7:10*

αμετρος.definition: without or beyond measure, regardless of measure, 2 Cor. 10:13, 15*

αμην.definition: in truth, most certainly; so be it; ὁ ἀμήν, the faithful and true one, Rev. 3:14

αμητωρ.definition: pr. without mother; independent of maternal descent, Heb. 7:3*

αμιαντος.definition: pr. unstained, unsoiled; met. undefiled, chaste, Heb. 7:26; 13:4; pure, sincere, Jas. 1:27; undefiled, unimpaired, 1 Pet. 1:4*

αμιναδαβ.definition: Aminadab, pr. name, indecl., Mt. 1:4; Lk. 3:33*

αμυνομαι.definition: to ward off; to help, assist; to repel from oneself, resist, make a defence; to assume the office of protector and avenger, Acts 7:24*

+.definition: to throw around; to cast a net, Mk. 1:16*

αμφιβληστρον.definition: pr. what is thrown around, e.g., a garment; a large kind of fishnet, Mt. 4:18*

αμφιεννυμι.definition: also spelled ἀμφιέζω and ἀμφιέννυμι, to clothe, invest, Mt. 6:30; 11:8; Lk. 7:25*

αμφιπολις.definition: Amphipolis, a city of Thrace, on the river Strymon, Acts 17:1*. See PhotoGuide.

αμφοδον.definition: pr. a road leading round a town or village; the street of a village, Mk. 11:4*

αμφοτεροι.definition: both. Only plural in the NT.

αμωμον.definition: amomum, an odoriferous shrub, from which a precious ointment was prepared, Rev. 18:13*

αμως.definition: Amos, pr. name, indecl., Mt. 1:10; Lk. 3:25*

αν.definition: For the various constructions of this particle, and their significance, consult a grammar. At the beginning of a clause, it is another form of ἐάν, if, Jn. 20:23

ανα.definition: prep. used in the NT only in certain forms. ἀνὰ μέρος, in turn; ἀνὰ μέσον, through the midst, between; ἀνὰ δηνάριον, at the rate of a denarius; with numerals, ἀνὰ ἑκατόν, in parties of a hundred. In composition, step by step, up, back, again

αναβαθμος.definition: the act of ascending; means of ascent, steps, stairs, Acts 21:35, 40*

αναβαινω.definition: to go up, ascend, Mt. 5:1; to climb, Lk. 19:4; to go on board, Mk. 6:51; to rise, mount upwards, as smoke, Rev. 8:4; to grow or spring up, as plants, Mt. 13:7; to spring up, arise, as thoughts, Lk. 24:38

αναβαλλω.definition: to throw back; mid. to put off, defer, adjourn, Acts 24:22*

αναβιβαζω.definition: to cause to come up or ascend, draw or bring up, Mt. 13:48*

αναβλεπω.definition: to look upwards, Mt. 14:19; to see again, recover sight, Mt. 11:5

αναβοαω.definition: to cry out or aloud, exclaim, Mt. 27:46*

αναγγελλω.definition: to bring back word, announce, report, Mk. 5:14; to declare, set forth, teach, Jn. 5:24

αναγενναω.definition: to beget or bring forth again; to regenerate, 1 Pet. 1:3, 23*

αναγινωσκω.definition: to gather exact knowledge of, recognize, discern; especially, to read

αναγκαζω.definition: to force, compel, Acts 28:19; to constrain, urge, Lk. 14:23

αναγκαιος.definition: necessary, indispensable, 1 Cor. 12:22; necessary, needful, right, proper, Acts 13:46; 2 Cor. 9:5; Phil. 1:24; 2:25; Heb. 8:3; near, intimate, closely connected, as friends, Acts 10:24

αναγκαστως.definition: by constraint or compulsion, unwillingly, opposite to ἑκουσίως, 1 Pet. 5:2*

αναγκη.definition: necessity, Mt. 18:7; constraint, compulsion, 2 Cor. 9:7; obligation of duty, moral or spiritual necessity, Rom. 13:5; distress, trial, affliction, Lk. 21:23; 1 Cor. 7:26; 2 Cor. 6:4; 12:10; 1 Thess. 3:7

αναγνωριζω.definition: to recognize; pass. to be made known, or to cause one’s self to be recognized, Acts 7:13*

αναγω.definition: to conduct; to lead or convey up from a lower place to a higher, Lk. 4:5; to offer up, as a sacrifice, Acts 7:41; to lead out, produce, Acts 12:4; as a nautical term (in the middle or passive), to set sail, put to sea, Lk. 8:22

αναδεικνυμι.definition: pr. to show anything by raising it aloft, as a torch; to display, manifest, show plainly or openly, Acts 1:24; to mark out, constitute, appoint by some outward sign, Lk. 10:1*

αναδειξις.definition: a showing forth, manifestation; public entrance upon the duty or office to which one is consecrated, Lk. 1:80*

αναδεχομαι.definition: to receive, as opposed to shunning or refusing; to receive with hospitality, Acts 28:7; to embrace a proffer or promise, Heb. 11:17*

αναδιδωμι.definition: to give forth, up, or back; to deliver, present, Acts 23:33*

αναζαω.definition: to live again, recover life, revive, Rom. 7:9; met. to live a new and reformed life, Lk. 15:24, 32*

αναζητεω.definition: to track; to seek diligently, inquire after, search for, Lk. 2:44, 45; Acts 11:25*

αναζωννυμι.definition: to gird with a belt or girdle; to gird one’s self, 1 Pet. 1:13*

αναζωπυρεω.definition: pr. to kindle up a dormant fire; met. to revive, excite; to stir up, quicken one’s powers, 2 Tim. 1:6*

αναθαλλω.definition: to grow or bloom again; to renew, Phil. 4:10*

αναθεμα.definition: a devoted thing, ordinarily in a bad sense, a person or thing accursed, Rom. 9:3; 1 Cor. 12:3; 16:22; Gal. 1:8, 9; a curse, execration, anathema, Acts 23:14*

αναθεματιζω.definition: to declare any one to be ἀνάθεμα; to curse, bind by a curse, Mk. 14:71; Acts 23:12, 14, 21*

αναθεωρεω.definition: to view, behold attentively, contemplate, Acts 17:23; Heb. 13:7*

αναθημα.definition: a gift or offering consecrated to God, Lk. 21:5*

αναιδεια.definition: pr. shamelessness; hence, persistence, without regard to time, place, or person, Lk. 11:8*

αναιρεσις.definition: a taking up or away; a putting to death, murder, Acts 8:1*

αναιρεω.definition: pr. to take up, lift, as from the ground; to take off, put to death, kill, murder, Mt. 2:16; to take away, abolish, abrogate, Heb. 10:9; mid. to take up infants in order to bring them up, Acts 7:21

ανακαθιζω.definition: to set up; intrans. to sit up, Lk. 7:15; Acts 9:40*

ανακαλυπτω.definition: to unveil, uncover; pass. to be unveiled, 2 Cor. 3:18; met. to be disclosed in true character and condition, 2 Cor. 3:14*

ανακαμπτω.definition: pr. to reflect, bend back; hence, to bend back one’s course, return, Mt. 2:12; Lk. 10:6; Acts 18:21; Heb. 11:15*

ανακειμαι.definition: to be laid up, as offerings; later, to lie, recline at table, Mt. 9:10

ανακεφαλαιοω.definition: to bring together several things under one, reduce under one head; to comprise, Rom. 13:9; Eph. 1:10*

ανακλινω.definition: to lay down, Lk. 2:7; to cause to recline at table, etc. Mk. 6:39; Lk. 9:15; 12:37; to recline at table, Mt. 8:11

ανακραζω.definition: to cry aloud, exclaim, shout, Mk. 1:23; 6:49; Lk. 4:33; 8:28; 23:18*

ανακρινω.definition: to sift; to examine closely, Acts 17:11; to scrutinize, scan, 1 Cor. 2:14, 15; 9:3; to try judicially, Lk. 23:14; to judge, give judgment upon, 1 Cor. 4:3, 4; to put questions, be inquisitive, 1 Cor. 10:25, 27; Acts 11:12 v.l

ανακρισις.definition: investigation, judicial examination, hearing of a cause, Acts 25:26*

ανακυπτω.definition: pr. to raise up one’s self, look up, Lk. 13:11; Jn. 8:7, 10; met. to look up cheerily, to be cheered, Lk. 21:28*

αναλαμβανω.definition: to take up, receive up, Mk. 16:19; to take up, carry, Acts 7:43; to take on board, Acts 20:13, 14; to take in company, Acts 23:31; 2 Tim. 4:11

αναλημψις.definition: a taking up, receiving up, Lk. 9:51*

αναλος.definition: without saltness, without the taste and pungency of salt, insipid, Mk. 9:50

αναλυσις.definition: pr. dissolution; met. departure, death, 2 Tim. 4:6*

αναλυω.definition: pr. to loose, dissolve; intrans. to loose in order to departure; to depart, Lk. 12:36; to depart from life, Phil. 1:23*

αναμενω.definition: to await, wait for, expect, 1 Thess. 1:10*

αναμιμνησκω.definition: to remind, cause to remember, 1 Cor. 4:17; to exhort, 2 Tim. 1:6; to call to mind, recollect, remember, Mk. 11:21; 14:72; 2 Cor. 7:15; Heb. 10:32*

αναμνησις.definition: remembrance; a commemoration, memorial, Lk. 22:19; 1 Cor. 11:24, 25; Heb. 10:3*

ανανεοω.definition: also spelled ἀνανεόομαι, to renew; pass. to be renewed, be renovated, by inward reformation, Eph. 4:23*

ανανηφω.definition: to become sober; met. to recover sobriety of mind, 2 Tim. 2:26*

ανανιας.definition: Ananias, pr. name I. A Christian of Jerusalem, Acts 5:1, etc. II. A Christian of Damascus, Acts 9:12, etc. III. High Priest, Acts 23:2; 24:1

αναντιρρητος.definition: not to be contradicted, indisputable, Acts 19:36*

αναντιρρητως.definition: pr. without contradiction or gainsaying; without hesitation, promptly, Acts 10:29*

αναξιως.definition: unworthily, in an improper manner, 1 Cor. 11:27*

αναπαυσις.definition: rest, intermission, Mt. 11:29; Rev. 4:8; 14:11; meton. place of rest, fixed habitation, Mt. 12:43; Lk. 11:24*

αναπαυω.definition: to cause to rest, to soothe, refresh, Mt. 11:28; mid. to take rest, repose, refreshment, Mt. 26:45; to have a fixed place of rest, abide, dwell, 1 Pet. 4:14

αναπειθω.definition: to persuade to a different opinion, to seduce, Acts 18:13*

αναπειρος.definition: also spelled ἀνάπηρος, maimed, deprived of some member of the body, or at least of its use, Lk. 14:13, 21

αναπεμπω.definition: to send back, Phlm. 12; to send up, remit to a tribunal, Lk. 23:7, 11, 15; Acts 25:21*

αναπηδαω.definition: to leap up, stand up, Mk. 10:50*

αναπιπτω.definition: to fall or recline backwards; to recline at table, etc., Lk. 11:37; to throw one’s self back, Jn. 21:20

αναπληροω.definition: to fill up, complete, 1 Thess. 2:16; to fulfil, confirm, as a prophecy by the event, Mt. 13:14; to fill the place of any one, 1 Cor. 14:16; to supply, make good, 1 Cor. 16:17; Phil. 2:30; to observe fully, keep the law, Gal. 6:2*

αναπτυσσω.definition: to roll back, unroll, unfold, Lk. 4:17*

αναπτω.definition: to light, kindle, set on fire, Lk. 12:49; Jas. 3:5*

ανασειω.definition: pr. to shake up; met. to stir up, instigate, Mk. 15:11; Lk. 23:5*

ανασκευαζω.definition: pr. to collect one’s effects or baggage (σκεύη) in order to remove; to lay waste by carrying off or destroying every thing; met. to unsettle, pervert, subvert, Acts 15:24*

ανασπαω.definition: to draw up, to draw out, Lk. 14:5; Acts 11:10*

αναστασις.definition: a raising or rising up; resurrection, Mt. 22:23; meton. the author of resurrection, Jn. 11:25; met. an uprising into a state of higher advancement and blessedness, Lk. 2:34

αναστατοω.definition: to lay waste, destroy; to disturb, throw into commotion, Acts 17:6; to excite to sedition and tumult, Acts 21:38; to disturb the mind of any one by doubts, etc.; to subvert, unsettle, Gal. 5:12*

αναστρεφω.definition: to overturn, throw down, to turn back, return, Acts 5:22; 15:16; to live, to conduct one’s self, 2 Cor. 1:12; Eph. 2:3; 1 Tim. 3:15; Heb. 13:18; 1 Pet. 1:17; 2 Pet. 2:18; to gaze, Heb. 10:33*

αναστροφη.definition: conversation, mode of life, conduct, deportment, Gal. 1:13

ανατασσομαι.definition: pr. to arrange; hence, to compose, Lk. 1:1*

ανατελλω.definition: to cause to rise, Mt. 5:45; intrans. to rise, as the sun, stars, etc., Mt. 4:16; to spring by birth, Heb. 7:14

ανατιθημι.definition: in NT only mid., to submit to a person’s consideration, statement, or report of matters, Acts 25:14; Gal. 2:2*

ανατολη.definition: pr. a rising of the sun, etc.; the place of rising, the east, as also pl. ἀνατολαί, Mt. 2:1, 2; met. the dawn or day-spring, Lk. 1:78

ανατρεπω.definition: pr. to overturn, overthrow; met. to subvert, corrupt, 2 Tim. 2:18; Tit. 1:11; Jn. 2:15*

ανατρεφω.definition: to nurse, as an infant, Acts 7:20; to bring up, educate, Acts 7:21; 22:3*

αναφαινω.definition: to bring to light, display; mid. and pass. to appear, Lk. 19:11; a nautical term, to come in sight of, Acts 21:3*

αναφερω.definition: to bear or carry upwards, lead up, Mt. 17:1; to offer sacrifices, Heb. 7:27; to bear aloft or sustain a burden, as sins, 1 Pet. 2:24; Heb. 9:28

αναχυσις.definition: a pouring out; met. excess, stream, flood, 1 Pet. 4:4*

αναχωρεω.definition: to go backward; to depart, go away, Mt. 2:12; to withdraw, retire, Mt. 9:24; Acts 23:19; 26:31

αναψυξις.definition: pr. a refreshing coolness after heat; met. refreshing, recreation, rest, Acts 3:20*

αναψυχω.definition: to recreate by fresh air; to refresh, cheer, 2 Tim. 1:16*

ανδριζομαι.definition: to render brave or manly; mid. to show or behave one’s self like a man, 1 Cor. 16:13*

ανεγκλητος.definition: unblamable, irreproachable, 1 Cor. 1:8; Col. 1:22; 1 Tim. 3:10; Tit. 1:6, 7*

ανεκδιηγητος.definition: which cannot be related, inexpressible, unutterable, indescribable, 2 Cor. 9:15*

ανεμιζω.definition: to agitate with the wind; pass. to be agitated or driven by the wind, Jas. 1:6*

ανεμος.definition: the wind; met. a wind of shifting doctrine, Eph. 4:14

ανεξεραυνητος.definition: also spelled ἀνεξερεύνητος, unfathomable, incapable of human explanation, Rom. 11:33*

ανεξικακος.definition: enduring or patient under evils and injuries, 2 Tim. 2:24*

ανεξιχνιαστος.definition: to track out, ἴξνος, a track which cannot be explored, inscrutable, incomprehensible, Rom. 11:33; Eph. 3:8*

ανεπαισχυντος.definition: without cause of shame, irreproachable, 2 Tim. 2:15*

ανεπιλημπτος.definition: also spelled ἀνεπίληπρος. pr. not to be laid hold of; met. beyond reproach, unblamable, 1 Tim. 3:2; 5:7; 6:14*

ανερχομαι.definition: to ascend, go up, Jn. 6:3; Gal. 1:17, 18*

ανεσις.definition: pr. the relaxing of a state of constraint; relaxation of rigor of confinement, Acts 24:23; met. ease, rest, peace, tranquility, 2 Cor. 2:13; 7:5; 8:13; 2 Thess. 1:7*

ανεταζω.definition: to examine thoroughly; to examine by torture, Acts 22:24, 29*

ανευ.definition: some classify as an improper preposition, without, Mt. 10:29; 1 Pet. 3:1; 4:9*

ανευρισκω.definition: to find by diligent search, Lk. 2:16; Acts 21:4*

ανεχομαι.definition: also listed as ἀνέχω, but it is always in the middle in our literature, to endure patiently, 1 Cor. 4:12; 2 Cor. 11:20; 2 Thess. 1:4; to bear with, Matt 17:7; to suffer, admit, permit, Acts 18:14; 2 Cor. 11:4; 2 Tim. 4:3; Heb. 13:22

ανηκω.definition: to come up to, to pertain to; ἀνήκει, impers. it is fit, proper, becoming, Col. 3:18; Eph. 5:4; Phlm. 8*

ανηρ.definition: a male person of full age and stature, as opposed to a child or female, 1 Cor. 13:11; a husband, Mt. 1:16; a man, human being, individual, Lk. 11:31; used also pleonastically with other nouns and adjectives, Lk. 5:8; Acts 1:16

ανθιστημι.definition: to oppose, resist, stand out against

ανθομολογεομαι.definition: pr. to come to an agreement; hence, to confess openly what is due; to confess, give thanks, render praise, Lk. 2:38*

ανθρακια.definition: a mass or heap of live coals, Jn. 18:18; 21:9

ανθρωπαρεσκος.definition: desirous of pleasing men, Eph. 6:6; Col. 3:22*

ανθρωπινος.definition: human, belonging to man, 1 Cor. 2:4, 13; 4:3; 10:13; Jas. 3:7; 1 Pet. 2:13; suited to man, Rom. 6:19*

ανθρωπος.definition: a human being, Jn. 16:21; Phil. 2:7; an individual, Rom. 3:28, et al. freq.; used also pleonastically with other words, Mt. 11:19; et al.; met. the spiritual frame of the inner man, Rom. 7:22; Eph. 3:16; 1 Pet. 3:4

ανιημι.definition: (1) to loose, slacken, Acts 27:40; to unbind, unfasten, Acts 16:26; (2) to omit, dispense with, Eph. 6:9; (3) to leave or neglect, Heb. 13:5*

ανιπτος.definition: literally: unwashed; figuratively: ceremonially unclean Mt. 15:20; Mk. 7:2*

ανιστημι.definition: trans. to cause to stand up or rise, Acts 9:41; to raise up, as the dead, Jn. 6:39; to raise up into existence, Mt. 22:24; intrans. and mid., to rise up, Mt. 9:9; to rise up into existence, Acts 7:18; 20:30

αννας.definition: Annas, pr. name, short version of Ἅνανος, Lk. 3:2; Jn. 18:13, 24; Acts 4:6*

ανοητος.definition: inconsiderate, unintelligent, unwise; Lk. 24:25; Rom. 1:14; Gal. 3:1, 3; Tit. 3:3; brutish, 1 Tim. 6:9

ανοια.definition: want of understanding; folly, rashness, madness, Lk. 6:11; 2 Tim. 3:9*

ανοιγω.definition: trans. to open, Mt. 2:11; intrans. to be opened, to be open, Mt. 3:16; Jn. 1:52

ανοιξις.definition: an opening, act of opening, Eph. 6:19*

ανομια.definition: lawlessness; violation of law, 1 Jn. 3:4; iniquity, sin, Mt. 7:23

ανομος.definition: lawless, without law, not subject to law, 1 Cor. 9:21; lawless, violating law, wicked, impious, Acts 2:23; a transgressor, Mk. 15:28; Lk. 22:37

ανομως.definition: without the intervention of law, Rom. 2:12 (2x)

ανορθοω.definition: to restore to straightness or erectness, Lk. 13:13; to re-invigorate, Heb. 12:12; to re-erect, Acts 15:16*

ανταλλαγμα.definition: a price paid in exchange for a thing; compensation, equivalent ransom, Mt. 16:26; Mk. 8:37*

ανταναπληροω.definition: to fill up, complete, supply, Col. 1:24*

ανταποδιδωμι.definition: to repay, give back, return, recompense, Lk. 14:14 (2x); Rom. 11:35; 12:19; 1 Thess. 3:9; 2 Thess. 1:6; Heb. 10:30

ανταποκρινομαι.definition: occurs in the NT only in the middle, to answer, speak in answer, Lk. 14:6; to reply against, contradict, dispute, Rom. 9:20*

αντεχω.definition: to hold firmly, cling or adhere to; to be devoted to any one, Lk. 16:13; Tit. 1:9; to exercise a zealous care for any one, 1 Thess. 5:14; Mk. 6:24*

αντι.definition: over against; hence, in correspondence to, answering to, Jn. 1:16; in place of, Mt. 2:22; in retribution or return for, Mt. 5:38; in consideration of, Heb. 12:2, 16; on account of, Mt. 17:27; ἀνθ’ ὡ, because, Lk. 1:20

αντιβαλλω.definition: pr. to throw or toss from one to another; met. to agitate, to converse or discourse about, Lk. 24:17*

αντιδιατιθημι.definition: to set opposite; mid. (only in the NT) to be of an opposite opinion, to be adverse; opponent, 2 Tim. 2:25*

αντιδικος.definition: an opponent in a lawsuit, Mt. 5:25 (2x); Lk. 12:58; 18:3; an adversary, 1 Pet. 5:8*

αντιθεσις.definition: pr. opposition; hence, a question proposed for dispute, disputation, 1 Tim. 6:20*

αντικαθιστημι.definition: trans. to set in opposition; intrans. to withstand, resist, Heb. 12:4*

αντικειμαι.definition: pr. occupy an opposite position; met. to oppose, be adverse to, Gal. 5:17; 1 Tim. 1:10; opponent, hostile, Lk. 13:7

αντικρυς.definition: can function as an improper preposition with the gen., also spelled ἀντικρύ, opposite to, over against, Acts 20:15*

αντιλαμβανω.definition: to aid, assist, help, Lk. 1:54; Acts 20:35; to be a recipient, 1 Tim. 6:2*

g483.definition: to speak against, contradict; to gainsay, deny, Lk. 20:27; to oppose, Jn. 19:12; Acts 13:45; 28:19; Rom. 10:21; Tit. 1:9; 2:9; pass. to be spoken against, decried, Lk. 2:34; Acts 28:22*

αντιλημψις.definition: aid, assistance; meton, one who aids or assists, a help, 1 Cor. 12:28*

αντιλογια.definition: contradiction, question, Heb. 6:16; 7:7; opposition, rebellion, Jude 11; hostility, Heb. 12:3*

αντιλοιδορεω.definition: to reproach or revile again or in return, 1 Pet. 2:23*

αντιοχεια.definition: Antioch, pr. name I. Antioch, the metropolis of Syria, where the disciples first received the name of Christians II. Antioch, a city of Pisidia, Acts 13:14; 14:19; 2 Tim. 3:11. See PhotoGuide.

αντιπαρερχομαι.definition: to pass over against, to pass along without noticing, Lk. 10:31, 32*

αντιπατρις.definition: Antipatris, pr. name, Acts 23:31*. See PhotoGuide.

αντιπερα.definition: can function as an improper preposition with the gen., opposite, Lk. 8:26*

αντιπιπτω.definition: pr. to fall upon, rush upon any one; hence, to resist by force, oppose, strive against, Acts 7:51*

αντιστρατευομαι.definition: to war against; to contravene, oppose, Rom. 7:23*

αντιτασσω.definition: to post in adverse array, as an army; mid. to set oneself in opposition, resist, Acts 18:6; Rom. 13:2; Jas. 5:6; to be averse, Jas. 4:6; 1 Pet. 5:5*

αντιτυπος.definition: of correspondent stamp or form; corresponding, in correspondent fashion, 1 Pet. 3:21; τὸ ἀντίτυπον, a copy, representation, Heb. 9:24*

αντιχριστος.definition: antichrist, an opposer of Christ, 1 Jn. 2:18, 22; 4:3; 2 Jn. 7; plural in 1 Jn. 2:18*

αντλεω.definition: to draw, e.g., wine, water, etc.; Jn. 2:8, 9; 4:7, 15*

αντλημα.definition: pr. that which is drawn; a bucket, vessel for drawing water, Jn. 4:11*

αντοφθαλμεω.definition: pr. to look in the face, met. a nautical term, to bear up against the wind, Acts 27:15*

ανυδρος.definition: without water, dry, 2 Pet. 2:17; Jude 12; τόποι ἄνυδροι, dry places, and therefore, in the East, barren, desert, Mt. 12:43; Lk. 11:24*

ανυποτακτος.definition: not subjected, not made subordinate, Heb. 2:8; insubordinate, refractory, disorderly, contumacious, lawless, 1 Tim. 1:9; Tit. 1:6, 10

ανω.definition: above, Acts 2:19; Gal. 4:26; Col. 3:1; up, upwards, Jn. 11:41; ὁ, ἡ, τό, ἄνω, that which is above, Jn. 8:23; ἕως ἄνω, to the top

ανωθεν.definition: from above, from a higher place, Jn. 3:31; of time, from the first or beginning, Acts 26:5; from the source, Lk. 1:33; again, anew, Jn. 3:3, 7; Gal. 4:9; with a prep., the top or upper part, Mt. 27:51

αξιος.definition: pr. of equal value; worthy, estimable, Mt. 10:11, 13; worthy of, deserving, either good or evil, Mt. 10:10; correspondent to, Mt. 3:8; Lk. 3:8; Acts 26:20; comparable, countervailing, Rom. 8:18; suitable, due, Lk. 23:41

αξιοω.definition: to judge or esteem worthy or deserving; to deem fitting, to require, Acts 15:38; 28:22

αξιως.definition: worthily, Col. 1:10; suitably, in a manner becoming, Rom. 16:2

απαγγελλω.definition: to announce that with which a person is charged, or which is called for by circumstances; to carry back word, Mt. 2:8; to report, Mt. 8:33; to declare plainly, Heb. 2:12; to announce formally, 1 Jn. 1:2, 3

απαγχω.definition: to strangle; mid. to choke or strangle one’s self, hang one’s self, Mt. 27:5*

απαγω.definition: to lead away, Mt. 26:57; to conduct, Mt. 7:13, 14; pass. to be led off to execution, Acts 12:19; met. to be led astray, seduced, 1 Cor. 12:1

απαιρω.definition: to take away; pass. to be taken away; to be withdrawn, Mt. 9:15; Mk. 2:20; Lk. 5:35*

απαιτεω.definition: to demand, require, Lk. 12:20; to demand back, Lk. 6:30*

απαλγεω.definition: pr. to desist from grief; hence, to become insensible or callous, Eph. 4:19*

απαλλασσω.definition: to set free, deliver, set at liberty, Heb. 2:15; to rid judicially, Lk. 12:58; mid. to depart, remove, Acts 19:12*

απαλλοτριοω.definition: pass. to be alienated from, be a stranger to; alien, Eph. 2:12; 4:18; Col. 1:21*

απαντησις.definition: a meeting, encounter; εἰς ἀπάντησιν, to meet, Mt. 25:6; Acts 28:15; 1 Thess. 4:17*

απαξ.definition: once, 2 Cor. 11:25; once for all, Heb. 6:4; 9:26, 28; 10:2; 1 Pet. 3:18, 20; Jude 3; εἰδὼς ἅπαξ, knowing once for ever, unfailingly, constantly, Jude 5

απαραβατος.definition: not transient; not to be superseded, unchangeable, Heb. 7:24*

απαρνεομαι.definition: to deny, disown, Mt. 26:34; to renounce, disregard, Mt. 16:24

απαρχη.definition: pr. the first act of a sacrifice; hence, the firstfruits, first portion, firstling, Rom. 8:23

απασπαζομαι.definition: to take leave of, say farwell to, Acts 21:6*

απαταω.definition: to deceive, seduce into error, Eph. 5:6; 1 Tim. 2:14; Jas. 1:26*

απατωρ.definition: pr. without a father, fatherless; hence, independent of paternal descent, Heb. 7:3*

απειθεια.definition: an uncompliant disposition; obstinacy, disobedience, unbelief, Rom. 11:30, 32; Eph. 2:2; 5:6; Heb. 4:6, 11; Col. 3:6*

απειθεω.definition: to be uncompliant; to refuse belief, disbelieve, Jn. 3:36; to refuse belief and obedience, Rom. 10:21; 1 Pet. 3:20; to refuse conformity, Rom. 2:8

απειθης.definition: who will not be persuaded, uncompliant; disobedient, Lk. 1:17; Acts 26:19; Rom. 1:30; 2 Tim. 3:2; Tit. 1:16; 3:3

απειλεω.definition: to threaten, menace, rebuke, Acts 4:17; 1 Pet. 2:23*

απειλη.definition: threat, commination, Acts 4:29; 9:1; harshness of language, Eph. 6:9*

απειμι.definition: to go away, depart, come Acts 17:10*

g561.definition: to refuse, forbid, to renounce, disclaim, 2 Cor. 4:2*

απειραστος.definition: inexperienced, untempted, incapable of being tempted, Jas. 1:13*

απεκδεχομαι.definition: to expect, wait or look for, Rom. 8:19, 23, 25; 1 Cor. 1:7; Gal. 5:5; Phil. 3:20; Heb. 9:28

απεκδυομαι.definition: to put off, renounce, Col. 3:9; to despoil a rival, Col. 2:15*

απεκδυσις.definition: a putting or stripping off, renunciation, Col. 2:11*

απελεγμος.definition: pr. refutation; by impl. disrepute. contempt, Acts 19:27*

απελπιζω.definition: to lay aside hope, despond, despair; also, to hope for something in return, Lk. 6:35*

απεναντι.definition: some classify as an improper preposition, opposite to, over against, Mt. 27:61; contrary to, in oppositition to, against, Acts 17:7; before, in the presence of, Mt. 27:24; Rom. 3:18; Acts 3:16*

απερισπαστως.definition: without distraction, without care or solicitude, 1 Cor. 7:35*

απεριτμητος.definition: pr. uncircumcised; met. uncircumcised in respect of untowardness and obduracy, Acts 7:51*

απερχομαι.definition: to go away, depart, Mt. 8:18; to go forth, pervade, as a rumor, Mt. 4:24; to arrive at a destination, Lk. 23:33; to pass away, disappear, Rev. 21:4; ἀπέρχομαι ὀπίσω, to follow, Mk. 1:20

g567,.definition: trans. to have in full what is due or is sought, Mt. 6:2, 5, 16; Lk. 6:24; Phil. 4:18; to have altogether, Phlm. 15; hence, it is enough, Mk. 14:41; intrans. to be distant, Lk. 7:6; to be estranged, Mt. 15:8; Mk. 7:6, mid. to abstain from, Acts 14:20

απιστεω.definition: to refuse belief, be incredulous, disbelieve, Mk. 16:11, 16; Lk. 24:11, 41; Acts 28:24; to prove false, violate one’s faith, be unfaithful, Rom. 3:3; 2 Tim. 2:13

απιστια.definition: unbelief, want of trust and confidence; a state of unbelief, 1 Tim. 1:13; violation of faith, faithlessness, Rom. 3:3; Heb. 3:12, 19

απιστος.definition: unbelieving, without confidence in any one, Mt. 17:17; violating one’s faith, unfaithful, false, treacherous, Lk. 12:46; an unbeliever, infidel, pagan, 1 Cor. 6:6; pass. incredible, Acts 26:8

απλοτης.definition: simplicity, sincerity, purity of mind, Rom. 12:8; 11:3; Eph. 6:5; Col. 3:22; liberality, as arising from simplicity and frankness of character, 2 Cor. 8:2; 9:11, 13; 11:3*

απλους.definition: pr. single; hence, simple, uncompounded; sound, perfect, Mt. 6:22; Lk. 11:34*

απλως.definition: in simplicity; sincerely, really, or, liberally, bountifully, Jas. 1:5*

απο.definition: pr. forth, from, away from; hence, it variously signifies departure; distance of time or place; avoidance; riddance; derivation from a quarter, source, or material; origination from agency or instrumentality

αποβαινω.definition: to step off; to disembark from a ship, Lk. 5:2; Jn. 21:9; to become, result, happen, Lk. 21:13; Phil. 1:19*

αποβαλλω.definition: to cast or throw off, cast aside, Mk. 10:50; Heb. 10:35*

αποβλεπω.definition: pr. to look off from all other objects and at a single one; hence, to turn a steady gaze, to look with fixed and earnest attention, Heb. 11:26*

αποβλητος.definition: pr. to be cast away; met. to be condemned, regarded as vile, 1 Tim. 4:4*

αποβολη.definition: a casting off; rejection, reprobation, Rom. 11:15; loss, deprivation, of life, etc., Acts 27:22*

απογινομαι.definition: to be away from, unconnected with; to die; met. to die to a thing by renouncing it, 1 Pet. 2:24*

απογραφη.definition: a register, inventory; registration, enrollment, Lk. 2:2; Acts 5:37*

απογραφω.definition: pr. to copy; hence, to register, enrol, Lk. 2:1; Heb. 12:23; mid. to procure the registration of one’s name, to give in one’s name for registration, Lk. 2:3, 5*

αποδεικνυμι.definition: to point out, display; to prove, evince, demonstrate, Acts 25:7; to designate, proclaim, hold forth, 2 Thess. 2:4; to constitute, appoint, Acts 2:22; 1 Cor. 4:9*

αποδεκατοω.definition: to pay or give tithes of, Mt. 23:23; Lk. 11:42; 18:12; to tithe, levy tithes upon, Heb. 7:5*

αποδεχομαι.definition: to receive kindly or heartily, welcome, Lk. 8:40; 9:11; Acts 18:27; 28:30; to receive with hearty assent, embrace, Acts 2:41; to accept with satisfaction, Acts 24:3*

αποδημεω.definition: to be absent from one’s home or country; to go on travel, Mt. 21:33; 25:14, 15; Mk. 12:1; Lk. 15:13; 20:9*

αποδιδωμι.definition: to give in answer to a claim or expectation; to render a due, Mt. 12:36; 16:27; 21:41; 22:21; to recompense, Mt. 6:4, 6, 18; to discharge an obligation, Mt. 5:33; to pay a debt, Mt. 5:26; to render back, requite, Rom. 12:17; to give back, restore, Lk. 4:20; 9:42; to refund, Lk. 10:35; 19:8; mid., to sell, Acts 5:8; 7:9; Heb. 12:16; pass., to be sold, Mt. 18:25; to be given up at a request, Mt. 27:58

αποδιοριζω.definition: pr. to separate by intervening boundaries; to separate or divide, Jude 19*

αποδοκιμαζω.definition: to reject upon trial; to reject, Mt. 21:42; Mk. 12:10; Lk. 20:17; 1 Pet. 2:4, 7; pass., to be disallowed a claim, declared useless, Lk. 9:22; 17:25; Heb. 12:17

αποδοχη.definition: pr. reception, welcome; met. reception of hearty assent, 1 Tim. 1:15; 4:9*

αποθεσις.definition: a putting off or away, laying aside, a euphemism for death, 1 Pet. 3:21; 2 Pet. 1:14*

αποθηκη.definition: a place where anything is laid up for preservation, repository, granary, storehouse, barn, Mt. 3:12; 6:26; 13:30; Lk. 3:17; 12:18, 24

αποθησαυριζω.definition: pr. to lay up in store, hoard; met. to treasure up, secure, 1 Tim. 6:19*

αποθλιβω.definition: pr. to press out; to press close, press upon, crowd, Lk. 8:45*

αποθνησκω.definition: to die, Mt. 8:32; to decay, rot, as seeds, Jn. 12:24; 1 Cor. 15:36; to wither, become dry, as a tree, Jude 12; met. to die the death of final condemnation and misery, Jn. 6:50; 8:21, 24; to die to a thing by renunciation or utter separation, Rom. 6:2; 1 Cor. 15:31; Gal. 2;19; Col. 3:3

αποκαθιστημι.definition: also spelled ἀποκαθιστάνω, to restore a thing to its former place or state, Mt. 12:13; 17:11; Mk. 3:5; 8:25

αποκαλυπτω.definition: pr. uncover; to reveal, Mt. 11:25; pass. to be disclosed, Lk. 2:35; Eph. 3:5; to be plainly signified, distinctly declared, Rom. 1:17, 18; to be set forth, announced, Gal. 3:23; to be discovered in true character, 1 Cor. 3:13; to be manifested, appear, Jn. 12:38;Rom. 8:18; 2 Thess. 2:3, 6, 8; 1 Pet. 1:5; 5:1

αποκαλυψις.definition: a disclosure, revelation, Rom. 2:5; manifestation, appearance, Rom. 8:19; 1 Cor. 1:7; 2 Thess. 1:7; 1 Pet. 1:7, 13; 4:13; met. spiritual enlightenment, Lk. 2:32

αποκαραδοκια.definition: earnest expectation, eager hope, Rom. 8:19; Phil. 1:20*

αποκαταλλασσω.definition: to transfer from a certain state to another which is quite different; hence, to reconcile, restore to favor, Eph. 2:16; Col. 1:20, 22*

αποκαταστασις.definition: pr. a restitution or restoration of a thing to its former state; hence, the renovation of a new and better era, Acts 3:21*

αποκειμαι.definition: to be laid up, preserved, Lk. 19:20; to be in store, be reserved, await any one, Col. 1:5; 2 Tim. 4:8; Heb. 9:27*

αποκοπτω.definition: to cut off, Mk. 9:43, 45; Jn. 18:10, 26; Acts 27:32; to castrate, make a eunich, Gal. 5:12*

αποκρινομαι.definition: to answer, Mt. 3:15; in NT to respond to certain present circumstances, to avow, Mt. 11:25

αποκρυπτω.definition: to hide away; to conceal, withhold from sight or knowledge, Lk. 10:21; 1 Cor. 2:7; Eph. 3:9; Col. 1:26*

αποκρυφος.definition: hidden away; concealed, Mk. 4:22; Lk. 8:17; stored up, Col. 2:3*

αποκτεινω.definition: also spelled ἀποκτέννω or ἀποκτένω, to kill, Mt. 14:5; to destroy, annihilate, Mt. 10:28; to destroy a hostile principle, Eph. 2:16; met. to kill by spiritual condemnation, Rom. 7:11; 2 Cor. 3:6

αποκυεω.definition: pr. to bring forth, as women; met. to generate, produce, Jas. 1:15; to generate by spiritual birth, Jas. 1:18*

αποκυλιω.definition: to roll away, Mt. 28:2; Mk. 16:3, 4; Lk. 24:2*

απολαμβανω.definition: to receive what is due, sought, or needed, Lk. 23:41; Rom. 1:27; Gal. 4:5; Col. 3:24; 2 Jn. 8; to receive in full, Lk. 16:25; to receive back, recover, Lk. 6:34; 15:27; 18:30; mid. to take aside, lead away, Mk. 7:33

απολαυσις.definition: beneficial participation, 1 Tim. 6:17; enjoyment, pleasure, Heb. 11:25*

απολειπω.definition: to leave, leave behind; pass. to be left, remain, 2 Tim. 4:13, 20; Heb. 4:6, 9; 10:26; to relinquish, forsake, desert, Tit. 1:5; Jude 6*

απολλυμι.definition: to destroy utterly; to kill, Mt. 2:13; to bring to nought, make void, 1 Cor. 1:19; to lose, be deprived of, Mt. 10:42; to be destroyed, perish, Mt. 9:17; to be put to death, to die, Mt. 26:52; to be lost, to stray, Mt. 10:6

απολλωνια.definition: Apollonia, a city of Macedonia, Acts 17:1*. See PhotoGuide.

απολογεομαι.definition: to defend one’s self against a charge, to make a defence, Lk. 12:11; 21:14

απολουω.definition: to cleanse by bathing; mid. to cleanse one’s self; to procure one’s self to be cleansed; met., of sin, Acts 22:16; 1 Cor. 6:11*

απολυτρωσις.definition: redemption, a deliverance, procured by the payment of a ransom; meton. the author of redemption, 1 Cor. 1:30; deliverance, simply, the idea of a ransom being excluded, Lk. 21:28; Heb. 11:35

απολυω.definition: pr. to loose; to release from a tie or burden, Mt. 18:27; to divorce, Mt. 1:19; to remit, forgive, Lk. 6:37; to liberate, discharge, Mt. 27:15; to dismiss, Mt. 15:23; Acts 19:40; to allow to depart, to send away, Mt. 14:15; to permit, or, signal departure from life, Lk. 2:29; mid. to depart, Acts 28:25; pass. to be rid, Lk. 13:12

απομασσω.definition: to wipe off; mid. to wipe off one’s self, Lk. 10:11*

απονεμω.definition: to portion off; to assign, bestow, 1 Pet. 3:7*

απονιπτω.definition: to cleanse a part of the body by washing; mid., of one’s self, Mt. 27:24*

αποπιπτω.definition: to fall off or from, Acts 9:18*

αποπλαναω.definition: to cause to wander; met. to deceive, pervert, seduce, Mk. 13:22; pass. to wander; met. to swerve from, apostatize, 1 Tim. 6:10*

αποπλεω.definition: to depart by ship, sail away, Acts 13:4; 14:26; 20:15; 27:1*

αποπνιγω.definition: to choke, suffocate, Lk. 8:7; to drown, Lk. 8:33*

απορεω.definition: also spelled ἀπορρίπτω, pr. to be without means; met. to hesitate, be at a stand, be in doubt and perplexity, Jn. 13:22; Acts 25:20; 2 Cor. 4:8; Gal. 4:20

αποριπτω.definition: to throw off, throw down, Acts 27:43*

απορφανιζω.definition: lit., to make an orphan; fig., to deprive, bereave, 1 Thess. 2:17*

αποσκιασμα.definition: a shadow cast; met. a shade, the slightest trace, Jas. 1:17*

αποσπαω.definition: to draw away from; to draw out or forth, Mt. 26:51; to draw away, seduce, Acts 20:30; to separate one’s self, to part, Lk. 22:41; Acts 21:1*

αποστασια.definition: a falling away, a rebellion, apostasy, Acts 21:21; 2 Thess. 2:3*

αποστασιον.definition: defection, desertion, as of a freedman from a patron; in NT the act of putting away a wife, repudiation, divorce, Mt. 19:7; Mk. 10:4; meton. a bill of repudiation, deed of divorce, Mt. 5:31*

αποστεγαζω.definition: to remove or break through a covering or roof of a place, Mk. 2:4*

αποστελλω.definition: to send forth a messenger, agent, message, or command, Mt. 2:16; 10:5; to put forth into action, Mk. 4:29; to liberate, rid, Lk. 4:19; to dismiss, send away, Mk. 12:3

αποστερεω.definition: to deprive, detach; to debar, 1 Cor. 7:5; to deprive in a bad sense, defraud, Mk. 10:19; 1 Cor. 6:7; mid. to suffer one’s self to be deprived or defrauded, 1 Cor. 6:8; pass. to be destitute or devoid of, 1 Tim. 6:5; to be unjustly withheld, Jas. 5:4*

αποστολη.definition: a sending, expedition; office or duty of one sent as a messenger or agent; office of an apostle, apostleship, Acts 1:25; Rom. 1:5; 1 Cor. 9:2; Gal. 2:8*

αποστολος.definition: one sent as a messenger or agent, the bearer of a commission, messenger, Jn. 13:16; an apostle, Mt. 10:2

αποστοματιζω.definition: pr. to speak or repeat offhand; also, to require or lead others to speak without premeditation, as by questions calculated to elicit unpremeditated answers, to endeavor to entrap into unguarded language, Lk. 11:53*

αποστρεφω.definition: to turn away; to remove, Acts 3:26; Rom. 11:26; 2 Tim. 4:4; to turn a people from their allegiance, to their sovereign, pervert, incite to revolt, Lk. 23:14; to replace, restore, Mt. 26:52; to turn away from any one, to slight, reject, repulse, Mt. 5:42; Tit. 1:14; Heb. 12:25; to desert, 2 Tim. 1:15

αποστυγεω.definition: to shrink from with abhorrence, detest, Rom. 12:9*

αποσυναγωγος.definition: expelled or excluded from the synagogue, excommunicated, cut off from the rights and privileges of a Jew, excluded from society, Jn. 9:22; 12:42; 16:2*

αποτασσω.definition: middle: to take leave of, bid farewell to, Lk. 9:61; Acts 18:18, 21; 2 Cor. 2:13; to dismiss, send away, Mk. 6:46; fig: to renounce, forsake, Lk. 14:33

αποτελεω.definition: to complete; pass. to be perfected, to arrive at full stature or measure, Lk. 13:32; Jas. 1:15*

αποτιθημι.definition: mid: to lay off, lay down or aside, as garments, Acts 7:58; me

αποτινω.definition: to pay off what is claimed or due; to repay, refund, make good, Phlm. 19*

αποτολμαω.definition: to dare or risk outright; to speak outright, without reserve or restraint, Rom. 10:20

αποτομια.definition: pr. abruptness; met. severity, rigor, Rom. 11:22 (2x)*

αποτρεπω.definition: mid: to turn any one away from a thing; mid. to turn one’s self away from any one; to avoid, shun, 2 Tim. 3:5*

αποφερω.definition: to bear or carry away, conduct away, Mk. 15:1; Lk. 16:22; Acts 19:12; 1 Cor. 16:3; Rev. 17:3; 21:10*

αποφευγω.definition: to flee from, escape; met. to be rid, be freed from, 2 Pet. 1:4; 2:18, 20*

αποφθεγγομαι.definition: to speak out, declare, particularly solemn, weighty, or pithy sayings, Acts 2:4, 14; 26:25*

αποχρησις.definition: a using up, or, a discharge of an intended use, Col. 2:22*

αποχωρεω.definition: to go from or away, depart, Mt. 7:23; Lk. 9:39; Acts 13:13*

αποχωριζω.definition: to separate; pass. to be swept aside, Rev. 6:14; mid. to part, Acts 15:39*

αποψυχω.definition: pr. to breathe out, faint away, die; met. to faint at heart, be dismayed, Lk. 21:26*

αππιος.definition: the forum or marketplace, of Appius; a village on the Appian road, near Rome, Acts 28:15*

απροσκοπος.definition: not stumbling or jarring; met. not stumbling or jarring against moral rule, unblamable, clear, Acts 24:16; Phil. 1:10; free from offensiveness, 1 Cor. 10:32*

απροσωπολημπτως.definition: without respect of persons, impartially, 1 Pet. 1:17*

απταιστος.definition: free from stumbling; met. free from moral stumbling, offence; irreprehensible, Jude 24*

gπ681.definition: pr. to bring in contact, fit, fasten; to light, kindle, Mk. 4:21; Lk. 8:16; to touch, Mt. 8:3; to meddle, venture to partake, Col. 2:21; to have intercourse with, to know carnally, 1 Cor. 7:1; by impl. to harm, 1 Jn. 5:18

απωθεω.definition: to thrust away, repel from one’s self, repulse, Acts 7:27; to refuse, reject, cast off, Acts 7:39; 13:46; Rom. 11:1, 2; 1 Tim. 1:19*

απωλεια.definition: consumption, destruction; waste, profusion, Mt. 26:8; Mk. 14:4; destruction, state of being destroyed, Acts 25:6; eternal ruin, perdition, Mt. 7:13; Acts 8:20

αρα.definition: inferential particle, used mainly in interrogations, Lk. 18:8; Acts 8:30; Gal. 2:17*

αργεω.definition: pr. to be unemployed; to be inoperative, to linger, 2 Pet. 2:3*

αργος.definition: pr. inactive, unemployed, Mt. 20:3, 6; idle, averse from labor, 1 Tim. 5:13; Tit. 1:12; met. 2 Pet. 1:8; unprofitable, hollow, or by impl., injurious, Mt. 12:36; Jas. 2:20*

αργυροκοπος.definition: a forger of silver, silversmith, Acts 19:24*

αργυρος.definition: silver; meton. anything made of silver; money, Jas. 5:3

αργυρους.definition: made of silver, Acts 19:24; 2 Tim. 2:20; Rev. 9:20*

αρεοπαγιτης.definition: a judge of the court of Areopagus, Acts 17:34*

αρεσκεια.definition: a pleasing, desire of pleasing, Col. 1:10*

αρεσκω.definition: to please, Mt. 14:6; to be pleasing, acceptable, Acts 6:5; to consult the pleasure of any one, Rom. 15:1, 2, 3; 1 Cor. 10:33; to seek favor with, Gal. 1:10; 1 Thess. 2:4

αρεστος.definition: pleasing, acceptable, Acts 12:3; 1 Jn. 3:22; 8:29, deemed proper, Acts 6:2

αρετη.definition: goodness, good quality of any kind; a gracious act of God, 1 Pet. 2:9; 2 Pet. 1:3; virtue, uprightness, Phil. 4:8; 2 Pet. 1:5*

αριμαθαια.definition: Arimathea, a town of Palestine, Mt. 27:57; Mk. 15:43; Lk. 23:51; Jn. 19:38*. See PhotoGuide.

αρισταρχος.definition: Aristarchus, pr. name, Acts 19:29; 20:4; 27:2; Col. 4:10; Phlm. 24*

αρισταω.definition: to take the first meal, breakfast, Jn. 21:12, 15; also, to take a mid-day meal, Lk. 11:37*

αριστερος.definition: the left hand, Mt. 6:3; so ἐξ ἀριστερῶν, i.e. μερῶν, Lk. 23:33; 2 Cor. 6:7; Mk. 10:37*

αριστον.definition: pr. the first meal, breakfast; afterwards extended to signify also a slight mid-day meal, luncheon, Mt. 22:4; Lk. 11:38; 14:12*

αρκεω.definition: pr. to ward off; thence; to be of service, avail; to suffice, be enough, Mt. 25:9; pass. to be contented, satisfied, Lk. 3:14; 1 Tim. 6:8; Heb. 13:5; 3 Jn. 10

αρκος.definition: also spelled ἄρκτος, a bear, Rev. 13:2*

αρμοζω.definition: to fit together; to join, unite, in marriage, espouse, betroth, 2 Cor. 11:2*

αρμος.definition: a joint or articulation of the bones, Heb. 4:12*

αρνεομαι.definition: to deny, disclaim, disown, Mt. 10:33; to renounce, Tit. 2:12; to decline, refuse, Heb. 11:24; absol. to deny, contradict, Lk. 8:15

αρνιον.definition: a young lamb, lamb, Jn. 21:15; Rev. 5:6, 8

αρπαγη.definition: plunder, pillage; the act of plundering, Heb. 10:34; prey, spoil, Mt. 23:25; Lk. 11:39*

αρπαγμος.definition: eager seizure; in NT, a thing retained with an eager grasp, or eagerly claimed and conspicuously exercised, Phil. 2:6*

αρπαζω.definition: to seize, as a wild beast, Jn. 10:12; take away by force, snatch away, Mt. 13:19; Jn. 10:28, 29; Acts 23:10; Jude 23; met. to seize on with avidity, eagerly, appropriate, Mt. 11:12; to convey away suddenly, transport hastily, Jn. 6:15

αρπαξ.definition: pr. raveneous, ravening, as a wild beast, Mt. 7:15; met. rapacious, given to extortion and robbery, an extortioner, Lk. 18:11; 1 Cor. 5:10, 11; 6:10*

αρρητος.definition: pr. not spoken; what ought not to be spoken, secret; which cannot be spoken or uttered, 2 Cor. 12:4*

αρρωστος.definition: ill, sick, an invalid, Mt. 14:14; Mk. 6:5, 13; 16:18; 1 Cor. 11:30

αρσενοκοιτης.definition: a male engaging in same-gender sexual activity, a sodomite, pedarest, 1 Cor. 6:9; 1 Tim. 1:10*

αρσην.definition: male, of the male sex, Mt. 19:4; Mk. 10:6; Lk. 2:23; Rom. 1:27; Gal. 3:28; Rev. 12:5, 13*

αρτεμων.definition: a topsail, foresail; or, according to others, the dolon of Pliny and Pollux, a small sail near the bow of the ship, which was hoisted when the wind was too strong to use the larger sails, Acts 27:40*

αρτι.definition: pr. at the present moment, close upon it either before of after; now, at the present juncture, Mt. 3:15; forthwith, presently; just now, recently, 1 Thess. 3:6; ἕως ἄρτι, until now, hitherto, Mt. 11:12; Jn. 2:10; ἀπ’ ἄρτι, or ἀπάρτι, from this time, henceforth, Mt. 23:39

αρτιος.definition: entirely suited; complete in accomplishment, ready, 2 Tim. 3:17*

αρτος.definition: bread; a loaf or thin cake of bread, Mt. 26:26; food, Mt. 15:2; Mk. 3:20; bread, maintenance, living, necessaries of life, Mt. 6:11; Lk. 11:3; 2 Thess. 3:8

αρτυω.definition: pr. to fit, prepare; to season, make savoury, Mk. 9:50; Lk. 14:34; Col. 4:6*

αρχαγγελος.definition: an archangel, chief angel, 1 Thess. 4:16; Jude 9*

αρχαιος.definition: old, ancient, of former age, Mt. 5:21, 33; of long standing, old, veteran, Acts 21:16; ἀφ’ ἡμερῶν ἀρχαίων, from early days, from an early period, of the Gospel, Acts 15:7

αρχη.definition: a beginning, Mt. 24:8; an extremity, corner, or, an attached cord, Acts 10:11; 11:5; first place, headship; high estate, eminence, Jude 6; authority, Lk. 20:20; an authority, magistrate, Lk. 12:11; a principality, prince, of spiritual existence, Eph. 3:10; 6:12; ἀπ’ ἀρχῆς, ἐξ ἀρχῆς, from the first, originally, Mt. 19:4, 8; Lk. 1:2; Jn. 6:64; 2 Thess. 2:13; 1 Jn. 1:1; 2:7; ἐν ἀρχῇ, κατ’ ἀρχάς, in the beginning of things, Jn. 1:1, 2; Heb. 1:10; ἐν ἀρχῇ, at the first, Acts 11:15; τὴν ἀρχήν, used adverbially, wholly, altogether, Jn. 8:25

αρχηγος.definition: a chief, leader, prince, Acts 5:31; a prime author, Acts 3:15; Heb. 2:10; 12:2*

αρχιερατικος.definition: belonging to or connected with the high-priest or his office, Acts 4:6*

αρχιππος.definition: Archippus, pr. name, Col. 4:17; Phlm. 2, inscr. and subscr.*

αρχισυναγωγος.definition: a president or moderating elder of a synagogue, Mk. 5:22, 35, 36, 38; Lk. 8:49

αρχιτελωνης.definition: a chief publican, chief collector of the customs or taxes, Lk. 19:2*

g757.definition: (1) pr. (act.) to be first; to rule, Mk. 10:42; Rom. 15:12 (2) mid. to begin, Mt. 4:17; to take commencement, Lk. 24:27; 1 Pet. 4:17

αρχων.definition: one invested with power and dignity, chief, ruler, prince, magistrate, Mt. 9:23; 20:25

αρωμα.definition: an aromatic substance, spice, etc., Mk. 16:1; Lk. 23:56; 24:1; Jn. 19:40*

ασαλευτος.definition: unshaken, immovable, Acts 27:41; met. firm, stable, enduring, Heb. 12:28*

ασβεστος.definition: unquenched; inextinguishable, unquenchable, Mt. 3:12; Mk. 9:43; Lk. 3:17*

ασεβεια.definition: impiety, ungodliness; dishonesty, wickedness, Rom. 1:18; 11:26; 2 Tim. 2:16; Tit. 2:12; Jude 15, 18*

ασεβεω.definition: to be impious, to act impiously or wickedly, live an impious life, 2 Pet. 2:6; Jude 15*

ασελγεια.definition: intemperance; licentiousness, lasciviousness, Rom. 13:13; insolence, outrageous behavior, Mk. 7:22

ασημος.definition: pr. not marked; met. not noted, not remarkable, unknown to fame, ignoble, mean, inconsiderable, Acts 21:39*

ασηρ.definition: Asher, pr. name, indecl. (Gen. 30:13; 49:20; 2 Chr. 30:11) Lk. 2:36; Rev. 7:6*

ασθενεια.definition: want of strength, weakness, feebleness, 1 Cor. 15:43; bodily infirmity, state of ill health, sickness, Mt. 8:17; Lk. 5:15; met. infirmity, frailty, imperfection, intellectual and moral, Rom. 6:19; 1 Cor. 2:3; Heb. 5:2; 7:28; suffering, affliction, distress, calamity, Rom. 8:26

ασθενεω.definition: to be weak, infirm, deficient in strength; to be inefficient, Rom. 8:3; 2 Cor. 13:3; to be sick, Mt. 25:36; met. to be weak in faith, to doubt, hesitate, be unsettled, timid, Rom. 14:1; 1 Cor. 8:9, 11, 12; 2 Cor. 11:29; to be deficient in authority, dignity, or power, be contemptible, 2 Cor. 11:21; 13:3, 9; to be afflicted, distressed, needy, Acts 20:35; 2 Cor. 12:10; 13:4, 9

ασθενημα.definition: pr. weakness, infirmity, met. doubt, hesitation, Rom. 15:1*

ασθενης.definition: without strength, weak, infirm, Mt. 26:41; Mk. 14:38; 1 Pet. 3:7; helpless, Rom. 5:6; imperfect, inefficient, Gal. 4:9; feeble, without energy, 2 Cor. 10:10; infirm in body, sick, sickly, Mt. 25:39, 43, 44; weak, mentally or spiritually, dubious, hesitating, 1 Cor. 8:7, 10; 9:22; 1 Thess. 5:14; afflicted, distressed, oppressed with calamities, 1 Cor. 4:10

ασιανος.definition: belonging to the Roman province of Asia, Acts 20:4*

ασιαρχης.definition: an Asiarch, an officer in the province of Asia, as in other eastern provinces of the Roman empire, selected, with others, from the more opulent citizens, to preside over the things pertaining to religious worship, and to exhibit annual public games at their own expense in honor of the gods, in the manner of the aediles at Rome, Acts 19:31*

ασκεω.definition: pr. to work materials; absol. to train or exert one’s self, make endeavor, Acts 24:16*

ασκος.definition: a leather bag or bottle, bottle of skin, Mt. 9:17; Mk. 2:22; Lk. 5:37, 38

ασοφος.definition: unwise; destitute of Christian wisdom, Eph. 5:15*

ασπαζομαι.definition: to salute, greet, welcome, express good wishes, pay respects, Mt. 10:12; Mk. 9:15, et al. freq.; to bid farewell, Acts 20:1; 21:6; to treat with affection, Mt. 5:47; met. to embrace mentally, welcome to the heart of understanding, Heb. 11:13

ασπιλος.definition: spotless, unblemished, pure, 1 Tim. 6:14; Jas. 1:27; 1 Pet. 1:19; 2 Pet. 3:14*

ασπις.definition: an asp, a species of serpent of the most deadly venom, Rom. 3:13*

ασπονδος.definition: pr. unwilling to make a treaty; hence, implacable, irreconcilable, 2 Tim. 3:3*

ασσαριον.definition: dimin. of the Latin, as, a Roman brass coin with the value of one-tenth of a denarius, or δραχμή, used to convey the idea of a trifle or very small sum, Mt. 10:29; Lk. 12:6*

ασσον.definition: nearer; very nigh, close; used as the compar. of ἄγχι, Acts 27:13*

ασσος.definition: Assos, a maritime city of Mysia, in Asia Minor, Acts 20:13-14*

αστατεω.definition: to be unsettled, to be a wanderer, be homeless, 1 Cor. 4:11*

αστειος.definition: pr. belonging to a city; well bred, polite, polished; hence, elegant, fair, comely, beautiful, Acts 7:20; Heb. 11:23*

αστηρ.definition: a star, luminous body like a star, luminary, Mt. 2:2, 7, 9, 10; Rev. 1:16

αστηρικτος.definition: not made firm; unsettled, unstable, unsteady, 2 Pet. 2:14; 3:16*

αστοργος.definition: devoid of natural or instinctive affection, without affection to kindred, Rom. 1:31; 2 Tim. 3:3*

αστοχεω.definition: pr. to miss the mark; met. to err, deviate, swerve from, 1 Tim. 1:6; 6:21; 2 Tim. 2:18*

αστραπτω.definition: to lighten, flash as lightning, Lk. 17:24; to be bright, shining, Lk. 24:4*

αστρον.definition: a constellation; a star, Lk. 21:25; Acts 7:43; 27:20; Heb. 11:12*

ασυμφωνος.definition: discordant in sound; met. discordant, at difference, Acts 28:25*

ασυνετος.definition: unintelligent, dull, Mt. 15:16; Mk. 7:18; reckless, perverse, Rom. 1:21, 31; unenlightened, heathenish, Rom. 10:19

ασυνθετος.definition: unable to be trusted, undutiful, Rom. 1:31*

ασφαλεια.definition: pr. state of security from falling, firmness; safety, security, 1 Thess. 5:3; certainty, truth, Lk. 1:4; means of security, Acts 5:23*

ασφαλης.definition: pr. firm, secure from falling; firm, sure, steady, immovable, Heb. 6:19; met. certain, sure, Acts 21:34; 22:30; 25:26; safe, making secure, Phil. 3:1*

ασφαλιζω.definition: mid: to make fast, safe, or secure, Mt. 27:64, 65, 66; Acts 16:24*

ασφαλως.definition: securely, safely; without fail, safely, Mk. 14:44; Acts 16:23; certainly, assuredly, Acts 2:36*

ασχημονεω.definition: to behave in an unbecoming manner or indecorously, 1 Cor. 13:5; to behave in a manner open to censure, 1 Cor. 7:36*

ασχημοσυνη.definition: pr. external indecorum; nakedness, shame, pudenda, Rev. 16:15; indecency, infamous lust or lewdness, Rom. 1:27*

ατακτεω.definition: pr. to infringe military order; met. to be irregular, behave disorderly, to be lazy, 2 Thess. 3:7*

ατακτος.definition: pr. used of soldiers, disorderly; met. irregular in conduct, disorderly, lazy, 1 Thess. 5:14*

ατενιζω.definition: to fix one’s eyes upon, look steadily, gaze intently, Lk. 4:20

ατερ.definition: improper prep with the gen., without, Lk. 22:6, 35*

ατιμαζω.definition: also spelled ἀτιμάω and ἀντιμόω, to dishonor, slight, Jn. 8:49; Rom. 2:23; Jas. 2:6; to treat with indignity, Mk. 12:4; Lk. 20:11; Acts 5:41; to abuse, debase, Rom. 1:24*

ατιμια.definition: dishonor, infamy, Rom. 1:26; shame, 1 Cor. 11:14; meanness, vileness, 1 Cor. 15:43; 2 Cor. 6:8; a dishonorable use, Rom. 9:21; 2 Tim. 2:20; κατὰ ἀτιμίαν, slightingly, disparagingly, 2 Cor. 11:21

ατιμος.definition: unhonored, without honor, Mt. 13:57; Mk. 6:4; despised, 1 Cor. 4:10; 12:23*

ατμις.definition: an exhalation, vapor, smoke, Acts 2:19; Jas. 4:14*

ατομος.definition: indivisible, and by impl. exceedingly minute; ἐν ἀτόμῳ, i.e. χρόνῳ, in an indivisible point of time, in an instant or moment, 1 Cor. 15:52*

ατοπος.definition: pr. out of place; inopportune, unsuitable, absurd; new, unusual, strange; in NT improper, amiss, wicked, Lk. 23:41; Acts 25:5; 2 Thess. 3:2; noxious, harmful, Acts 28:6*

ατταλεια.definition: Attalia, a city of Pamphylia, Acts 14:25*. See PhotoGuide.

αυγαζω.definition: to see distinctly, discern, or possibly to shine, give light at 2 Cor. 4:4*

αυθαδης.definition: one who pleases himself, willful, obstinate; arrogant, stubborn, Tit. 1:7; 2 Pet. 2:10*

αυθαιρετος.definition: pr. one who chooses his own course of action; acting spontaneously, of one’s own accord, 2 Cor. 8:3, 17*

αυθεντεω.definition: to have authority over, domineer, 1 Tim. 2:12*

αυλεω.definition: to play on a pipe or flute, pipe, Mt. 11:17; Lk. 7:32; 1 Cor. 14:7*

αυλη.definition: pr. an unroofed enclosure; court-yard; sheepfold, Jn. 10:1, 16; an exterior court, i.q. προαύλιον, an enclosed place between the door and the street, Rev. 11:2; an interior court, quadrangle, the open court in the middle of Oriental houses, which are commonly built in the form of a square enclosing this court, Mt. 26:58, 69; by synec. a house, mansion, palace, Mt. 26:3; Lk. 11:21

αυλητης.definition: a player on a pipe or flute, Mt. 9:23; Rev. 18:22*

αυλιζομαι.definition: pr. to pass the time in a court-yard; to lodge; hence, to pass the night in any place, to lodge at night, pass or remain through the night, Mt. 21:17; Lk. 21:37*

αυξανω.definition: also spelled αὔξω, trans. to cause to grow or increase; pass. to be increased, enlarged, Mt. 13:32; 1 Cor. 3:6, 7; intrans. to increase, grow, Mt. 6:28; Mk. 4:8

αυριον.definition: tomorrow, Mt. 6:30; ἡ αὔριον, i.e. ἡμέρα, the next day, Mt. 6:34

αυστηρος.definition: pr. harsh, sour in flavor; met. harsh, rigid, ungenerous, Lk. 19:21, 22*

αυταρκεια.definition: a competence of the necessaries of life, 2 Cor. 9:8; a frame of mind viewing one’s lot as sufficient, contentedness, 1 Tim. 6:6*

αυταρκης.definition: pr. sufficient or adequate in one’s self; contented with one’s lot, Phil. 4:11*

αυτοματος.definition: self-excited, acting spontaneously, spontaneous, of his own accord, Mk. 4:8; Acts 12:10*

g847,.definition: self, very; alone, Mk. 6:31; 2 Cor. 12:13; of one’s self, of one’s own motion, Jn. 16:27; used also in the oblique cases independently as a personal pron. of the third person; ὁ αὐτός, the same; unchangeable, Heb. 1:12; κατὰ τὸ αὐτό, at the same time, together, Acts 14:1; ἐπὶ τὸ αὐτό, in one and the same place, Mt. 22:34; at the same time, together, Acts 3:1

αυτοφωρος.definition: pr. caught in the act of theft, Jn. 8:4*

αυτοχειρ.definition: acting or doing anything with one’s own hands, Acts 27:19*

αυχμηρος.definition: squalid, filthy; by impl. dark, obscure, murky, 2 Pet. 1:19*

αφαιρεω.definition: to take away, remove, Lk. 1:25; 10:42; to take off, cut off, remove by cutting off, Mt. 26:15; Mk. 14:47; Lk. 22:50

αφανης.definition: out of sight; not manifest, hidden, concealed, Heb. 4:13*

αφανιζω.definition: to remove out of sight, cause to disappear; pass. to disappear, vanish, Jas. 4:14; by impl. to destroy, consume, so that nothing shall be left visible, Mt. 6:19, 20; met. to spoil, deform, disfigure, Mt. 6:16; to perish, Acts 13:41*

αφανισμος.definition: a disappearing, vanishing away; met. destruction, abolition, abrogation, Heb. 8:13*

αφαντος.definition: not appearing, not seen, invisible; hence, ἄφαντος γενέσθαι, to disappear, vanish, Lk. 24:31*

αφειδια.definition: pr. the disposition of one who is ἀφειδής, unsparing; hence, in NT unsparingness in the way of rigorous treatment, non-indulgence, Col. 2:23*

αφεσις.definition: dismission, deliverance, from captivity, Lk. 4:18 (2x); remission, forgiveness, pardon, Mt. 26:28

αφη.definition: a fastening; a ligament, by which the different members are connected, commissure, joint, Eph. 4:16; Col. 2:19*

αφθαρσια.definition: incorruptibility, 1 Cor. 15:42, 53, 54; immortality, Rom. 2:7; 2 Tim. 1:10; soundness, purity; ἐν ἀφθαρσίᾳ, purely, sincerely or constantly, unfailingly, Eph. 6:24

αφθαρτος.definition: incorruptible, immortal, imperishable, undying, enduring, Rom. 1:23; 1 Cor. 9:25; 15:52

αφθορια.definition: pr. incapability of decay; met. incorruptness, integrity, genuineness, purity, Tit. 2:7*

αφιημι.definition: to send away, dismiss, suffer to depart; to emit, send forth; τὴν φωνήν, the voice, to cry out, utter an exclamation, Mk. 15:37; τὸ πνεῦμα, the spirit, to expire, Mt. 27:50; to omit, pass over or by; to let alone, care not for, Mt. 15:14; 23:23; Heb. 6:1; to permit, suffer, let, forbid not; to give up, yield, resign, Mt. 5:40; to remit, forgive, pardon; to relax, suffer to become less intense, Rev. 2:4; to leave, depart from; to desert, forsake; to leave remaining or alone; to leave behind, i.e. at one’s death, Mk. 12:19, 20, 21, 22; Jn. 14:27

αφικνεομαι.definition: to come, arrive at; to reach as a report, Rom. 16:19*

αφιλαγαθος.definition: not a lover of good and good men, 2 Tim. 3:3*

αφιλαργυρος.definition: not fond of money, not covetous, generous, 1 Tim. 3:3; Heb. 13:5*

αφιστημι.definition: trans. to put away, separate; to draw off or away, withdraw, induce to revolt, Acts 5:37; intrans., and mid., to depart, go away from, Lk. 2:37; met. to desist or refrain from, let alone, Acts 5:38; 22:29; 2 Cor. 12:8; to make defection, fall away, apostatize, Lk. 8:13; 1 Tim. 4:1; Heb. 3:12; to withdraw from, have no intercourse with, 1 Tim. 6:5; to abstain from, 2 Tim. 2:19

αφοβως.definition: fearlessly, boldly, intrepidly, Phil. 1:14; securely, peacefully, tranquilly, Lk. 1:74; 1 Cor. 16:10; boldly, shamelessly, Jude 12*

αφομοιοω.definition: to assimilate, cause to resemble, Heb. 7:3*

g872.definition: to view with undivided attention by looking away from every other object; to regard fixedly and earnestly, Heb. 12:2; to see distinctly, Phil. 2:23*

αφοριζω.definition: to limit off; to separate, sever from the rest, Mt. 13:49; to separate from society, cut off from all intercourse, excommunicate, Lk. 6:22; to set apart, select, Acts 13:2; Rom. 1:1; Gal. 1:15

αφορμη.definition: pr. a starting point; means to accomplish an object; occasion, opportunity, Rom. 7:8, 11

αφροσυνη.definition: inconsiderateness, folly; boastful folly, 2 Cor. 11:1, 17, 21; in NT foolishness, levity, wickedness, impiety, Mk. 7:22*

αφρων.definition: unwise, inconsiderate, simple, foolish, Lk. 11:40; 12:20; 1 Cor. 15:36; ignorant, religiously unenlightened, Rom. 2:20; Eph. 5:17; 1 Pet. 2:15; boastfully foolish, vain, 2 Cor. 11:16, 19

αφυπνοω.definition: to awake from sleep; in NT to go off into sleep, fall asleep, Lk. 8:23*

αφωνος.definition: dumb, destitute of the power of speech, 1 Cor. 12:2; 2 Pet. 2:16; silent, mute, uttering no voice, Acts 8:32; inarticulate, consisting of inarticulate sounds, unmeaning, 1 Cor. 14:10*

αχαια.definition: Achaia, the Roman province, comprehending all Greece to the south of Thessaly

αχειροποιητος.definition: not made with hands, Mk. 14:58; 2 Cor. 5:1; Col. 2:11*

αχλυς.definition: a mist; darkening, dimness, of the sight, Acts 13:11*

αχρειος.definition: useless, unprofitable, worthless, Mt. 25:30; unmeritorious, Lk. 17:10*

αχρειοω.definition: also ἀχρεόω, pass., to render useless; met., to become corrupt, depraved, Rom. 3:12*

αχρηστος.definition: unuseful, useless, unprofitable, and by impl. detrimental, causing loss, Phlm. 11*

αχρι.definition: improper prep with the gen., also functioning as a conj, also spelled ἄχρις (Gal. 3:19; Heb. 3:13; Rev. 2:25), with respect to place, as far as; to time, until, during; as a conj., until

αχυρον.definition: chaff, straw broken up by treading out the grain, Mt. 3:12; Lk. 3:17*

αψευδης.definition: free from falsehood; incapable of falsehood, Tit. 1:2*

αψυχος.definition: void of life or sense, inanimate, 1 Cor. 14:7*

βααλ.definition: Baal, (Hebrew for Master) pr. name, indecl., Rom. 11:4*

βαθμος.definition: pr. a step, stair; met. grade of dignity, degree, rank, standing, 1 Tim. 3:13*

βαθος.definition: depth; τὸ βάθος, deep water, Lk. 5:4; Mt. 13:5; met. fullness, abundance, immensity, Rom. 11:33; an extreme degree, 2 Cor. 8:2; pl. profundities, deep-laid plans, 1 Cor. 2:10; Rev. 2:24

βαθυς.definition: deep, Jn. 4:11; met. deep, profound, Acts 20:9; Rev. 2:24; ὄρθρου βαθέος, lit. at deep morning twilight, at the earliest dawn, Lk. 24:1*

βαλλαντιον.definition: also spelled βαλάντιον, a bag, purse, Lk. 10:4; 12:33; 22:35, 36*

βαλλω.definition: pluperfect, ἐβεβλήμην, to throw, cast; to lay, Rev. 2:22; Mt. 8:6, 14; to put, place, Jas. 3:3; to place, deposit, Mt. 27:6; Mk. 12:41-44; Lk. 21:1-4; Jn. 12:6; to pour, Jn. 13:5; to thrust, Jn. 18:11; 20:27; Mk. 7:33; Rev. 14:19; to send forth, Mt. 10:34; to assault, strike, Mk. 14:65; met. to suggest, Jn. 13:2; intrans. to rush, beat, as the wind, Acts 27:14

βαπτιζω.definition: pr. to dip, immerse; to cleanse or purify by washing; to administer the rite of baptism, to baptize; met. with various reference to the ideas associated with Christian baptism as an act of dedication, e.g. marked designation, devotion, trial, etc.; mid. to procure baptism for one’s self, to undergo baptism, Acts 22:16

βαπτισμα.definition: pr. immersion; baptism, ordinance of baptism, Mt. 3:7; Rom. 6:4; met. baptism in the trial of suffering, Mt. 20:22, 23; Mk. 10:38, 39

βαπτισμος.definition: pr. an act of dipping or immersion: a baptism, Col. 2:12; Heb. 6:2; an ablution, Mk. 7:4; Heb. 9:10*

βαπτιστης.definition: one who baptizes, a baptist, Mt. 3:1; 11:11, 12

βαπτω.definition: to dip, Jn. 13:26; Lk. 16:24; to dye, Rev. 19:13*

βαρβαρος.definition: pr. one to whom a pure Greek dialect is not native; one who is not a proper Greek, a barbarian, Rom. 1:14; Col. 3:11; Acts 28:2, 4; a foreigner speaking a strange language, 1 Cor. 14:11*

βαρεω.definition: to be heavy upon, weigh down, burden, oppress, as sleep, Mt. 26:43; Mk. 14:40; Lk. 9:32; calamities, 2 Cor. 1:8; 5:4; or, trouble, care, expense, etc. 1 Tim. 5:16*

βαρεως.definition: heavily; met. with difficulty, dully, stupidly, Mt. 13:15; Acts 28:27*

βαριωνα.definition: also Βὰρ Ἰωνᾶ or Βαριωνᾶς, Bar-jona, pr. name, Mt. 16:17*

βαρος.definition: weight, heaviness; a burden, anything grievous and hard to be borne, Mt. 20:12; Acts 15:28; Gal. 6:2; Rev. 2:24; burden, charge or weight, influence, dignity, honor, 1 Thess. 2:7; with another noun in government, fulness, abundance, excellence, 2 Cor. 4:17*

βαρσαββας.definition: Bar-sabas, pr. name (1) Joseph, surnamed Justus, Acts 1:23 (2) Judas, Acts 15:22*

βαρυς.definition: heavy; met. burdensome, oppressive or difficult of observance, as precepts, Mt. 23:4; 1 Jn. 5:3; weighty, important, momentous, Mt. 23:23; Acts 25:7; grievous, oppressive, afflictive, violent, Acts 20:29; authoritative, strict, stern, severe, 2 Cor. 10:10*
