εκκλαω.definition: to break off, pass., be broken, Rom. 11:17, 19, 20*

εκκλειω.definition: to shut out, exclude; to shut of, separate, insulate; Gal. 4:17; to leave no place for, eliminate, Rom. 3:27*

εκκλησια.definition: a popular assembly, Acts 19:32, 39, 41; in NT the congregation of the children of Israel, Acts 7:38; transferred to the Christian body, of which the congregation of Israel was a figure, the Church, 1 Cor. 12:28; Col. 1:18; a local portion of the Church, a local church, Rom. 16:1; a Christian congregation, 1 Cor. 14:4

εκκλινω.definition: to deflect, deviate, Rom. 3:12; to decline or turn away from, avoid, Rom. 16:17; 1 Pet. 3:11

εκκολυμβαω.definition: to swim out to land, Acts 27:42*

εκκομιζω.definition: to carry out, bring out; especially, to carry out a corpse for burial, Lk. 7:12*

εκκοπτω.definition: to cut out; to cut off, Mt. 3:10; 5:30; met. to cut off an occasion, remove, prevent, 2 Cor. 11:12; to render ineffectual, Mt. 7:19; 18:8; Lk. 3:9; 12:7, 9; Rom. 11:22, 24; 1 Pet. 3:7*

εκκρεμαννυμι.definition: mid., to hang upon a speaker, fondly listen to, be earnestly attentive, Lk. 19:48*

εκλαλεω.definition: to speak out; to tell, utter, divulge, Acts 23:22*

εκλαμπω.definition: to shine out or forth, Mt. 13:43*

εκλανθανομαι.definition: to make to forget; to forget entirely, Heb. 12:5*

εκλεγομαι.definition: to pick out; in NT to choose, select, Lk. 6:13; 10:42; in NT to choose out as the recipients of special favor and privilege, Acts 13:17; 1 Cor. 1:27

εκλειπω.definition: to fail, die out, Lk. 22:32; to come to an end, Heb. 1:12; to be defunct, Lk. 16:9; 23:45*

εκλεκτος.definition: chosen out, selected; in NT chosen as a recipient of special privilege, elect, Col. 3:12; specially beloved, Lk. 23:35; possessed of prime excellence, exalted, 1 Tim. 5:21; choice, precious, 1 Pet. 2:4, 6

εκλογη.definition: the act of choosing out, election; in NT election to privilege by divine grace, Rom. 9:11; 11:5, 28; 1 Thess. 1:4; 2 Pet. 1:10; ἡ ἐκλογή, the elect, Rom. 11:7; ἐκλογῆς, equivalent to ἐκλεκτόν, by Hebraism, Acts 9:15*

εκλυω.definition: to be weary, exhausted, faint, Mt. 15:32; Mk. 8:3; Gal. 6:9; to lose courage, to faint, Heb. 12:3, 5*

εκμασσω.definition: to wipe off; to wipe dry, Lk. 7:38, 44; Jn. 11:2; 12:3; 13:5*

εκμυκτηριζω.definition: to mock, deride, scoff at, Lk. 16:14; 23:35*

εκνευω.definition: pr. to swim out, to escape by swimming; hence, generally, to escape, get clear of a place, Jn. 5:13; though ἐκνεύσας, in this place, may be referred to ἐκνεύω, to deviate, withdraw*

εκνηφω.definition: pr. to awake sober after intoxication; met. to shake off mental bewilderment, to wake up from delusion and folly, 1 Cor. 15:34*

εκπειραζω.definition: to tempt, put to the test, Mt. 4:7; Lk. 4:12; 1 Cor. 10:9; to try, sound, Lk. 10:25*

εκπεμπω.definition: to send out, or away, Acts 13:4; 17:10*

εκπεταννυμι.definition: pluperfect, ἐκπεπετάκειν, to stretch forth, expand, extend, Rom. 10:21*

εκπηδαω.definition: to leap forth, rush out, Acts 14:14*

εκπιπτω.definition: to fall off or from, Acts 12:7; 27:32; met. to fall from, forfeit, lose, Gal. 5:4; 2 Pet. 3:17; to be cast ashore, Acts 27:17, 26, 29; to fall to the ground, be fruitless, ineffectual, Rom. 9:6; to cease, come to an end, Jas. 1:11; 1 Pet. 1:24*

εκπλεω.definition: to sail out of or from a place, Acts 15:39; 18:18; 20:6*

εκπληροω.definition: to fill out, complete, fill up; met. to fulfil, perform, accomplish, Acts 13:33*

εκπληρωσις.definition: pr. a filling up, completion; hence, a fulfilling, accomplishment, Acts 21:26*

εκπλησσω.definition: pr. to strike out of; hence, to strike out of one’s wits, to astound, amaze; pass., overwhelmed, Mt. 7:28; 13:54

εκπνεω.definition: to breathe out; to expire, die, Mk. 15:37, 39; Lk. 23:46*

εκπορευομαι.definition: to go from or out of a place, depart from, Mk. 11:19; 13:1; to be voided, Mk. 7:19; to be cast out, Mt. 17:21; to proceed from, be spoken, Mt. 4:4; 15:11; to burst forth, Rev. 4:5; to be spread abroad, Lk. 4:37; to flow out, Rev. 22:1; from the Hebrew, ἐκπορεύομαι καὶ εἰσπορεύομαι. see εἰσέρχομαι, Acts 9:28

εκπορνευω.definition: to be given to fornication, indulge in immorality, Jude 7*

εκπτυω.definition: lit., to spit out; met. to reject, Gal. 4:14*

εκριζοω.definition: to root up, eradicate, pull out by the roots, Mt. 13:29; 15:13; Lk. 17:6; Jude 12*

εκστασις.definition: pr. a displacement; hence, a displacement of the mind from its ordinary state and self-possession; amazement, astonishment, Mk. 5:42; excess of fear; fear, terror, Mk. 16:8; Lk. 5:26; Acts 3:10; in NT an ecstasy, a trance, Acts 10:10; 11:5; 22:17*

εκστρεφω.definition: pr. to turn out of, to turn inside out; hence, to change entirely; in NT pass. to be perverted, Tit. 3:11*

εκταρασσω.definition: to disturb, disquiet, throw into confusion, Acts 16:20*

εκτεινω.definition: to stretch out, Mt. 8:3; 12:13; to lay hands on any one, Lk. 22:53; to exert power and energy, Acts 4:30; to cast out, let down an anchor, Acts 27:30

εκτελεω.definition: to bring to an end, to finish, complete, Lk. 14:29, 30*

εκτενεια.definition: pr. extension; in NT intenseness, intentness; ἐν ἐκτενείᾳ, intently, perseverance, earnestness, Acts 26:7*

εκτενης.definition: pr. extended; met. intense, earnest, fervent, eager, 1 Pet. 4:8*

g1619.definition: intensely, fervently, earnestly, Lk. 22:44; Acts 12:5; 1 Pet. 1:22*

εκτιθημι.definition: pr. to place outside, put forth; to expose an infant, Acts 7:21; met. to set forth, declare, explain, Acts 11:4; 18:26; 28:23*

εκτινασσω.definition: to shake out, shake off, Mt. 10:14; Mk. 6:11; Acts 13:51; 18:6*

εκτρεπω.definition: mid. and pass., to turn out or aside, Heb. 12:13; to turn aside or away, swerve, 1 Tim. 1:6; 5:15; 2 Tim. 4:4; to turn from, avoid, 1 Tim. 6:20*

εκτρεφω.definition: to nourish, promote health and strength, Eph. 5:29; to bring up, educate, Eph. 6:4*

εκτρωμα.definition: an abortion, baby prematurely born, 1 Cor. 15:8*

εκφερω.definition: to bring forth, carry out, Lk. 15:22; Acts 5:15; 1 Tim. 6:7; to carry out for burial, Acts 5:6, 9, 10; to produce, yield, Mk. 8:23; Heb. 6:8*

εκφευγω.definition: intrans. to flee out, to make an escape, Acts 16:27; 19:16; trans. to escape, avoid, Lk. 21:36; Rom. 2:3

εκφυω.definition: lit. to cause to grow, to generate; to put forth, shoot, Mt. 24:32; Mk. 13:28*

εκχεω.definition: also formed as ἐκχύννομαι (11x), to pour out, Rev. 16:1, 2, 3; to shed blood, Mt. 26:28; Mk. 14:24; pass. to gush out, Acts 1:18; to spill, scatter, Mt. 9:17; Jn. 2:15; met. to give largely, bestow liberally, Acts 2:17, 18, 33; 10:45; pass. to rush headlong into anything, be abandoned to, Jude 11

εκχυννομαι.definition: some list as the active ἐκχύννω; see ἐκχέω (G1772)

εκχωρεω.definition: to go out, depart from, flee, Lk. 21:21*

εκψυχω.definition: to expire, give up one’s spirit, Acts 5:5, 10; 12:23*

ελαια.definition: an olive tree, Mt. 21:1; 24:3; an olive, fruit of the olive tree, Jas. 3:12, ὄρος τῶν ἐλαιῶν, the Mount of Olives, Mt. 21:1

ελαιων.definition: an olive garden; in NT the mount Olivet, Lk. 19:29; 21:37; Acts 1:12*

ελαμιτης.definition: an Elamite; an inhabitant of Elam, a province of Persia, Acts 2:9*

ελασσων.definition: ἐλάττων (G1784) is the Attic form of this word. Twice it is used with σσ (Jn. 2:10; Rom. 9:12) and twice with ττ (1 Tim. 5:9; Heb. 7:7). It is used as the comparative of μικρός, less; less in age, younger, Rom. 9:12; less in dignity, inferior, Heb. 7:7; less in quality, inferior, worse, Jn. 2:10; 1 Tim. 5:9*

ελαττονεω.definition: trans. to make less; intrans. to be less, inferior; to have too little, want, lack, 2 Cor. 8:15*

ελαττοω.definition: to make less or inferior, Heb. 2:7; pass. to be made less or inferior, Heb. 2:9; to decline in importance, Jn. 3:30*

ελαυνω.definition: to drive, urge forward, spur on, Lk. 8:29; Jas. 3:4; 2 Pet. 2:17; to impel a vessel by oars, to row, Mk. 6:48; Jn. 6:19*

ελαφρια.definition: lightness in weight; hence, lightness of mind, levity, 2 Cor. 1:17*

g1647.definition: used as the superlative of μικρός, smallest, least, Mt. 2:6; 5:19

ελεαω.definition: see ἐλεέω, have mercy on, Rom. 9:16; 12:8; Jude 22, 23*

ελεγμος.definition: reproof, 2 Tim. 3:16, a later equivalent to ἔλεγχος*

ελεγχος.definition: pr. a trial in order to proof, a proof; meton. a certain persuasion, Heb. 11:1*

ελεγχω.definition: to put to proof, to test; to convict, Jn. 8:46; Jas. 2:9; to refute, confute, 1 Cor. 14:24; Tit. 1:9; to detect, lay bare, expose, Jn. 3:20; Eph. 5:11, 13; to reprove, rebuke, Mt. 18:15; Lk. 3:19; 1 Tim. 5:20; to discipline, chastise, Heb. 12:5; Rev. 3:19; pass. to experience conviction, Jn. 3:20; 1 Cor. 14:24

ελεεω.definition: also formed as ἐλεάω 4x, to pity, have compassion on; pass. to receive pity, experience compassion, Mt. 5:7; 9:27; 15:22; to be gracious to any one, show gracious favor and saving mercy towards; pass. to be an object of gracious favor and saving mercy, Rom. 11:30, 31; spc. to obtain pardon and forgiveness, 1 Tim. 1:13, 16

ελεημοσυνη.definition: pity, compassion; in NT an act of kindness, alms, almsgiving, Mt. 6:2, 3, 4; Lk. 11:41

ελεος.definition: pity, mercy, compassion, Mt. 9:13; 12:7; Lk. 1:50, 78; meton. benefit which results from compassion, kindness, mercies, blessing, Lk. 1:54, 58, 72; 10:37; Rom. 9:23

ελευθερος.definition: free, in a state of freedom as opposed to slavery, 1 Cor. 12:13; Gal. 3:28; free, exempt, Mt. 17:26; 1 Cor. 7:39; unrestricted, unfettered, 1 Cor. 9:1; free from the dominion of sin, etc., Jn. 8:36; Rom. 6:20; free in the possession of Gospel privileges, 1 Pet. 2:16

ελιακιμ.definition: also spelled Ἐλιακείμ, Eliakim, pr. name, indecl., Mt. 1:13; Lk. 3:30*

ελιουδ.definition: Eliud, the father of Eleazar, Mt. 1:14, 15*

ελισαβετ.definition: Elizabeth, the wife of Zechariah and mother of John the Baptist, Lk. 1:5, 13, 24, 36, 57

ελισαιος.definition: also spelled Ἐλισσαῖος, Elisha, pr. name, Lk. 4:27*

g1667.definition: to roll, fold up, as garments, Heb. 1:12; Rev. 6:14*

ελκος.definition: pr. a wound; hence, an ulcer, sore, Lk. 16:21; Rev. 16:2, 11*

ελκοω.definition: pass. to be afflicted with ulcers, Lk. 16:20*

ελλας.definition: Hellas, Greece; in NT the southern portion of Greece as distinguished from Macedonia, Acts 20:2*

ελλην.definition: a Greek, Acts 18:17; Rom. 1:14; one not a Jew, a Gentile, Acts 14:1; 16:1, 3

ελληνιστης.definition: pr. one who uses the language and follows the customs of the Greeks; in NT a Jew by blood, but a native of a Greek-speaking country, Hellenist, Acts 6:1; 9:29; 11:20*

ελληνιστι.definition: in the Greek language, Jn. 19:20; Acts 21:37*

ελλογεω.definition: to enter in an account, to put or charge to one’s account, Phlm. 18; in NT to impute, Rom. 5:13*

ελμαδαμ.definition: also spelled Ἐλμωδάμ, Elmadam, pr. name, indecl., Lk. 3:28*

ελπιζω.definition: to hope, expect, Lk. 23:8; 24:21; to repose hope and confidence in, trust, confide, Mt. 12:21; Jn. 5:45

ελπις.definition: pr. expectation; hope, Acts 24:15; Rom. 5:4; meton. the object of hope, thing hoped for, Rom. 8:24; Gal. 5:5; the author or source of hope, Col. 1:27; 1 Tim. 1:1; trust, confidence, 1 Pet. 1:21; ἐπ’ ἐλπίδι, in security, with a guarantee, Acts 2:26; Rom. 8:20

εμβαινω.definition: to step in; to go on board a ship, embark, Mt. 8:23; 9:1; 13:2

εμβαπτω.definition: to dip in, Mt. 26:23; to dip for food in a dish, Mk. 14:20*

εμβατευω.definition: pr. to step into or upon; met. to search into, investigate; to pry into intrusively, Col. 2:18*

εμβιβαζω.definition: to cause to step into or upon; to set in or upon; especially, to put on board, Acts 27:6*

εμβλεπω.definition: to look attentively, gaze earnestly, at an object, followed by εἰς, Mk. 6:26; Acts 1:11; to direct a glance, to look searchingly or significantly, at a person, followed by the dat., Mk. 10:21; 14:67; Lk. 22:61; absol. to see clearly, Mk. 8:25; Acts 22:11

εμβριμαομαι.definition: Attic spelling, ἐμβριμόομαι, to be greatly agitated, Jn. 11:33, 38; to charge or forbid sternly or vehemently, Mt. 9:30; Mk. 1:43; to express indignation, to censure, Mk. 14:5*

εμμαινομαι.definition: to be mad against, be furious toward, Acts 26:11*

εμμαους.definition: Emmaus, pr. name, indecl., of a village near Jerusalem, Lk. 24:13*. See PhotoGuide.

εμμενω.definition: pr. to remain in a place; met. to abide by, to continue firm in, persevere in, Acts 14:22; 28:30; Gal. 3:10; Heb. 8:9*

εμμωρ.definition: also spelled Ἑμμόρ, Hamor, pr. name, indecl., Acts 7:16

εμπαιζω.definition: to play upon, deride, mock, treat with scorn, ridicule, Mt. 20:19; 27:29; by impl. to delude, deceive, Mt. 2:16

εμπαικτης.definition: a mocker, derider, scoffer, 2 Pet. 3:3; Jude 18*

εμπεριπατεω.definition: pr. to walk about in a place; met. in NT to live among, be conversant with, 2 Cor. 6:16*

εμπιπλημι.definition: also spelled ἐμπίμπλημι (G1855) and ἐμπιμπλάω (G1857), to fill, Acts 14:17; pass. to be satisfied, satiated, full, Lk. 1:53; 6:25; Jn. 6:12; met. to have the full enjoyment of, Rom. 15:24*

εμπιμπρημι.definition: also spelled ἐμπίπρημι and ἐμπρήθω, to set on fire, burn down, Mt. 22:7*

εμπιπτω.definition: to fall into, Mt. 12:11; Lk. 14:5; to encounter, Lk. 10:36; to be involved in, 1 Tim. 3:6, 7; 6:9; εἰς χεῖρας, to fall under the chastisement of, Heb. 10:31

εμπλεκω.definition: pr. to intertwine; met. to implicate, entangle, involve; pass. to be implicated, involved, or to entangle one’s self in, 2 Tim. 2:4; 2 Pet. 2:20*

εμπλοκη.definition: braiding or plaiting of hair, 1 Pet. 3:3*

εμπνεω.definition: gen., to breathe into or upon; to respire, breathe; met. to breathe of, be animated with the spirit of, Acts 9:1*

εμπορευομαι.definition: to travel; to travel for business’ sake; to trade, traffic, Jas. 4:13; by impl., trans., to make a gain of, deceive for one’s own advantage, 2 Pet. 2:3*

εμποριον.definition: a mart, marketplace, emporium; met. traffic, Jn. 2:16*

εμπορος.definition: pr. a passenger by sea; a traveller; one who travels about for traffic, a merchant, Mt. 13:45; Rev. 18:3, 11, 15, 23*

εμπροσθεν.definition: also an improper prep., before, in front of, Lk. 19:4; Phil. 3:14; before, in the presence of, in the face of, Mt. 5:24; 23:14; before, previous to, Jn. 1:15, 27, 30; from the Hebrew, in the sight or estimation of, Mt. 11:26; 18:14

εμπτυω.definition: followed by the dat., or εἰς and the acc., to spit upon, Mt. 26:67; 27:30

εμφανης.definition: apparent, conspicuous, obvious to the sight, Acts 10:40; met. manifest, known, comprehended, Rom. 10:20*

εμφανιζω.definition: to cause to appear clearly; to communicate, report, Acts 23:15, 22; to bring charges against, Acts 24:1; 25:2, 15, to manifest, intimate plainly, Heb. 11:14; to reveal, make known, Jn. 14:21, 22; pass. to appear, be visible, Mt. 27:53; to present one’s self, Heb. 9:24*

εμφοβος.definition: terrible; in NT terrified, Lk. 24:5, 37; Acts 10:4; 24:25; Rev. 11:13*

εμφυσαω.definition: to blow or breathe into, inflate; in NT to breathe upon, Jn. 20:22*

εν.definition: followed by the dat., in, Mt. 8:6; Mk. 12:26; Rev. 6:6,; upon, Lk. 8:32; among, Mt. 11:11; before, in the presence of, Mk. 8:38; in the sight, estimation of, 1 Cor. 14:11; before, judicially, 1 Cor. 6:2; in, of state, occupation, habit, Mt. 21:22; Lk. 7:25; Rom. 4:10; in the case of, Mt. 17:12; in respect of, Lk. 1:7; 1 Cor. 1:7; on occasion of, on the ground of, Mt. 6:7; Lk. 1:21; used of the thing by which an oath is made, Mt. 5:34; of the instrument, means, efficient cause, Rom. 12:21; Acts 4:12; equipped with, furnished with, 1 Cor. 4:21; Heb. 9:25; arrayed with, accompanied by, Lk. 14:31; Jude 14; of time, during, in the course of, Mt. 2:1; in NT of demoniacal possession, possessed by, Mk. 5:2

εναγκαλιζομαι.definition: to take into or embrace in one’s arms, Mk. 9:36; 10:16*

εναλιος.definition: marine, living in the sea, Jas. 3:7*

εναντι.definition: also an improper prep, over against, in the presence of, Lk. 1:8; Acts 8:21*

εναντιον.definition: acc sg neut of ἐναντίος used adverbially; the adj. does not appear in the NT, improper prep., before, in the presence of, Lk. 1:6; 20:26; Acts 8:32; 2 Cor. 2:7; Gal. 2:7; 1 Pet. 3:9; from the Hebrew, in the sight or estimation of, Acts 7:10; with τοῦ θεοῦ, an intensive expression, Lk. 24:19*

εναντιος.definition: opposite to, over against, Mk. 15:39; contrary, as the wind, Mt. 14:24; Acts 26:9; 28:17; ὁ ἐξ ἐναντίας, an adverse party, enemy, Tit. 2:8; adverse, hostile, counter, 1 Thess. 2:15

ενδεικνυμι.definition: to manifest, display, Rom. 9:17, 22; Heb. 6:10; to give outward proof of, Rom. 2:15; to display a certain bearing towards a person; hence, to perpetrate openly, 2 Tim. 4:14*

ενδειξις.definition: a pointing out; met. manifestation, public declaration, Rom. 3:25, 26; a token, sign, proof, i.q. ἔνδειγμα, 2 Cor. 8:24; Phil. 1:28*

ενδεκα.definition: eleven, indecl. numeral, Mt. 28:16; Mk. 16:14; Lk. 24:9, 33; Acts 1:26; 2:14*

ενδεχομαι.definition: to admit, approve; to be possible, impersonal, it is possible, Lk. 13:33*

ενδημεω.definition: to dwell in a place, be at home, 2 Cor. 5:6, 8, 9*

ενδιδυσκω.definition: a later form, equivalent to ἐνδύω, to dress (oneself), Mark 15:17; 16:19*

ενδοξαζομαι.definition: to invest with glory; pass. to be glorified, to be made a subject of glorification, 2 Thess. 1:10, 12*

ενδοξος.definition: honored, 1 Cor. 4:10; notable, memorable, Lk. 13:17; splendid, gorgeous, Lk. 7:25; in unsullied array, Eph. 5:27*

ενδυμα.definition: clothing, a garment, Mt. 6:25, 28; 22:11, 12; in particular, an outer garment, cloak, mantle, Mt. 3:4; 7:15; 28:3; Lk. 12:23*

ενδυναμοω.definition: to empower, invigorate, Phil. 4:13; 1 Tim. 1:12; 2 Tim. 4:17; mid. to summon up vigor, put forth energy, Eph. 6:10; 2 Tim. 2:1; pass. to acquire strength, be invigorated, be strong, Acts 9:22; Rom. 4:20*

ενδυσις.definition: a putting on, or wearing of clothes, 1 Pet. 3:3*

ενδυω.definition: to enter, 2 Tim. 3:6; to put on, clothe, invest, array, Mt. 27:31; Mk. 15:17, 20; mid. clothe one’s self, be clothed, Mt. 22:11, 27, 31; trop. to be clothed with spiritual gifts, graces, or character, Lk. 24:49; Rom. 13:14

ενεδρα.definition: pr. a sitting in or on a spot; an ambush, or lying in wait, Acts 23:16; 25:3*

ενεδρευω.definition: to lie in wait or ambush for, Acts 23:21; to endeavor to entrap, Lk. 11:54*

ενειμι.definition: to be in or within; τὰ ἐνόντα, those things which are within, Lk. 11:41*

ενεργεια.definition: energy, efficacy, power, Phil. 3:21; Col. 2:12; active energy, operation, Eph. 1:19; 3:7; 4:16; Col. 1:29; 2 Thess. 2:9, 11*

ενεργεω.definition: to effect, 1 Cor. 12:6, 11; Gal. 3:5; Eph. 1:11; Phil. 2:13; to put into operation, Eph. 1:20; absol. to be active, Mt. 14:2; Mk. 6:14; Eph. 2:2; in NT to communicate energy and efficiency, Gal. 2:8; pass. or mid. to come into activity, be actively developed; to be active, be in operation, towards a result, 2 Cor. 4:12; 2 Thess. 2:7; to be an active power or principle, Rom. 7:5; 1 Thess. 2:12; instinct with activity; in action, operative, 2 Cor. 1:6; Gal. 5:6; Eph. 3:20; Col. 1:29; earnest, Jas. 5:16

ενεργημα.definition: an effect, thing effected, activity, 1 Cor. 12:6; operation, working, 1 Cor. 12:10*

ενεργης.definition: active, Phlm. 6; efficient, energetic, Heb. 4:12; adapted to accomplish a thing, effectual, 1 Cor. 16:9*

ενευλογεω.definition: to bless in respect of, or by means of, Acts 3:25; Gal. 3:8*

ενεχω.definition: to hold within; to fix upon; in NT intrans. (i.e. χόλον) to entertain a grudge against, Mk. 6:19; to be exasperated against, Lk. 11:53; pass. to be entangled, held fast in, Gal. 5:1*

ενθαδε.definition: pr. to this place, Jn. 4:15, 16; also, here, in this place, Lk. 24:41; Acts 10:8; 16:28; 17:6; 25:17, 24*

ενθυμεομαι.definition: to ponder in one’s mind, think of, meditate on, Mt. 1:20; 9:4*

ενθυμησις.definition: the act of thought, reflection, Mt. 9:4; 12:25; Heb. 4:12; the result of thought, invention, device, Acts 17:29*

ενιαυτος.definition: a year, more particularly as being a cycle of seasons, and in respect of its revolution, Jn. 11:49, 51; 18:13; in NT an era, Lk. 4:19

ενιστημι.definition: to place in or upon; intrans., to stand close upon; to be at hand, impend, to be present, Rom. 8:38; 2 Thess. 2:2; Heb. 9:9

ενισχυω.definition: to strengthen, impart strength and vigor, Lk. 22:43; intrans. to gain, acquire, or recover strength and vigor, be strengthened, Acts 9:19*

εννευω.definition: to nod at, signify by a nod; to make signs; to intimate by signs, Lk. 1:62*

εννοια.definition: notion, idea; thought, purpose, intention, Heb. 4:12; 1 Pet. 4:1*

εννομος.definition: within law; lawful, legal, Acts 19:39; in NT subject or under a law, obedient to a law, 1 Cor. 9:21*

ενοικεω.definition: to dwell in, inhabit; in NT met. to be indwelling spiritually, Rom. 8:11; Col. 3:16; 2 Tim. 1:14; to be infixed mentally, 2 Tim. 1:5; of the Deity, to indwell, by special presence, 2 Cor. 6:16*

ενοχλεω.definition: to trouble, annoy; to be a trouble, Lk. 6:18; Heb. 12:15*

ενοχος.definition: held in or by; subjected to, Heb. 2:15; subject to, liable to, guilty, deserving, Mt. 5:21, 22; 26:66; Mk. 3:29; 14:64; an offender against, 1 Cor. 11:27; Jas. 2:10*

ενταλμα.definition: a precept, commandment, ordinance, Mt. 15:9; Mk. 7:7; Col. 2:22*

ενταφιαζω.definition: to prepare a body for burial, Mt. 26:12; absol. to make the ordinary preparations for burial, Jn. 19:40*

ενταφιασμος.definition: preparation of a corpse for burial, burial itself, Mk. 14:8; Jn. 12:7*

εντελλω.definition: some list as ἐντέλλομαι, mid., to enjoin, charge, command, Mt. 4:6; 15:4; 17:9; to direct, Mt. 19:7; Mk. 10:3

εντευθεν.definition: hence, from this place, Mt. 17:20; Lk. 4:9; ἐντεῦθεν καὶ ἐντεῦθεν, on each side, Rev. 22:2; hence, from this cause, Jas. 4:1

εντευξις.definition: pr. a meeting with; hence address; prayer, supplication, intercession, 1 Tim. 2:1; 4:5*

εντιμος.definition: honored, estimable, dear, Lk. 7:2; 14:8; Phil. 2:29; highly-valued, precious, costly, 1 Pet. 2:4, 6*

εντολη.definition: an injunction; a precept, commandment, law, Mt. 5:19; 15:3, 6; an order, direction, Acts 17:15; an edict, Jn. 11:57; a direction, Mk. 10:5; a commission, Jn. 10:18, a charge of matters to be proclaimed or received, Jn. 12:49, 50; 1 Tim. 6:14; 2 Pet. 2:21

εντοπιος.definition: in or of a place; an inhabitant, citizen, Acts 21:12*

εντος.definition: improper prep., gen., inside, within, Lk. 17:21; τὸ ἐντός, the interior, inside, Mt. 23:26*

εντρεπω.definition: mid., to revere, reverence, regard, Mt. 21:37; Mk. 12:6; absol. to feel shame, be put to shame, 2 Thess. 3:14; Tit. 2:8; pass., be put to shame, 2 Thess. 3:14; Tit. 3:8

εντρεφω.definition: to nourish in, bring up or educate in, 1 Tim. 4:6*

εντρυφαω.definition: to live luxuriously, riot, revel, 2 Pet. 2:13*

εντυγχανω.definition: to fill in with, meet; to have conversation with, address; to address or apply to any one, Acts 25:24; ὑπέρ τινος, to intercede for any one, plead the cause of, Rom. 8:27, 34; Heb. 7:25; κατά τινος, to address a representation or suit against any one, to accuse, complain of, Rom. 11:2*

εντυλισσω.definition: to wrap up in, inwrap, envelope, Mt. 27:59; Lk. 23:53; to wrap up, roll or fold together, Jn. 20:7*

εντυποω.definition: to impress a figure, instamp, engrave, 2 Cor. 3:7*

ενυπνιαζομαι.definition: to dream, in NT to dream under supernatural impression, Acts 2:17; to dream delusion, have visions, Jude 8*

ενυπνιον.definition: a dream; in NT a supernatural suggestion or impression received during sleep, a sleep-vision, Acts 2:17*

ενωπιον.definition: gen., before, in the presence of, Lk. 5:25; 8:47; in front of, Rev. 4:5, 6; immediately preceding as a forerunner, Lk. 1:17; Rev. 16:19; from the Hebrew, in the presence of, metaphysically, i.e. in the sphere of sensation or thought, Lk. 12:9; 15:10; Acts 10:31; in the eyes of, in the judgment of, Lk. 16:15; 24:11; Acts 4:19

ενωτιζομαι.definition: to give ear, listen, pay attention to, Acts 2:14*

ενωχ.definition: Enoch, pr. name, indecl., Lk. 3:37; Heb. 11:5; 1 Pet. 3:19; Jude 14*

εξαγγελλω.definition: to tell forth, divulge, publish; to declare abroad, celebrate, 1 Pet. 2:9, shorter ending of Mark*

εξαγοραζω.definition: to buy out of the hands of a person; to redeem, set free, Gal. 3:13; 4:5; mid. to redeem, buy off, to secure for one’s self or one’s own use; to rescue from loss or misapplication, Eph. 5:16; Col. 4:5*

εξαγω.definition: to bring or lead out, conduct out of, Mk. 8:23; 15:20; Lk. 24:50

εξαιρεω.definition: to take out of; to pluck out, tear out, Mt. 5:29; 18:9; mid. to take out of, select, choose, Acts 26:17; to rescue, deliver, Acts 7:10, 34; 12:11; 23:27; Gal. 1:4*

εξαιρω.definition: pr. to lift up out of; in NT to remove, eject, 1 Cor. 5:13*

εξαιτεω.definition: to ask for; to demand; mid. to demand for one’s self, Lk. 22:31; also, to obtain by asking*

εξακολουθεω.definition: to follow out; to imitate, 2 Pet. 2:2, 15; to observe as a guide, 2 Pet. 1:16*

εξαλειφω.definition: pr. to anoint or smear over; hence, to wipe off or away, Rev. 7:17; 21:4; to blot out, obliterate, Col. 2:14; Rev. 3:5; met. to wipe out guilt, Acts 3:19*

εξαλλομαι.definition: to leap or spring up or forth, Acts 3:8*

εξαναστασις.definition: a raising up; a dislodgment; a rising up; a resurrection from the dead, Phil. 3:11*

εξανατελλω.definition: to raise up, make to spring up; intrans. to rise up, sprout, spring up or forth, Mt. 13:5; Mk. 4:5*

εξανιστημι.definition: to cause to rise up, raise up; from the Hebrew, to raise up into existence, Mk. 12:19; Lk. 20:28; intrans. to rise up from, stand forth, Acts 15:5*

εξαπαταω.definition: pr. to deceive thoroughly; to deceive, delude, Rom. 7:11; 16:18; 1 2 Cor. 3:18; 11:3; 2 Thess. 2:3; 1 Tim. 2:14*

εξαπορεω.definition: some list as a deponent ἐξαπορέομαι, pass., to be in the utmost perplexity or despair, 2 Cor. 1:8; 4:8*

εξαποστελλω.definition: to send out or forth; to send away, dismiss, Lk. 1:53; to dispatch on a service or agency, Acts 7:12; to send forth as a pervading influence, Gal. 4:6

εξαρτιζω.definition: to equip or furnish completely, 2 Tim. 3:17; to complete time, Acts 21:5*

εξαστραπτω.definition: pr. to flash forth; hence, to glisten as lightning, Lk. 9:29*

εξαυτης.definition: at the very time; presently, instantly, immediately, Mk. 6:25; Acts 10:33; 11:11

εξεγειρω.definition: to raise up from the dead, 1 Cor. 6:14; to raise up into existence, or into a certain condition, Rom. 9:17*

εξειμι.definition: to go out or forth, Acts 13:42; to depart, Acts 17:15; 20:7; ἐπὶ τὴν γῆν, to get to land, from the water, Acts 27:43

εξελκω.definition: to draw or drag out; met. to withdraw, allure, hurry away, Jas. 1:14*

εξεραυναω.definition: to search out, to examine closely, 1 Pet. 1:10*

εξερχομαι.definition: to go or come out of; to come out, Mt. 5:26; 8:34; to proceed, emanate, take rise from, Mt. 2:6; 15:18; 1 Cor. 14:36; to come abroad, 1 Jn. 4:1; to go forth, go away, depart, Mt. 9:31; Lk. 5:8; to escape, Jn. 10:39; to pass away, come to an end, Acts 16:19

εξεστιν.definition: 3rd person sing of the unused ἔχειμι (#1997) used impersonally, it is possible; it is permitted, it is lawful, Mt. 12:2, 4; Mk. 3:4; Lk. 6:9; Acts 22:25; 1 Cor. 6:12

εξεταζω.definition: to search out; to inquire by interrogation, examine strictly, Mt. 2:8; 10:11; to interrogate, Jn. 21:12*

εξηγεομαι.definition: to be a leader; to detail, to set forth in language; to tell, narrate, recount, Lk. 24:35; Acts 10:8; to make known, reveal, Jn. 1:18; Acts 15:12, 14; 21:19*

εξης.definition: successively, in order; in NT with the article ὁ, ἡ, τό, ἑχῆς, next, Lk. 7:11; 9:37; Acts 21:1; 25:17; 27:18*

εξηχεω.definition: act., to make to sound forth; pass., to sound forth, 1 Thess. 1:8*

εξις.definition: a condition of body or mind, strictly, as resulting from practice; habit, Heb. 5:14*

εξιστημι.definition: pr. to put out of its place; to astonish, amaze, Lk. 24:22; Acts 8:9, 11; intrans. to be astonished, Mt. 12:23; to be beside one’s self, Mk. 3:21; 2 Cor. 5:13

εξισχυω.definition: to be fully able, be strong, Eph. 3:18*

εξοδος.definition: a way out, a going out; a going out, departure, the exodus, Heb. 11:22; met. a departure from life, decease, death, Lk. 9:31; 2 Pet. 1:15*

εξολεθρευω.definition: to destroy utterly, root out, Acts 3:23*

εξομολογεομαι.definition: to agree, bind one’s self, promise, Lk. 22:6; mid. to confess, Mt. 3:6; to profess openly, Phil. 2:11; Rev. 3:5; to make open avowal of benefits; to praise, celebrate, Mt. 11:25; Lk. 10:21

εξορκιζω.definition: to put an oath to a person, to adjure, Mt. 26:63*

εξορκιστης.definition: pr. one who puts an oath; in NT an exorcist, one who by various kinds of incantations, etc., pretended to expel demons, Acts 19:13*

εξορυσσω.definition: to dig out or through, force up, Mk. 2:4; to pluck out the eyes, Gal. 4:15*

εξουδενεω.definition: also spelled ἐξουδενόω, to treat with contempt, Mk. 9:12*

εξουθενεω.definition: also spelled ἐξουθενόω, to make light of, set at naught, despise, treat with contempt and scorn, Lk. 18:9; to neglect, disregard, 1 Thess. 5:20; ἐξουθενημένος, contemptible, 2 Cor. 10:10; of small account, 1 Cor. 1:28; 6:4; by impl. to reject with contempt, Acts 4:11

εξουσια.definition: power, ability, faculty, Mt. 9:8; 10:1; efficiency, energy, Lk. 4:32; liberty, licence, Jn. 10:18; Acts 5:4; authority, rule, dominion, jurisdiction, Mt. 8:9; 28:18; meton. pl. authorities, potentates, powers, Lk. 12:11; 1 Cor. 15:24; Eph. 1:21; right, authority, full power, Mt. 9:6; 21:23; privilege, prerogative, Jn. 1:12; perhaps, a veil, 1 Cor. 11:10

εξουσιαζω.definition: to have or exercise power or authority over anyone, Lk. 22:25; to possess independent control over, 1 Cor. 7:4 (2x); pass. to be subject to, under the power or influence of, 1 Cor. 6:12*

εξοχη.definition: pr. prominence, anything prominent; in NT eminence, distinction, Acts 25:23*

εξυπνιζω.definition: to awake, arouse from sleep, Jn. 11:11*

εξω.definition: can function as an improper prep., without, out of doors; Mt. 12:46, 47; ὁ, ἡ, τὸ ἔξω, outer, external, foreign, Acts 26:11; 2 Cor. 4:16; met. not belonging to one’s community, Mk. 4:11; 1 Cor. 5:12, 13; out, away, from a place or person, Mt. 5:13; 13:48; as a prep., out of, Mk. 5:10

εξωθεν.definition: can function as an improper prep., outwardly, externally, Mt. 23:27, 28; Mk. 7:15; ὁ, ἡ, τὸ ἔξωθεν, outer, external, Mt. 23:25; Lk. 11:39; τὸ ἔξωθεν, the exterior, Lk. 11:40; οἱ ἔξωθεν, those who are without the Christian community, 1 Tim. 3:7

εξωθεω.definition: to expel, drive out, Acts 7:45; to propel, urge forward, Acts 27:39*

εξωτερος.definition: comparative in form but used as a superlative, outer, exterior, external, Mt. 8:12; 22:13; 25:30*

εοικα.definition: see εἴκω (1634a), dat., to be like, Jas. 1:6, 23*

εορταζω.definition: to keep a feast, celebrate a festival, 1 Cor. 5:8*

εορτη.definition: a solemn feast, public festival, Lk. 2:41; 22:1; Jn. 13:1; spc. used of the passover, Mt. 26:5; 27:15

επαγγελια.definition: annunciation, 2 Tim. 1:1; a promise, act of promising, Acts 13:23, 32; 23:21; meton. the thing promised, promised favor and blessing, Lk. 24:49; Acts 1:4

επαγγελλομαι.definition: to declare, to promise, undertake, Mk. 14:11; Rom. 4:21; to profess, 1 Tim. 2:10

επαγγελμα.definition: a promise, 2 Pet. 3:13; meton. promised favor or blessing, 2 Pet. 1:4*

επαγω.definition: to bring upon, cause to come upon, 2 Pet. 2:1, 5; met. to cause to be imputed or attributed to, to bring guilt upon, Acts 5:28*

επαγωνιζομαι.definition: to contend strenuously in defence of, Jude 3*

επαθροιζω.definition: act., to gather together, to collect close upon, or beside; pass., to crowd upon, Lk. 11:29*

επαινεω.definition: to praise, commend, applaud, Lk. 16:8; Rom. 15:11; 1 Cor. 11:2, 17, 22 (2x)*

επαινος.definition: praise, applause, honor paid, Rom. 2:29; 2 Cor. 8:18; meton. ground or reason of praise or commendation, Phil. 4:8; approval, Rom. 13:3; 1 Pet. 2:14; 1 Cor. 4:5

επαιρω.definition: to lift up, raise, elevate; to hoist, Acts 27:40; τὴν φωνήν, to lift up the voice, to speak in a loud voice, Lk. 11:27; τὰς χεῖρας, to lift up the hands in prayer, Lk. 24:50; 1 Tim. 2:8; τοὺς ὀφθαλμούς, to lift up the eyes, to look, Mt. 17:8; τὴν κεφαλήν, to lift up the head, to be encouraged, animated, Lk. 21:28; τὴν πτέρναν, to lift up the heel, to attack, assault; or, to seek one’s overthrow or destruction, Jn. 13:18; pass. to be borne upwards, Acts 1:9; met. mid. to exalt one’s self, assume consequence, be elated, 2 Cor. 10:5

επαιτεω.definition: to prefer a suit or request in respect of certain circumstances; to ask alms, beg, Lk. 16:3; 18:35*

επακολουθεω.definition: to follow upon; to accompany, be attendant, Mk. 16:20; to appear later, 1 Tim. 5:24; met. to follow one’s steps, to imitate, 1 Pet. 2:21; to follow a work, pursue, prosecute, be studious of, devoted to, 1 Tim. 5:10*

επακουω.definition: gen., to listen or hearken to; to hear with favor, 2 Cor. 6:2*

επακροαομαι.definition: gen., to hear, hearken, listen to, Acts 16:25*

επαν.definition: with subj., whenever, as soon as, Mt. 2:8; Lk. 11:22, 34*

επαναγκες.definition: of necessity, necessarily; τὰ ἐπάναγκες, necessary things, Acts 15:28*

επαναγω.definition: to bring up or back; intrans. to return, Mt. 21:18; a nautical term, to put off from shore, Lk. 5:3, 4*

επαναμιμνησκω.definition: to remind, put in remembrance, Rom. 15:15*

επαναπαυομαι.definition: pr. to make to rest upon; mid. to rest upon; to abide with, Lk. 10:6; to rely on, confide in, abide by confidingly, Rom. 2:17*

επανιστημι.definition: to raise up against; mid. to rise up against in rebellion, Mt. 10:21; Mk. 13:12*

επανω.definition: can function as an improper prep., above, over, upon, of place, Mt. 2:9; 5:14; over, of authority, Lk. 19:17, 19; above, more than, Mk. 14:5

επαρκεω.definition: dat., pr. to ward off; to assist, relieve, succor; 1 Tim. 5:10, 16 (2x)*

επαυλις.definition: pr. a place to pass the night in; cottage, farm; in NT a dwelling, habitation, farm, Acts 1:20*

επαυριον.definition: tomorrow; ἡ ἐπαύριον, i.e. ἡμέρα, the next or following day, Mt. 27:62; Mk. 11:12

επαφριζω.definition: to foam out; to pour out like foam, vomit forth, Jude 13*

επεγειρω.definition: to raise or stir up against, excite or instigate against, Acts 13:50; 14:2*

επει.definition: when, after, since, because, in as much as, Mt. 18:32; 27:6; for, for then, for else, since in that case, Rom. 3:6; 11:6

επειδη.definition: since, because, in as much as, Mt. 21:46; Lk. 11:6; Acts 13:46

επειδηπερ.definition: since now, since indeed, considering that, Lk. 1:1*

επειμι.definition: to come upon; to come after; to succeed immediately, Acts 7:26; 16:11; 20:15; 21:18; 23:11*

επεισαγωγη.definition: a superinduction, a further introduction, whether by way of addition or substitution, Heb. 7:19*

επεισερχομαι.definition: to come in upon, invade, surprise, Lk. 21:35*

επειτα.definition: thereupon, then, after that, in the next place, afterwards, Mk. 7:5; Lk. 16:7

επεκεινα.definition: BDAG 361, say it is an adverb with the gen.; others classify it as an improper prep., gen., on yonder side, beyond, Acts 7:43*

επεκτεινομαι.definition: pr. to stretch out farther; in NT mid. to reach out towards, strain for, Phil. 3:13*

επενδυομαι.definition: to put on over or in addition to; mid. to put on one’s self in addition; to be further invested, 2 Cor. 5:2, 4*

επενδυτης.definition: the outer or upper tunic, worn between the inner tunic and the external garments, Jn. 21:7*

επερχομαι.definition: to come to, Acts 14:19; to come upon, Lk. 1:35; 21:26; Acts 1:8; Jas. 5:1; to be coming on, to succeed, Eph. 2:7; to occur, happen to, Acts 8:24; 13:40; to come against, attack, Lk. 11:22*

επερωταω.definition: to interrogate, question, ask, Mt. 12:10; 17:10; in NT to request, require, Mt. 16:1; from the Hebrew, ἐπερωτᾶν τὸν θεόν, to seek after, desire an acquaintance with God, Rom. 10:20

επερωτημα.definition: pr. an interrogation, question; in NT profession, pledge, 1 Pet. 3:21*

επεχω.definition: trans. to hold out, present, exhibit, display, Phil. 2:16; intrans. to observe, take heed to, attend to, Lk. 14:7; Acts 3:5; 1 Tim. 4:16; to stay, delay, Acts 19:22*

επηρεαζω.definition: to harass, insult, Lk. 6:28; to mistreat, abuse, 1 Pet. 3:16*

επι.definition: (1) with the gen., upon, on, Mt. 4:6; 9:2; 27:19; in, of locality, Mk. 8:4; near upon, by, at, Mt. 21:19; Jn. 21:1; upon, over, of authority, Mt. 2:22; Acts 8:27; in the presence of, especially in a judicial sense, 2 Cor. 7:14; Acts 25:9; in the case of, in respect of, Jn. 6:2; Gal. 3:16; in the time of, at the time of, Acts 11:28; Rom. 1:10; ἐπ’ ἀληθείας, really, bona fide, Mk. 12:32; (2) with the dat., upon, on, Mt. 14:8; Mk. 2:21; Lk. 12:44; close upon, by, Mt. 24:33; Jn. 4:6; in the neighborhood or society of, Acts 28:14; over, of authority, Mt. 24:47; to, of addition, besides, Mt. 25:20; Eph. 6:16; Col. 3:14; supervening upon, after, 2 Cor. 1:4; 7:4; immediately upon, Jn. 4:27; upon, of the object of an act, towards, to, Mk. 5:33; Lk. 18:7; Acts 5:35; against, of hostile posture or disposition, Lk. 12:52; in dependence upon, Mt. 4:4; Lk. 5:5; Acts 14:3; upon the ground of, Mt. 19:9; Lk. 1:59; Phil. 1:3; Heb. 7:11; 8:6; 9:17; with a view to, Gal. 5:13; 1 Thess. 4:7; (3) with the acc., upon, with the idea of previous or present motion, Mt. 4:5; 14:19, 26; towards, of place, to, Mt. 3:13; 22:34; towards, of the object of an action, Lk. 6:35; 9:38; against, of hostile movement, Mt. 10:21; over, of authority, Lk. 1:33; to the extent of, both of place and time, Rev. 21:16; Rom. 7:1; near, by, Mt. 9:9; about, at, of time, Acts 3:1; in order to, with a view to, for the purpose of, Mt. 3:7; Lk. 7:44

επιβαινω.definition: pr. to step upon; to mount, Mt. 21:5; to go on board, Acts 21:2; 27:2, to enter, Acts 20:18; to enter upon, Acts 21:4; 25:1*

επιβαλλω.definition: to cast or throw upon, Mk. 11:7; 1 Cor. 7:35; to lay on, apply to, Lk. 9:62; to put on, sew on, Mt. 9:16; Lk. 5:36; τὰς χεῖρας, to lay hands on, offer violence to, seize, Mt. 26:50; also, to lay hand to, undertake, commence, Acts 12:1; intrans. to rush, dash, beat into, Mk. 4:37; to ponder, reflect on, Mk. 14:72; to fall to one’s share, pertain to, Lk. 15:12

επιβαρεω.definition: to burden; met. to be burdensome, chargeable to, 1 Thess. 2:9; 2 Thess. 3:8; to bear hard upon, overcharge, 2 Cor. 2:5*

επιβιβαζω.definition: to cause to ascend or mount, to set upon, Lk. 10:34; 19:35; Acts 23:24*

επιβλεπω.definition: to look upon; to regard with partiality, Jas. 2:3; to regard with kindness and favor, Lk. 1:48; 9:38*

επιβλημα.definition: that which is put over or upon; in NT a patch, Mt. 9:16; Mk. 2:21; Lk. 5:36 (2x)*

επιβουλη.definition: a purpose or design against any one; conspiracy, plot, Acts 9:24; 20:3, 19; 23:30*

επιγαμβρευω.definition: to marry a wife by the law of affinity, Mt. 22:24*

επιγειος.definition: pr. on the earth, Phil. 2:10; earthly, terrestrial, Jn. 3:12; 1 Cor. 15:40; 2 Cor. 5:1; Phil. 3:19; earthly, low, grovelling, Jas. 3:15*

επιγινομαι.definition: to come on, spring up, as the wind, Acts 28:13*

επιγινωσκω.definition: pr. to make a thing a subject of observation; hence, to arrive at knowledge from preliminaries; to attain to a knowledge of, Mt. 11:27; to ascertain, Lk. 7:37; 23:7; to perceive, Mk. 2:8; 5:30; to discern, detect, Mt. 7:16, 20; to recognize, Mk. 6:33; Lk. 24:16, 31; Acts 3:10; to acknowledge, admit, 1 Cor. 14:37; 1 Tim. 4:3; pass. to have one’s character discerned and acknowledged, 2 Cor. 6:9; from the Hebrew, to regard with favor and kindness, 1 Cor. 16:18

επιγνωσις.definition: the coming at the knowledge of a thing, ascertainment, Rom. 3:20; a distance perception or impression, acknowledgment, insight, Col. 2:2

επιγραφη.definition: an inscription; a legend of a coin, Mt. 22:20; Mk. 12:16; Lk. 20:24; a label of a criminal’s name and offence, Mk. 15:26; Lk. 23:38*

επιγραφω.definition: pluperfect pass., ἐπεγεγράμμην, to imprint a mark on; to inscribe, engrave, write on, Mk. 15:26; Acts 17:23; Rev. 21:12; met. to imprint, impress deeply on, Heb. 8:10; 10:16*

επιδεικνυμι.definition: to exhibit, Mt. 16:1; Acts 9:39; to show, Mt. 22:19; Lk. 17:14; to point out, Mt. 24:1; to demonstrate, prove, Acts 18:28; Heb. 6:17*

επιδεχομαι.definition: to admit; to receive kindly, welcome, entertain, 3 Jn. 10; met. to admit, approve, assent to, 3 Jn. 9*

επιδημεω.definition: to dwell among a people; to be at home among one’s own people; and in NT to sojourn as a stranger among another people, Acts 2:10; 17:21*

επιδιατασσομαι.definition: to enjoin anything additional, superadd an injunction, Gal. 3:15*

επιδιδωμι.definition: to give in addition; also, to give to, deliver to, give into one’s hands, Mt. 7:9, 10; Lk. 4:17; 11:11f.; 24:30, 42; Acts 15:30; intrans. probably a nautical term, to commit a ship to the wind, let her drive, Acts 27:15*

επιδιορθοω.definition: to set further to rights, to carry on an amendment, correct, Tit. 1:5*

επιδυω.definition: to set upon, to set during, Eph. 4:26*

επιεικεια.definition: also spelled ἐπιεικία, reasonableness, equity; in NT gentleness, mildness, 2 Cor. 10:1; clemency, Acts 24:4*

επιεικης.definition: pr. suitable; fair, reasonable; gentle, mild, patient, 1 Tim. 3:3; Tit. 3:2; Jas. 3:17; 1 Pet. 2:18; τὸ ἐπιεικές, mildness, gentleness, Phil. 4:5*

επιζητεω.definition: to seek for, make search for, Acts 12:19; to require, demand, Mt. 12:39; 16:4; Acts 19:39; to desire, endeavor to obtain, Rom. 11:7; Heb. 11:14; to seek with care and anxiety, Mt. 6:32

επιθανατιος.definition: condemned to death, under sentence of death, 1 Cor. 4:9*

επιθεσις.definition: the act of placing upon, imposition of hands, Acts 8:18; 1 Tim. 4:14; 2 Tim. 1:6; Heb. 6:2*

επιθυμεω.definition: with the gen. or acc., to set the heart upon; to desire, long for, have earnest desire, Mt. 13:17; Lk. 15:16; to lust after, Mt. 5:28; spc. to covet, Rom. 13:9

επιθυμητης.definition: one who has an ardent desire for anything, 1 Cor. 10:6*

επιθυμια.definition: earnest desire, Lk. 22:15; irregular or violent desire, Mk. 4:19; spc. impure desire, lust, Rom. 1:24; met. the object of desire, what enkindles desire, 1 Jn. 2:16, 17

επικαθιζω.definition: to cause to sit upon, seat upon, Mt. 21:7 (where some mss read ἐπεκάθισεν, intrans. to sit upon)*

επικαλεω.definition: pluperfect, ἐπεκέκλητο (3 sg), to call on; to attach or connect a name, Acts 15:17; Jas. 2:7; to attach an additional name, to surname, Mt. 10:3; pass. to receive an appellation or surname, Heb. 11:16; mid. to call upon, invoke, 2 Cor. 1:23; to appeal to, Acts 25:11, 12, 21

επικαλυμμα.definition: a covering, veil; met. a cloak, 1 Pet. 2:16*

επικαλυπτω.definition: to cover over; met. to cover or veil by a pardon, Rom. 4:7*

επικαταρατος.definition: cursed, accursed; subject to the curse of condemnation, Gal. 3:10; infamous, Gal. 3:13*

επικειμαι.definition: to lie upon, be placed upon, Jn. 11:38; 21:9; to press, urge upon, Lk. 5:1; Acts 27:20; be urgent, importunate upon, Lk. 23:23; to be imposed upon, be imposed by law, Heb. 9:10; by necessity, 1 Cor. 9:16

επικελλω.definition: to push a ship to shore, Acts 27:41*

επικουρειος.definition: an Epicurean, follower of the philosophy of Epicurus, Acts 17:18*

επιλαμβανομαι.definition: to take hold of, Mt. 14:31; Mk. 8:23; to lay hold of, seize, Lk. 23:26; Acts 16:19; met. to seize on as a ground of accusation, Lk. 20:20, 26; to grasp, obtain as if by seizure, 1 Tim. 6:12, 19; to assume a portion of, to assume the nature of, or, to attach or ally one’s self to, Heb. 2:16

επιλανθανομαι.definition: to forget, Mt. 16:5; to be forgetful, neglectful of, to disregard, Phil. 3:13; Heb. 6:10; in NT in a passive sense, forgotten, Lk. 12:6

επιλεγω.definition: to call, Jn. 5:2; mid. to select for one’s self, choose, Acts 15:40*

επιλειπω.definition: to be insufficient, to run short, to fail, Heb. 11:32*

επιλυσις.definition: a loosing, liberation; met. interpretation of what is enigmatical and obscure, 2 Pet. 1:20*

επιλυω.definition: to loose what has previously been fastened or entangled, as a knot; met. to solve, to explain, what is enigmatical, as a parable, Mk. 4:34; to settle, put an end to a matter of debate, Acts 19:39*

επιμαρτυρεω.definition: to bear testimony to; to testify solemnly, 1 Pet. 5:12*

επιμελεομαι.definition: gen., to take care of, Lk. 10:34f.; 1 Tim. 3:5*

επιμενω.definition: to stay longer, prolong a stay, remain on, Acts 10:48; 15:34; to continue, persevere, Jn. 8:7; Acts 12:16; to adhere to, continue to embrace, Acts 13:43; Rom. 11:22; to persist in, Rom. 6:1; 1 Cor. 16:8

επινευω.definition: to nod to; met. to assent to, consent, Acts 18:20*

επιορκεω.definition: to forswear one’s self, to fail of observing one’s oath, Mt. 5:33*

επιορκος.definition: one who violates his oath, perjured, 1 Tim. 1:10*

επιουσιος.definition: This word occurs nowhere else in Greek literature except in the context of the Lord’s prayer. Guesses include, necessary for today, necessary for tomorrow, daily, sufficient, Mt. 6:11; Lk. 11:3*

επιπιπτω.definition: to fall upon; to throw one’s self upon, Lk. 15:20; Jn. 13:25; Acts 20:10, 37; to press, urge upon, Mk. 3:10; to light upon, Rom. 15:3; to come over, Acts 13:11; to come upon, fall upon mentally or spiritually, Lk. 1:12; Acts 8:16; 10:10, 44; 11:15; 19:17

επιπλησσω.definition: pr. to inflict blows upon; met. to chide, reprove, 1 Tim. 5:1*

επιποθεω.definition: to desire besides; also, to desire earnestly, long for, 2 Cor. 5:2; to have a strong bent, Jas. 4:5; by impl. to love, have affection for, 2 Cor. 9:14

επιπορευομαι.definition: to travel to; to come to, Lk. 8:4*

επιραπτω.definition: also ἐπιρράπτω, to sew on, Mk. 2:21*

επιριπτω.definition: to throw upon, cast upon, Lk. 19:35; 1 Pet. 5:7*

επισημος.definition: pr. bearing a distinctive mark or device; noted, eminent, Rom. 16:7; notorious, Mt. 27:16*

επισκεπτομαι.definition: to look at observantly, to inspect; to look out, select, Acts 6:3; to go see, visit, Acts 7:23; 15:36; to visit for the purpose of comfort and relief, Mt. 25:36, 43; Jas. 1:27; from the Hebrew, of God, to visit, Lk. 1:68, 78

επισκευαζομαι.definition: to prepare for a journey, Acts 21:15*

επισκηνοω.definition: to quarter in or at; met. to abide upon, 2 Cor. 12:9*

επισκιαζω.definition: to overshadow, Mt. 17:5; met. to shed influence upon, Lk. 1:35

επισκοπεω.definition: to look at, inspect; met. to be circumspect, heedful, Heb. 12:15; to oversee, to exercise the office of ἐπίσκοπος, 1 Pet. 5:2*

επισκοπη.definition: inspection, oversight, visitation; of God, visitation, interposition, whether in mercy or judgment, Lk. 19:44; 1 Pet. 2:12; the office of an ecclesiastical overseer, 1 Tim. 3:1; from the Hebrew, charge, function, Acts 1:20*

επισκοπος.definition: pr. an inspector, overseer; a watcher, guardian, 1 Pet. 2:25; in NT an ecclesiastical overseer, Acts 20:28; Phil. 1:1; 1 Tim. 3:2; Tit. 1:7*

επισπαομαι.definition: to draw upon or after; in NT mid. to obliterate circumcision by artificial extension of the foreskin, 1 Cor. 7:18*

επισπειρω.definition: to sow in or among, Mt. 13:25*

επισταμαι.definition: to be versed in, to be master of, 1 Tim. 6:4; to be acquainted with, Acts 18:25; 19:15; Jude 10: to know, Acts 10:28; to remember, comprehend, understand, Mk. 14:68

επιστασις.definition: pr. care of, attention to, 2 Cor. 11:28

επιστατης.definition: pr. one who stands by; one who is set over; in NT in voc., equivalent to διδάσκαλε, or ῥαββί, master, doctor, Lk. 5:5; 8:24, 45; 9:33, 49; 17:13*

επιστελλω.definition: to send word to, to send injunctions, Acts 15:20; 21:25; to write to, write a letter, Heb. 13:22*

επιστηριζω.definition: pr. to cause to rest or lean on, to settle upon; met. to conform, strengthen, establish, 14:22; 15:32, 41; 18:23*

επιστολη.definition: word sent; an order, command; an epistle, letter, Acts 9:2; 15:30

επιστομιζω.definition: to apply a curb or muzzle; met. to put to silence, Tit. 1:11*

επιστρεφω.definition: trans. to turn towards; to turn round; to bring back, convert, Lk. 1:16, 17; Jas. 5:19, 20; intrans. and mid. to turn one’s self upon or towards, Acts 9:40; Rev. 1:12; to turn about, Mt. 9:22; to turn back, return, Mt. 12:44; met. to be converted, Acts 28:27

επιστροφη.definition: a turning towards, a turning about; in NT met. conversion, Acts 15:3*

επισυναγω.definition: to gather to a place; to gather together, assemble, convene, Mt. 23:37; 24:31; Lk. 17:37

επισυναγωγη.definition: the act of being gathered together or assembled, 2 Thess. 2:1; an assembling together, Heb. 10:25*

επισυντρεχω.definition: to run together to a place, Mk. 9:25*

επισφαλης.definition: on the verge of falling, unsteady; met. insecure, hazardous, dangerous, Acts 27:9*

επισχυω.definition: to strengthen; intrans. to gather strength; met. to be urgent, to press on a point, insist, Lk. 23:5*

επισωρευω.definition: to heap up, accumulate largely; met. to procure in abundance, 2 Tim. 4:3*

επιταγη.definition: injunction, 1 Cor. 7:6, 25; 2 Cor. 8:8; a decree, Rom. 16:26; 1 Tim. 1:1; Tit. 1:3; authoritativeness, strictness, Tit. 2:15*

επιτασσω.definition: with dat., to set over or upon; to enjoin, charge, Mk. 1:27; 6:39; Lk. 4:36

επιτελεω.definition: to bring to an end; to finish, complete, perfect, Rom. 15:28; 2 Cor. 8:6, 11; to perform, Lk. 13:32; to carry into practice, to realize, 2 Cor. 7:1; to discharge, Heb. 9:6; to execute, Heb. 8:5; to carry out to completion, Phil. 1:6; mid. to end, make an end, Gal. 3:3; pass. to be fully undergone, endured, 1 Pet. 5:9

επιτιθημι.definition: to put, place, or lay upon, Mt. 9:18; Lk. 4:40; to impose a name, Mk. 3:16, 17; to inflict, Acts 16:23; Lk. 10:30; Rev. 22:18; mid. to impose with authority, Acts 15:28; 28:10; to set or fall upon, assail, assault, attack, Acts 18:10

επιτιμαω.definition: pr. to set a value upon; to assess a penalty; to allege as a crimination; hence, to reprove, chide, censure, rebuke, reprimand, Mt. 19:13; Lk. 23:40; in NT to admonish strongly, enjoin strictly, Mt. 12:16; Lk. 17:3

επιτρεπω.definition: to give over, to leave to the entire trust or management of any one; hence, to permit, allow, suffer, Mt. 8:21; Mk. 5:13

επιτροπη.definition: a trust; a commission, permission, Acts 26:12*

επιτροπος.definition: one to whose charge or control a thing is left; a steward, bailiff, agent, manager, Mt. 20:8; steward or overseer of the revenue, treasurer, Lk. 8:3; a guardian of children, Gal. 4:2*

επιτυγχανω.definition: to light upon, find; to hit, reach; to acquire, obtain, attain, Rom. 11:7 (2x); Heb. 6:15; 11:33; Jas. 4:2*

επιφαινω.definition: to make to appear, to display; pass. to be manifested, revealed, Tit. 2:11; 3:4; intrans. to give light, shine, Lk. 1:79; Acts 27:20*

επιφανεια.definition: appearance, manifestation, 1 Tim. 6:14; 2 Tim. 1:10; glorious display, 2 Thess. 2:8; 2 Tim. 4:1, 8; Tit. 2:13*

επιφαυσκω.definition: to shine upon, give light to, enlighten, Eph. 5:14*

επιφερω.definition: to bring upon or against, Jude 9; to inflict, Rom. 3:5*

επιφωνεω.definition: to cry aloud, raise a shout at a speaker, whether applaudingly, Acts 12:22; or the contrary, to clamor at, Lk. 23:21; Acts 21:34; 22:24*

επιφωσκω.definition: to dawn, Mt. 28:1; hence, used of the reckoned commencement of the day, to be near commencing, to dawn on, Lk. 23:54*

επιχειρεω.definition: to put hand to a thing; to undertake, attempt, Lk. 1:1; Acts 9:29; 19:13*

επιχορηγεω.definition: to supply further; to superadd, 2 Pet. 1:5; to supply, furnish, give, 2 Cor. 9:10; Gal. 3:5; 2 Pet. 1:11; pass. to gather vigor, Col. 2:19*

επιχριω.definition: to smear upon, to anoint, Jn. 9:6, 11*

εποικοδομεω.definition: to build upon, 1 Cor. 3:10, 12, 14; pass. met. to be built upon as parts of a spiritual structure, Eph. 2:20; to build up, carry up a building; met. to build up in spiritual advancement,Col. 2:7; Jude 20*

επονομαζω.definition: to attach a name to; pass. to be named, Rom. 2:17*

εποπτευω.definition: to look upon, observe, watch; to witness, be an eye-witness of, 1 Pet. 2:12; 3:2*

επος.definition: a word, that which is expressed by words; ὡς ἔπος εἰπεῖν, so to say, if the expression may be allowed, Heb. 7:9*

επουρανιος.definition: heavenly, in respect of locality, Eph. 1:20; Phil. 2:10; τὰ ἐπουράνια, the upper regions of the air, Eph. 6:12; heavenly, in respect of essence and character, unearthly, 1 Cor. 15:48, 49; met. divine, spiritual, Jn. 3:12

επτα.definition: seven, indecl. numeral, Mt. 15:34, 37; by Jewish usage for a round number, Mt. 12:45; Lk. 11:26

εραστος.definition: Erastus, pr. name, Acts 19:22; Rom. 16:23; 2 Tim. 4:20*

εραυναω.definition: to search, examine, investigate, Jn. 5:39; 7:52; Rom. 8:27; 1 Cor. 2:10; 1 Pet. 1:11; Rev. 2:23*

εργαζομαι.definition: intrans. to work, labor, Mt. 21:28; Lk. 13:14; to trade, traffic, do business, Mt. 25:16; Rev. 18:17; to act, exert one’s power, be active, Jn. 5:17; trans. to do, perform, commit, Mt. 26:10; Jn. 6:28; to be engaged in, occupied upon, 1 Cor. 9:13; Rev. 18:17; to acquire, gain by one’s labor, Jn. 6:27

εργασια.definition: work, labor; in NT ἐργασίαν διδόναι, to endeavor, strive, Lk. 12:58; performance, practice, Eph. 4:19; a trade, business, craft, Acts 19:25, gain acquired by labor or trade, profit, Acts 16:16, 19; 19:24*

εργατης.definition: a workman, laborer, Mt. 9:37, 38; 20:1, 2, 8; met. a spiritual workman or laborer, 2 Cor. 11:13; an artisan, artificer, Acts 19:25; a worker, practicer, Lk. 13:27

εργον.definition: anything done or to be done; a deed, work, action, Jn. 3:21; Eph. 2:10; 2 Cor. 9:8, et al. freq.; duty enjoined, office, charge, business, Mk. 13:34; Jn. 4:34, et al. freq.; a process, course of action, Jas. 1:4; a work, product of an action or process, Acts 7:41; Heb. 1:10; substance in effect, Rom. 2:15

ερεθιζω.definition: to provoke, to irritate, exasperate, Col. 3:21; to incite, stimulate, 2 Cor. 9:2*

ερειδω.definition: to make to lean upon; to fix firmly; intrans. to become firmly fixed, stick fast, Acts 27:41*

ερευγομαι.definition: to vomit; met. to utter, declare openly, Mt. 13:35*

ερημια.definition: a solitude, uninhabited region, waste, desert, Mt. 15:33; Mk. 8:4; 2 Cor. 11:26; Heb. 11:38*

ερημος.definition: lone, desert, waste, uninhabited, Mt. 14:13, 15; Mk. 6:31, 32, 35; lone, abandoned to ruin, Mt. 23:38; Lk. 13:35; met. lone, unmarried, Gal. 4:27; as a subst. a desert, uninhabited region, waste, Mt. 3:1; 24:26; Acts 7:36

ερημοω.definition: to lay waste, make desolate, bring to ruin, Mt. 12:25; Lk. 11:17; Rev. 17:16; 18:17, 19*

εριζω.definition: to quarrel; to wrangle; to use the harsh tone of a wrangler or brawler, to grate, Mt. 12:19*

εριθεια.definition: the service of a party, party spirit; feud, faction, 2 Cor. 12:20; contentious disposition, selfish ambition, Gal. 5:20; Phil. 1:17; 2:3; Jas. 3:14; by impl. untowardness, disobedience, Rom. 2:8; Jas. 3:16*

ερις.definition: altercation, strife, Rom. 13:13; contentious disposition, Rom. 1:29; Phil. 1:15

ερμηνεια.definition: interpretation, explanation, 1 Cor. 14:26; meton. the power or faculty of interpreting, 1 Cor. 12:10*

ερμηνευω.definition: to explain, interpret, translate, Jn. 1:42; 9:7; Heb. 7:2*

ερμης.definition: Hermes or Mercury, son of Jupiter and Maia, the messenger and interpreter of the gods, and the patron of eloquence, learning, etc., Acts 14:12; Rom. 16:14*

ερπετον.definition: a creeping animal, a reptile, Acts 10:12; 11:6; Rom. 1:23; Jas. 3:7*

ερχομαι.definition: to come, to go, to pass. By the combination of this verb with other terms, a variety of meaning results, which, however, is due, not to a change of meaning in the verb, but to the adjuncts. Ὁ ἐρχόμενος, He who is coming, the expected Messiah, Mt. 11:3

ερωταω.definition: to ask, interrogate, inquire of, Mt. 21:24; Lk. 20:3; in NT to ask, request, beg, beseech, Mt. 15:23; Lk. 4:38; Jn. 14:16

εσθης.definition: also spelled ἔσθησις, a robe, vestment, raiment, garment, Lk. 23:11; 24:4; Acts 1:10; 10:30; 12:21; Jas. 2:2, 3*

g5315.definition: to eat, Mt. 12:1; 15:27; ἐσθίειν καὶ πίνειν, to eat and drink, to eat and drink in the usual manner, follow the common mode of living, Mt. 11:18; also with the associated notion of supposed security, Lk. 17:27; to feast, banquet, Mt. 24:49; met. to devour, consume, Heb. 10:27; Jas. 5:3; from the Hebrew, ἄρτον ἐσθίειν, to eat bread, to take food, take the usual meals, Mt. 15:2

εσρωμ.definition: Hezron, pr. name, indecl., Mt. 1:3; Lk. 3:33*

εσχατος.definition: farthest; last, latest, Mt. 12:45; Mk. 12:6; lowest, Mt. 19:30; 20:16; in the lowest plight, 1 Cor. 4:9

εσχατως.definition: to be in the last extremity, Mk. 5:23*

εσω.definition: can function as an improper prep., in, within, in the interior of, Mt. 26:58; Jn. 20:26; ὁ, ἡ, τὸ ἔσω, inner, interior, internal; met. within the pale of community, 1 Cor. 5:12; ὁ ἐσω ἄνθρωπος, the inner man, the mind, soul, Rom. 7:22

εσωθεν.definition: from within, from the interior, Mk. 7:21, 23; within, in the internal parts, Mt. 7:15; ὁ, ἡ, τὸ ἔσωθεν, interior, internal, Lk. 11:39, 40; ὁ ἔσωθεν ἄνθρωπος, the mind, soul, 2 Cor. 4:16

εταιρος.definition: a companion, associate, fellow-comrade, friend, Mt. 20:13; 22:12; 26:50*

ετερογλωσσος.definition: one who speaks another or foreign language, 1 Cor. 14:21*

ετεροδιδασκαλεω.definition: to teach other or different doctrine, and spc. what is foreign to the Christian religion, 1 Tim. 1:3; 6:3*

ετεροζυγεω.definition: to be unequally yoked or matched, 2 Cor. 6:14*

ετερος.definition: other, Mt. 12:45; another, some other, Mt. 8:21; besides, Lk. 23:32; ὁ ἕτερος, the other of two, Mt. 6:24; τῇ ἑτέρᾳ, on the next day, Acts 20:15; 27:3; ὁ ἕτερος, one’s neighbor, Rom. 13:8; different, Lk. 9:29; foreign, strange, Acts 2:4; 1 Cor. 14:21; illicit, Jude 7

ετι.definition: yet, still, Mt. 12:46; still, further, longer, Lk. 16:2; further, besides, in addition, Mt. 18:16; with a compar. yet, still, Phil. 1:9

ετοιμως.definition: in readiness, preparedly, Acts 21:13; 2 Cor. 2:14; 1 Pet. 4:5*

ευαγγελιζω.definition: to address with good tidings, Rev. 10:7; 14:6; but elsewhere to proclaim as good tidings, to announce good tidings of, Lk. 1:19; to address with good tidings, Acts 13:32; 14:15; to address with the Gospel teaching, evangelize, Acts 16:10; Gal. 1:9; absol. to announce the good tidings of the Gospel, Lk. 4:18; 9:6; pass. to be announced as good tidings, Lk. 16:16; to be addressed with good tidings, Mt. 11:5; Lk. 7:22; Heb. 4:2

ευαγγελιον.definition: glad tidings, good or joyful news, Mt. 4:23; 9:35; the Gospel; doctrines of the Gospel, Mt. 26:13; Mk. 8:35; meton. the preaching of, or instruction in, the Gospel, 1 Cor. 4:15; 9:14

ευαγγελιστης.definition: pr. one who announces glad tidings; an evangelist, preacher of the Gospel, teacher of the Christian religion, Acts 21:8; Eph. 4:11; 2 Tim. 4:5*

ευαρεστεω.definition: to please, Heb. 11:5, 6; pass. to take pleasure in, be well pleased with, Heb. 13:16*

ευγενης.definition: well-born, of high rank, honorable, Lk. 19:12; 1 Cor. 1:26; generous, candid, Acts 17:11*

ευδια.definition: serenity of the heavens, a cloudless sky, fair or fine weather, Mt. 16:2*

ευδοκεω.definition: to think well, approve, consent, take delight or pleasure, Mt. 3:17; 17:5; Mk. 1:11; Lk. 3:22; 12:32

ευδοκια.definition: good will, favor, Lk. 2:14; good pleasure, purpose, intention, Mt. 11:26; Lk. 10:21; Eph. 1:5, 9; Phil. 2:13; by impl. desire, Rom. 10:1; Phil. 1:15; 2 Thess. 1:11*

ευεργεσια.definition: well-doing, a good deed, benefit conferred, Acts 4:9; duty, good offices, 1 Tim. 6:2*

ευεργετεω.definition: to do good, exercise beneficence, Acts 10:38*

ευθετος.definition: pr. well arranged, rightly disposed; fit, proper, adapted, Lk. 9:62; 14:35; useful, Heb. 6:7*

ευθυδρομεω.definition: to run on a straight course; to sail on a direct course, Acts 16:11; 21:1*

ευθυμεω.definition: to be cheerful, be in good spirits, take courage, Acts 27:22, 25; Jas. 5:13*

ευθυμος.definition: good cheer or courage, cheerful, Acts 27:36*

ευθυνω.definition: to guide straight; to direct, guide, steer a ship, Jas. 3:4; to make straight, Jn. 1:23*

ευθυς.definition: straight forwards; directly, immediately, instantly, Mt. 3:16; 13:20, 21

ευκαιρεω.definition: to have convenient time or opportunity, have leisure, Mk. 6:31; 1 Cor. 16:12; to be at leisure for a thing, to be disposed to attend, to give time, Acts 17:21*

ευκαιρια.definition: convenient opportunity, favorable occasion, Mt. 26:16; Lk. 22:6*

ευκαιρος.definition: timely, opportune, seasonable, convenient, Mk. 6:21; Heb. 4:16*

ευλαβεια.definition: the disposition of one who is εὐλαβής, caution, circumspection; in NT reverence to God, piety, Heb. 5:7; 12:28*

ευλαβεομαι.definition: to fear, be afraid or apprehensive; in NT absol. to reverence God, to be influenced by pious awe, Heb. 11:7*

ευλαβης.definition: pr. taking hold of well, i.e., warily; hence, cautious, circumspect; full of reverence towards God, devout, pious, religious, Lk. 2:25; Acts 2:5; 8:2; 22:12*

ευλογεω.definition: pr. to speak well of, in NT to bless, ascribe praise and glorification, Lk. 1:64; to bless, invoke a blessing upon, Mt. 5:44; to bless, confer a favor or blessing upon, Eph. 1:3; Heb. 6:14; pass. to be blessed, to be an object of favor or blessing, Lk. 1:28

ευλογητος.definition: worthy of praise or blessing, blessed, Mk. 14:61; Lk. 1:68

ευλογια.definition: pr. good speaking; fair speech, flattery, Rom. 16:18; in NT blessing, praise, celebration, 1 Cor. 10:16; Rev. 5:12, 13; invocation of good, benediction, Jas. 3:10; a divine blessing, Rom. 15:29; a gift, benevolence, 2 Cor. 9:5; a frank gift, as opposed to πλεονεξία, 2 Cor. 9:5; ἐπ’ εὐλογίαις, liberally, 2 Cor. 9:6

ευνοεω.definition: to have kind thoughts, be well affected or kindly disposed towards, make friends, Mt. 5:25*

ευνοια.definition: good will, kindliness; heartiness, enthusiasm, Eph. 6:7*

ευνουχος.definition: pr. one who has charge of the bedchamber; hence, a eunuch, one emasculated, Mt. 19:12; as eunuchs in the East often rose to places of power and trust, hence, a minister of a court, Acts 8:27, 34, 36, 38f.*

ευοδοω.definition: to give a prosperous journey; cause to prosper or be successful; pass. to have a prosperous journey, to succeed in a journey, Rom. 1:10; met. to be furthered, to prosper, temporally or spiritually, 1 Cor. 16:2; 3 Jn. 2 (2x)*

ευπαρεδρος.definition: constantly attending; devoted to; τὸ εὐπάρεδρον, devotedness, 1 Cor. 7:35*

ευπορεω.definition: to be in prosperous circumstances, enjoy plenty, Acts 11:29*

ευπροσδεκτος.definition: acceptable, grateful, pleasing, Rom. 15:16, 31; 2 Cor. 6:2; 8:12; 1 Pet. 2:5; in NT gracious*

ευπροσωπεω.definition: to carry or make a fair appearance, Gal. 6:12*

ευρακυλων.definition: also spelled εὐρυκλύδων and εὐροκλύδων, which BDAG 411, says was probably due to scribal error, euracylon, the name of a tempestuous southeast wind, Acts 27:14*

ευρισκω.definition: to find, to meet with; Mt. 18:28; 20:6; to find out, to detect, discover, Lk. 23:2, 4, 14; to acquire, obtain, win, gain, Lk. 1:30; 9:12; to find mentally, to comprehend, recognize, Acts 17:27; Rom. 7:21; to find by experience, observe, gather, Rom. 7:18; to devise as feasible, Lk. 5:19; 19:48

ευσεβεια.definition: reverential feeling; piety, devotion, godliness, Acts 3:12; 1 Tim. 2:2; 4:7, 8; religion, the Christian religion, 1 Tim. 3:16

ευσεβεω.definition: to exercise piety; towards a deity, to worship, Acts 17:23; towards relatives, to be dutiful towards, 1 Tim. 5:4*

ευσεβης.definition: reverent; pious, devout, religious, Acts 10:2, 7; 2 Pet. 2:9*

ευσημος.definition: pr. well marked, strongly marked; met. significant, intelligible, 1 Cor. 14:9*

ευσχημονως.definition: in a becoming manner, with propriety, decently, gracefully, Rom. 13:13; 1 Cor. 14:40; 1 Thess. 4:12*

ευσχημοσυνη.definition: comeliness, gracefulness; artificial comeliness, ornamental array, embellishment, 1 Cor. 12:23*

ευσχημων.definition: of good appearance, pleasing to look upon, comely, 1 Cor. 12:24; met. becoming, decent, τὸ εὔσχημον, decorum, propriety, 1 Cor. 7:35; honorable, reputable, of high standing and influence, Mk. 15:43; Acts 13:50; 17:12*

ευτραπελια.definition: facetiousness, pleasantry; hence, buffoonery, coarse laughter, Eph. 5:4*

ευφημια.definition: pr. use of words of good omen; hence, favorable expression, praise, commendation, 2 Cor. 6:8*

ευφημος.definition: pr. of good omen, auspicious; hence, of good report, commendable, laudable, reputable, Phil. 4:8*

ευφορεω.definition: to bear or bring forth well or plentifully, yield abundantly, Lk. 12:16*

ευφραινω.definition: to gladden, 2 Cor. 2:2; pass. to be glad, exult, rejoice, Lk. 12:19; Acts 2:26; mid. to feast in token of joy, keep a day of rejoicing, Lk. 15:23, 24, 29, 32

ευχαριστεω.definition: to thank, Lk. 17:16; absol. to give thanks, Mt. 15:36; 26:27; pass. to be made a matter of thankfulness, 2 Cor. 1:11

ευχαριστια.definition: gratitude, thankfulness, Acts 24:3; thanks, the act of giving thanks, thanksgiving, 1 Cor. 14:16; conversation marked by the gentle cheerfulness of a grateful heart, as contrasted with the unseemly mirth of εὐτραπελία, Eph. 5:4

ευχαριστος.definition: grateful, pleasing; mindful of benefits, thankful, Col. 3:15*

ευχη.definition: a wish, prayer, Jas. 5:15; a vow, Acts 21:23; Acts 18:18*

ευχομαι.definition: to pray, offer prayer, Acts 26:29; 2 Cor. 13:7, 9; Jas. 5:16; to wish, desire, Acts 27:29; Rom. 9:3; 3 Jn. 2*

ευχρηστος.definition: highly useful, very profitable, 2 Tim. 2:21; 4:11; Phlm. 11*

ευψυχεω.definition: to be animated, encouraged, in good spirits, Phil. 2:19*

ευωδια.definition: a sweet smell, grateful odor, fragrance, 2 Cor. 2:15; Eph. 5:2; Phil. 4:18*

ευωνυμος.definition: of good name or omen; used also as an euphemism by the Greeks instead of ἀριστερός, which was a word of bad import, as all omens on the left denoted misfortune; the left, Mt. 20:21, 23; 25:33, 41

εφαλλομαι.definition: to leap or spring upon, assault, Acts 19:16*

εφαπαξ.definition: once for all, Rom. 6:10; Heb. 7:27; 9:12; 10:10; at once, 1 Cor. 15:6*

εφεσος.definition: Ephesus, a celebrated city of Asia Minor, Acts 18:19, 21, 24; 1 Cor. 15:32*

εφημερια.definition: pr. daily course; the daily service of the temple; a class of priests to which the daily service for a week was allotted in rotation, Lk. 1:5, 8*

εφημερος.definition: lasting for a day; daily sufficient for a day, necessary for every day, Jas. 2:15*

εφικνεομαι.definition: to come or reach to, to reach a certain point or end; to reach, arrive at, 2 Cor. 10:13, 14*

εφιστημι.definition: trans. to place upon, over, close by; intrans. to stand by or near, Lk. 2:38; 4:39; to come suddenly upon, Lk. 2:9; 24:4; to come upon, assault, Acts 6:12; 17:5; to come near, approach, Lk. 10:40; to impend, be instant, to be at hand, 1 Thess. 5:3; to be present, Acts 28:2; to be pressing, urgent, earnest, 2 Tim. 4:2

εφοραω.definition: a proposed lexical form for the second aorist ἐπεῖδον

εφραιμ.definition: Ephraim, pr. name, indecl. Jn. 11:54*. See PhotoGuide.

εχθρα.definition: enmity, discord, feud, Lk. 23:12; Gal. 5:20; alienation, Eph. 2:14, 16; a principle or state of enmity, Rom. 8:7; Jas. 4:4*

εχθρος.definition: hated, under disfavor, Rom. 11:28; inimical, hostile, Mt. 13:28; Col. 1:21; as a subst., an enemy, adversary, Mt. 5:43, 44; 10:36; Lk. 27:35

εχιδνα.definition: a viper, poisonous serpent, Acts 28:3; used also fig. of persons, Mt. 3:7; 12:34; 23:33; Lk. 3:7*

εχω.definition: pluperfect., ἐσχήκειν, to hold, Rev. 1:16; to seize, possess a person, Mk. 16:8; to have, possess, Mt. 7:29, et al. freq.; to have, have ready, be furnished with, Mt. 5:23; Jn. 5:36; 6:68; to have as a matter of crimination, Mt. 5:23; Mk. 11:25; to have at command, Mt. 27:65; to have the power, be able, Mt. 18:25; Lk. 14:14; Acts 4:14; to have in marriage, Mt. 14:4; to have, be affected by, subjected to, Mt. 3:14; 12:10; Mk. 3:10; Jn. 12:48; 15:22, 24; 16:21, 22; Acts 23:29; 1 Tim. 5:12; Heb. 7:28; 1 Jn. 1:8; 4:18; χάραν ἔχειν, to feel gratitude, be thankful, 1 Tim. 1:12; 2 Tim. 1:3; Phlm. 7; to hold, esteem, regard, Mt. 14:5; Lk. 14:18, 19; to have or hold as an object of knowledge, faith, or practice, Jn. 5:38, 42; 14:21; 1 Jn. 5:12; 2 Jn. 9; to hold on in entire possession, to retain, Rom. 15:4; 2 Tim. 1:13; Heb. 12:28; intrans. with adverbs or adverbial expression, to be, to fare, Mt. 9:12; Mk. 2:17; 5:23; Lk. 5:31; Jn. 4:52; Acts 7:1; 12:15; 15:36; 21:13; 2 Cor. 10:6; 12:14; 1 Tim. 5:25; 1 Pet. 4:5; τὸ νῦν ἔχον, for the present; in NT ἔχειν ἐν γαστρί, to be pregnant, Mt. 1:18; as also ἔχειν κοίτην, Rom. 9:10; ἔχειν δαιμόνιον, to be possessed, Mt. 11:18; of time, to have continued, to have lived, Jn. 5:5, 6; 8:57; of space, to embrace, be distant, Acts 1:12; mid. pr. to hold by, cling to; hence, to border upon, be next, Mk. 1:38; Lk. 13:33; Acts 20:15; 21:26; to tend immediately to, Heb. 6:9

εως.definition: can function as an improper prep., while, as long as, Jn. 9:4; until, Mt. 2:9; Lk. 15:4; as also in NT ἕως οὗ, ἕως ὅτου, Mt. 5:18, 26; ἕως ἄρτι, until now, Mt. 11:12; ἕως πότε, until when, how long, Mt. 17:17; ἕως σήμερον, until this day, to this time, 2 Cor. 3:15; as a prep. of time, until, Mt. 24:21; of place, unto, even to, Mt. 11:23; Lk. 2:15; ἕως ἄνω, to the brim, Jn. 2:7; ἕως εἰς, even to, as far as, Lk. 24:50; ἕως κάτω, to the bottom; ἕως ὥδε, to this place, Lk. 23:5; of state, unto, even to, Mt. 26:38; of number, even, so much as, Rom. 3:12, et al. freq.

ζαβουλων.definition: Zebulun, pr. name, indecl., an Israelite tribe, Mt. 4:13, 15; Rev. 7:8*

ζαχαριας.definition: Zacharias, pr. name. (1) Son of Barachias, Mt. 23:35; Lk. 11:51. (2) Father of Jn. the Baptist, Lk. 1:5

ζαω.definition: to live, to be possessed of vitality, to exercise the functions of life, Mt. 27:63; Acts 17:28; τὸ ζῆν, life, Heb. 2:15; to have means of subsistence, 1 Cor. 9:14; to live, to pass existence in a specific manner, Lk. 2:36; 15:13; to be instinct with life and vigor; hence, ζῶν, living, an epithet of God, in a sense peculiar to Himself; ἐλπὶς ζῶσα, a living hope vigor and constancy, 1 Pet. 1:3; ὕδωρ ζῶν, living water in respect of a full and unfailing flow, Jn. 4:10, 11; to be alive with cheered and hopeful feelings, 1 Thess. 3:8; to be alive in a state of salvation from spiritual death, 1 Jn. 4:9

ζεβεδαιος.definition: Zebedee, pr. name, the father of Jas. and John, Mt. 4:21; Mk. 10:35; Lk. 5:10; Jn. 21:1*

ζεστος.definition: pr. boiled; boiling, boiling hot; met. glowing with zeal, fervent, Rev. 3:15, 16*

ζευγος.definition: a yoke of animals; a pair, couple, Lk. 2:24; 14:19*

ζευς.definition: the supreme god of the Greeks answering to the Jupiter of the Romans, Acts 14:12, 13*

ζεω.definition: to boil, to be hot, in NT met. to be fervent, ardent, zealous, Acts 18:25; Rom. 12:11*

ζηλευω.definition: to be zealous, earnest, eager, Rev. 3:19*

ζηλος.definition: generous rivalry; noble aspiration; in NT zeal, ardor in behalf of, ardent affection, Jn. 2:17; Rom. 10:2; in a bad sense, jealousy, envy, malice, Acts 13:45; Rom. 13:13; indignation, wrath, Acts 5:17

ζηλοω.definition: to have strong affection towards, be ardently devoted to, 2 Cor. 11:2; to make a show of affection and devotion towards, Gal. 4:17; to desire earnestly, aspire eagerly after, 1 Cor. 12:31; 14:1, 39; absol. to be fervent, to be zealous, Rev. 3:19; to be jealous, envious, spiteful, Acts 7:9; 17:5; 1 Cor. 13:4; Jas. 4:2; pass. to be an object of warm regard and devotion, Gal. 4:18

g2208.definition: pr. a generous rival, an imitator; in NT an aspirant, 1 Cor. 14:12; Tit. 2:14; a devoted adherent, a zealot, Acts 21:20; 22:3; Gal. 1:14

ζητεω.definition: to seek, look for, Mt. 18:12; Lk. 2:48, 49; to search after, Mt. 13:45; to be on the watch for, Mt. 26:16; to pursue, endeavor to obtain, Rom. 2:7; 1 Pet. 3:11; to desire, wish, want, Mt. 12:47; to seek, strive for, Mt. 6:33; to endeavor, Mt. 21:46; to require, demand, ask for, Mk. 8:11; Lk. 11:16; 12:48; to inquire or ask questions, question, Jn. 16:19; to deliberate, Mk. 11:18; Lk. 12:29; in NT from Hebrew, ζητεῖν τὴν ψυχήν, to seek the life of any one, to seek to kill, Mt. 2:20

ζητημα.definition: a question; a subject of debate or controversy, Acts 15:2; 18:15; 23:29; 25:19; 26:3*

ζητησις.definition: a seeking; an inquiry, a question; a dispute, debate, discussion, Jn. 3:25; 1 Tim. 6:4; a subject of dispute or controversy, Acts 15:2, 7; 25:20; 2 Tim. 2:23; Tit. 3:9

ζιζανιον.definition: zizanium, darnel, spurious wheat, a plant found in Palestine, which resembles wheat both in its stalk and grain, but is worthless, Mt. 13:25, 26, 27, 29, 30, 36, 38, 40*

ζοροβαβελ.definition: Zorobabel, pr. name, indecl. (Ezra 2:2; 3:8), Mt. 1:12, 13; Lk. 3:27*

ζοφος.definition: gloom, thick darkness, Heb. 12:18; 2 Pet. 2:4, 17; Jude 6, 13*

ζυγος.definition: also spelled ζυγόν, ου, τό (n-2c), pr. a cross bar or band; a yoke; met. a yoke of servile condition, 1 Tim. 6:1; a yoke of service or obligation, Mt. 11:29, 30; Acts 15:10; Gal. 5:1; the beam of a balance; a balance, Rev. 6:5*

ζυμη.definition: leaven, yeast, Mt. 16:12; 13:33; met. leaven of the mind and conduct, by a system of doctrine or morals, used in a bad sense, Mt. 16:6, 11; 1 Cor. 5:6

ζυμοω.definition: to leaven, cause to ferment, Mt. 13:33; Lk. 13:21; 1 Cor. 5:6; Gal. 5:9*

ζωγρεω.definition: pr. to take alive, take prisoner in war instead of killing; to take captive, enthral, 2 Tim. 2:26; also, to catch animals, as fish; in which sense it is used figuratively, Lk. 5:10*

ζωη.definition: life, living existence, Lk. 16:25; Acts 17:25; in NT spiritual life of deliverance from the proper penalty of sin, which is expressed by θάνατος, Jn. 6:51; Rom. 5:18; 6:4; the final life of the redeemed, Mt. 25:46; life, source of spiritual life, Jn. 5:39; 11:25; Col. 3:4

ζωνη.definition: a zone, belt, girdle, Mt. 3:4; 10:9; Mk. 1:6; 6:8; Acts 21:11; Rev. 1:13; 15:6*

ζωννυμι.definition: also spelled ζωννύω, to gird, gird on, put on one’s girdle, Jn. 21:18 (2x), Acts 12:8*

ζωογονεω.definition: pr. to bring forth living creatures; in NT to preserve alive, save, Lk. 17:33; Acts 7:19; 1 Tim. 6:13*

ζωον.definition: a living creature, animal, Heb. 13:11; 2 Pet. 2:12

ζωοποιεω.definition: pr. to engender living creatures; to quicken, make alive, Rom. 4:17; 8:11; 1 Cor. 15:36; in NT met. to quicken with the life of salvation, Jn. 6:63; 2 Cor. 3:6

η.definition: can function as a conj (298x), either, or, Mt. 6:24; after comparatives, and ἄλλος, ἕτερος, expressed or implied, than, Mt. 10:15; 18:8; Acts 17:21; 24:21; intensive after ἀλλά and πρίν, Lk. 12:51; Mt. 1:18; it also serves to point an interrogation, Rom. 3:29

ηγεμονευω.definition: to be a guide, leader, chief; in NT to hold the office of a Roman provincial governor, Lk. 2:2; 3:1*

ηγεμονια.definition: leadership, sovereignty; in NT a reign, Lk. 3:1*

ηγεμων.definition: a guide; a leader; a chieftain, prince, Mt. 2:6; a Roman provincial governor, under whatever title, Mt. 10:18; 27:2; Lk. 20:20; Acts 23:24

ηγεομαι.definition: to lead the way; to take the lead, Acts 14:12; to be chief, to preside, govern, rule, Mt. 2:6; Acts 7:10; ἡγούμενος, a chief officer in the church, Heb. 13:7, 17, 24; also, to think, consider, count, esteem, regard, Acts 26:2; 2 Cor. 9:5

g2236.definition: with pleasure, gladly, willingly, Mk. 6:20; 12:37; 2 Cor. 11:19

ηδη.definition: before now, now, already, Mt. 3:10; 5:28; ἤδη ποτέ, at length, Rom. 1:10; Phil. 4:10

ηδονη.definition: pleasure, gratification; esp. sensual pleasure, Lk. 8:14; Tit. 3:3; Jas. 4:3; 2 Pet. 2:13; a passion, Jas. 4:1*

ηθος.definition: pr. a place of customary resort; hence, a settled habit of mind and manners, 1 Cor. 15:33*

ηκω.definition: to become, have arrived, Mt. 8:11; Mk. 8:3; Lk. 15:27; Rev. 15:4*

ηλι.definition: Heli, the father of Joseph, Lk. 3:23*

ηλικια.definition: a particular period of life; the period fitted for a particular function, prime, Heb. 11:11; full age, years of discretion, Jn. 9:21, 23; perhaps, the whole duration of life, Mt. 6:27; Lk. 12:25; otherwise, stature, Lk. 2:52; 19:3; Eph. 4:13*

ηλικος.definition: as great as; how great, Col. 2:1; Jas. 3:5 (2x)*

ηλιος.definition: the sun, Mt. 13:43; 17:2; Mk. 1:32; meton. light of the sun, light, Acts 13:11

ημερα.definition: day, a day, the interval from sunrise to sunset, opp. to νύξ, Mt. 4:2; 12:40; Lk. 2:44; the interval of twenty-four hours, comprehending day and night, Mt. 6:34; 15:32; from the Hebrew, ἡμέρᾳ καὶ ἡμέρᾳ, day by day, every day, 2 Cor. 4:16; ἡμέραν ἐξ ἡμέρας, from day to day, continually, 2 Pet. 2:8; καθ’ ἡμέραν, every day, daily, Acts 17:17; Heb. 3:13; a point or period of time, Lk. 19:42; Acts 15:7; Eph. 6:13; a judgement, trial, 1 Cor. 4:3

ημιωριον.definition: also spelled ἡμίωρον, half an hour, Rev. 8:1*

ηπερ.definition: strengthened form of ἤ, than, Jn. 12:43*

ηρωδης.definition: Herod, pr. name. (1) Herod the Great, Mt. 2:1. (2) Herod Antipas, tetrarch of Galilee and Peraea, Mt. 14:1. (3) Herod Agrippa, Acts 12:1

ηρωδιανοι.definition: Herodians, partisans of Ἡρῴδης, Herod Antipas, Mt. 22:16; Mk. 3:6; 12:13*

ηρωδιας.definition: Herodias, pr. name, the wife of Herod Antipas, Mt. 14:3, 6; Mk. 6:17, 19, 22; Lk. 3:19*

ησαυ.definition: Esau, pr. name, indecl. (Gen. 27-28), Rom. 9:13; Heb. 11:20; 12:16*

ησυχαζω.definition: to be still, at rest; to live peaceably, be quiet, 1 Thess. 4:11; to rest from labor, Lk. 23:56; to be silent or quiet, acquiesce, to desist from discussion, Lk. 14:4; Acts 11:18; 21:14*

ησυχια.definition: rest, quiet, tranquillity; a quiet, tranquil life, 2 Thess. 3:12; silence, silent attention, Acts 22:2; 1 Tim. 2:11, 12*

ητοι.definition: whether, with an elevated tone, Rom. 6:16*

ητταομαι.definition: to be less, inferior to; to fare worse; by impl. to be overcome, vanquished, 2 Pet. 2:19, 20*

ηττημα.definition: an inferiority, to a particular standard; default, defeat, failure, shortcoming, Rom. 11:12; 1 Cor. 6:7*

θαλασσα.definition: the sea, Mt. 23:15, Mk. 9:42; a sea, Acts 7:36; an inland sea, lake, Mt. 8:24

θαλπω.definition: to impart warmth; met. to cherish, nurse, foster, comfort, Eph. 5:29; 1 Thess. 2:7*

θαμβεω.definition: to be astonished, amazed, awestruck Mt. 1:27; 10:24, 32*

θανατηφορος.definition: bringing or causing death, deadly, fatal, Jas. 3:8*

θανατος.definition: death, the extinction of life, whether naturally, Lk. 2:26; Mk. 9:1; or violently, Mt. 10:21; 15:4; imminent danger of death, 2 Cor. 4:11, 12; 11:23; in NT spiritual death, as opposed to ζωή in its spiritual sense, in respect of a forfeiture of salvation, Jn. 8:51; Rom. 6:16

θανατοω.definition: to put to death, deliver to death, Mt. 10:21; 26:59; Mk. 13:12; pass. to be exposed to imminent danger of death, Rom. 8:36; in NT met. to subdue, Rom. 8:13; pass. to be dead to, to be rid, parted from, as if by the intervention of death, Rom. 7:4

θαρα.definition: Terah, Abraham’s father, pr. name, indecl., Lk. 3:34*

θαρρεω.definition: to be confident, courageous, 2 Cor. 5:6, 8; 7:16; 10:1, 2; Heb. 13:6*

θαρσεω.definition: to be of good courage, be of good cheer, Mt. 9:2; to be confident, hopeful; to be bold, maintain a bold bearing, Mt. 9:22; 14:27; Mk. 6:50; 10:49; Jn. 16:33; Acts 23:11*

θαυμα.definition: a wonder; wonder, admiration, astonishment, 2 Cor. 11:14; Rev. 17:6*

θαυμαζω.definition: to admire, regard with admiration, wonder at, Lk. 7:9; Acts 7:31; to reverence, adore, 2 Thess. 1:10; absol. to wonder, be filled with wonder, admiration, or astonishment, Mt. 8:10; Lk. 4:22

θαυμασιος.definition: wonderful, admirable, marvellous; τὸ θαυμάσιον, a wonder, wonderful work, Mt. 21:15*
