τεκνον.definition: a child, a son or daughter, Mt. 2:18; Lk. 1:7; pl. descendants, posterity, Mt. 3:9; Acts 2:39; child, son, as a term of endearment, Mt. 9:2; Mk. 2:5; 10:24; pl. children, inhabitants, people, of a city, Mt. 23:37; Lk. 19:44; from the Hebrew, met. a child or son in virtue of discipleship, 1 Cor. 4:17; 1 Tim. 1:2; 2 Tim. 1:2; Tit. 1:4; Phlm. 10; 3 Jn. 4; a child in virtue of gracious acceptance, Jn. 1:12; 11:52; Rom. 8:16, 21; 1 Jn. 3:1; a child in virtue of spiritual conformity, Jn. 8:39; Phil. 2:15; 1 Jn. 3:10; a child of, one characterized by some condition or quality, Mt. 11:19; Eph. 2:3; 5:8; 1 Pet. 1:14; 2 Pet. 2:14

τεκτων.definition: an artisan; and spc. one who works with wood, a carpenter, Mt. 13:55; Mk. 6:3*

τελειος.definition: brought to completion; fully accomplished, fully developed, Jas. 1:4a; fully realized, thorough, 1 Jn. 4:18; complete, entire, as opposed to what is partial and limited, 1 Cor. 13:10; full grown of ripe age, 1 Cor. 14:20; Eph. 4:13; Heb. 5:14; fully accomplished in Christian enlightenment, 1 Cor. 2:6; Phil. 3:15; Col. 1:28; perfect in some point of character, without shortcoming in respect of a certain standard, Mt. 5:48; 19:21; Col. 4:12; Jas. 1:4b; 3:2; perfect, consummate, Rom. 12:2; Jas. 1:17, 25; compar. of higher excellence and efficiency, Heb. 9:11*

τελειοτης.definition: completeness, perfectness, Col. 3:14; ripeness of knowledge or practice, maturity, Heb. 6:1*

τελειοω.definition: to execute fully, discharge, Jn. 4:34; 5:36; 17:4; to reach the end of, run through, finish, Lk. 2:43; Acts 20:24; to consummate, place in a condition of finality, Heb. 7:19; to perfect a person, advance a person to final completeness of character, Heb. 2:10; 5:9; 7:28; to perfect a person, advance a person to a completeness of its kind, which needs no further provision, Heb. 9:9; 10:1, 14; pass. to receive fulfillment, Jn. 19:28; to be brought to the goal, to reach the end of one’s course, Lk. 13:32; Phil. 3:12; Heb. 11:40; 12:23; to be fully developed, 2 Cor. 12:9; Jas. 2:22; 1 Jn. 2:5; 4:12, 17; to be completely organized, to be closely embodied, Jn. 17:23

τελειωσις.definition: a completing; a fulfillment, an accomplishment of predictions, promised, etc., Lk. 1:45; finality of function, completeness of operation and effect, Heb. 7:11*

τελειωτης.definition: a finisher, one who completes and perfects a thing; one who brings through to final attainment, perfecter, Heb. 12:2*

τελεσφορεω.definition: to bring to maturity, as fruits, etc.; met. Lk. 8:14*

τελευταω.definition: to end, finish, complete; absol. to end

τελευτη.definition: a finishing, end; hence, end of life, death, decease, Mt. 2:15*

τελεω.definition: to finish, complete, conclude, an operation, Mt. 11:1; 13:53; 19:1; to finish a circuit, Mt. 10:23; to fulfil, to carry out into full operation, Rom. 2:27; Gal. 5:16; Jas. 2:8; to pay dues, Mt. 17:24; pass. to be fulfilled, realized, Lk. 12:50; 18:31; of time, to be ended, elapse, Rom. 15:8; 20:3, 5, 7

τελος.definition: an end attained, consummation; an end, closing act, Mt. 24:6, 14; 1 Cor. 15:24; full performance, perfect discharge, Rom. 10:4; fulfillment, realization, Lk. 22:37; final dealing, developed issue, Jas. 5:11; issue, final stage, 1 Cor. 10:11; issue, result, Mt. 26:58; Rom. 6:21, 22; 1 Pet. 1:9; antitypical issue, 2 Cor. 3:13; practical issue, 1 Tim. 1:5; ultimate destiny, Phil. 3:19; Heb. 6:8; 1 Pet. 4:17; a tax or dues, Mt. 17:25; Rom. 13:7; εἰς τέλος, to the full, 1 Thess. 2:16; εἰς τέλος, continually, Lk. 18:5; εἰς τέλος, μέχρι, ἄχρι τέλους, throughout, Mt. 10:22; Mk. 13:13; Jn. 13:1; Heb. 3:6, 14; 6:11; Rev. 2:26

τελωνης.definition: one who farms the public revenues; in NT a publican, collector of imposts, revenue officer, tax gatherer, Mt. 5:46; 9:10, 11; 10:3; Mk. 2:15f.; Lk. 3:12

τελωνιον.definition: a custom-house, toll house; collector’s office, Mt. 9:9; Mk. 2:14; Lk. 5:27*

τερας.definition: a prodigy, portent, Acts 2:19; a signal act, wonder, miracle, Mt. 13:22; Jn. 4:48; Acts 2:43

τερτιος.definition: Tertius, pr. name, a helper of Paul, Rom. 16:22*

τερτυλλος.definition: Tertullus, pr. name, an attorney, Acts 24:1f.*

τεταρτος.definition: fourth, Mt. 14:25; the fourth part, quarter, Rev. 6:8

τετραδιον.definition: a set of four; a detachment of four men, Acts 12:4*

τετραμηνος.definition: of four months, four months in duration, Jn. 4:35*

τετραπλους.definition: contracted form of τετραπλόος, four times (as much), fourfold, quadruple, Lk. 19:8*

τετρααρχεω.definition: also spelled τετραρχέω, be tetrarch, Lk. 3:1 (3x)*

τετρααρχης.definition: also spelled τετράρχης, a tetrarch, title of a prince, whose rank was lower than a king, Mt. 14:1; Lk. 3:19; 9:7; Acts 13:1*

τεφροω.definition: to reduce to ashes, to consume, destroy, 2 Pet. 2:6*

τεχνη.definition: art, skill, Acts 17:29; an art, trade, craft, Acts 18:3; Rev. 18:22*

τεχνιτης.definition: an artisan; workman, mechanic, Acts 19:24, 38; Rev. 18:22; an architect, builder, Heb. 11:10*

τηκω.definition: to dissolve; pass. to melt, 2 Pet. 3:12*

τηλικουτος.definition: so great, large, important, 2 Cor. 1:10; Heb. 2:3; Jas. 3:4; Rev. 16:18*

τηρεω.definition: to keep watch upon, guard, Mt. 27:36, 54; 28:4; Acts 12:6; to watch over protectively, guard, 1 Jn. 5:18; Rev. 16:15; to mark attentively, to heed, Rev. 1:3; to observe practically, keep strictly, Mt. 19:17; 23:3; 28:20; Mk. 7:9; Jn. 8:51; to preserve, shield, Jn. 17:15; to store up, reserve, Jn. 2:10; 12:7; 1 Pet. 1:4; 2 Pet. 2:4, 9, 17; to keep in custody, Acts 12:5; 16:23; to maintain, Eph. 4:3; 2 Tim. 4:7; to keep in a condition, Jn. 17:11, 12; 1 Cor. 7:37; 2 Cor. 11:9; 1 Tim. 5:22; Jas. 1:27

τηρησις.definition: a keeping, custody; meton. a place of custody, prison, ward, Acts 4:3; 5:18; met. practical observance, strict performance, 1 Cor. 7:19*

τιβεριας.definition: Tiberias, a city of Galilee, built by Herod Antipas, and named in honor of Tiberius, Jn. 6:1, 23; 21:1*

τιβεριος.definition: Tiberius, the third Roman emperor, 14–37 A.D., Lk. 3:1*

τιθημι.definition: by-form of τιθέω, to place, set, lay, Mt. 5:15; Mk. 6:56; Lk. 6:48; to produce at table, Jn. 2:10; to deposit, lay, Mt. 27:60; Lk. 23:53; Acts 3:2; to lay down, Lk. 19:21, 22; Jn. 10:11, 15, 17, 18; 1 Jn. 3:16; to lay aside, put off, Jn. 13:4; to allocate, assign, Mt. 24:51; Lk. 12:46; to set, appoint, Jn. 15:16; Acts 13:47; Heb. 1:2; to render, make, Mt. 22:44; Rom. 4:17; 1 Cor. 9:18; mid. to put in custody, Mt. 14:3; Acts 4:3; to reserve, Acts 1:7; to commit as a matter of charge, 2 Cor. 5:19; to set, with design, in a certain arrangement or position, Acts 20:28; 1 Cor. 12:18, 28; 1 Thess. 5:9; 1 Tim. 1:12; pass. 1 Tim. 2:7; 2 Tim. 1:11; 1 Pet. 2:8; τιθέναι τὰ γόνατα, to kneel down, Mk. 15:19; Lk. 22:41; Acts 7:60; 9:40; 20:36; 21:5; τίθεσθαι ἐν τῇ καρδίᾳ, to lay to heart, ponder, Lk. 1:66; also, εἰς τὰς καρδίας, Lk. 21:14; to design, resolve, Acts 5:4; also, ἐν πνεύματι, Acts 19:21; also, βουλήν, Acts 17:12; τίθεσθαι εἰς τὰ ὦτα, to give attentive audience to, to listen to retentively, Lk. 9:44

τικτω.definition: to bear, bring forth children, Mt. 1:21, 23; trop. to bear, produce, as the earth, yield, Heb. 6:7; met. to give birth to, Jas. 1:15

τιλλω.definition: to pull, pluck off, Mt. 12:1; Mk. 2:23; Lk. 6:1*

τιμαω.definition: to estimate in respect of worth; to hold in estimation, respect, honor, reverence, Mt. 15:4, 5, 8; 19:19; Mk. 7:10; to honor with reverent service, Jn. 5:23 (4x); 8:49; to treat with honor, manifest consideration towards, Acts 28:10; to treat graciously, visit with marks of favor, Jn. 12:26; mid. to price, Mt. 27:9

τιμη.definition: a pricing, estimate of worth; price, value, Mt. 27:9; price paid, Mt. 27:6; meton. a thing of price, and collectively, precious things, Rev. 21:24, 26; preciousness, 1 Pet. 2:7; substantial value, real worth, Col. 2:23; careful regard, honor, state of honor, dignity, Rom. 9:21; Heb. 5:4; honor conferred, observance, veneration, Rom. 2:7, 10; 12:10; mark of favor and consideration, Acts 28:10, honorarium, compensation, 1 Tim. 5:7

τιμιος.definition: precious, costly, of great price, 1 Cor. 3:12; Rev. 18:12; precious, dear, valuable, Acts 20:24; 1 Pet. 1:7, 19; honored, esteemed, respected, Acts 5:34; Heb. 13:4

τιμιοτης.definition: preciousness, costliness; meton. precious things, valuable merchandise, Rev. 18:19*

τιμοθεος.definition: Timotheus, Timothy, pr. name, son of Eunice, traveling companion of Paul, Acts 16:1; Rom. 16:21; 1 Cor. 4:17; 2 Cor. 1:1; Phil. 1:1; Col. 1:1; 1 Thess. 1:1; 1 Tim. 1:2, 18; 6:20; 2 Tim. 1:2

τιμωρεω.definition: to avenge, someone; in NT to punish, Acts 22:5; 26:11*

τινω.definition: to pay; to pay a penalty, incur punishment, 2 Thess. 1:9*

τις.definition: enclitic, indefinite pronoun, a certain one, someone, Mt. 12:47; pl. some, certain, several, Lk. 8:2; Acts 9:19; 2 Pet. 3:16; one, a person, Mt. 12:29; Lk. 14:8; Jn. 6:50; combined with the name of an individual, one, Mk. 15:21; as it were in a manner, a kind of, Heb. 10:27; Jas. 1:18; any whatever, Mt. 8:28; Lk. 11:36; Rom. 8:39; τις, somebody of consequence, Acts 5:36; τι, something of consequence, Gal. 2:6; 6:3; τι, anything at all, anything worth account, 1 Cor. 3:7; 10:19; τι at all, Phil. 3:15; Phlm. 18

τιτος.definition: Titus, pr. name, friend and helper of Paul, 2 Cor. 2:13; 7:6; Gal. 2:1; 2 Tim. 4:10; Tit. 1:4

τοιγαρουν.definition: well then, so then, wherefore, for that reason, 1 Thess. 4:8; Heb. 12:1*

τοιοσδε.definition: such as this; such as follows, 2 Pet. 1:17*

τοιουτος.definition: such, such like, of this kind or sort, Mt. 18:5; 19:14; such, so great, Mt. 9:8; Mk. 6:2; ὁ τοιοῦτος, such a fellow, Acts 22:22; also, the one alluded to, 1 Cor. 1:5; 2 Cor. 2:6, 7; 12:2, 3, 5

τοιχος.definition: a wall of a building, as distinct from a city wall or fortification (τεῖχος) Acts 23:3*

τοκος.definition: a bringing forth; offspring; met. produce of money lent, interest, usury, Mt. 25:27; Lk. 19:23*

τολμαω.definition: to assume resolution to do a thing, Mk. 15:43; Rom. 5:7; Phil. 1:14; to make up the mind, 2 Cor. 10:12; to dare, Acts 5:13; 7:32; to presume, Mt. 22:46; Mk. 12:34; Lk. 20:40; Jn. 21:12; Rom. 15:18; Jude 9; to have the face, 1 Cor. 6:1; absol. to assume a bold bearing, courageous, 2 Cor. 10:2; 11:21*

τολμητης.definition: one who is bold; in a bad sense, a presumptuous, audacious person, 2 Pet. 2:10*

τοπαζιον.definition: a topaz, a gem of a yellowish color, different from the modern topaz, Rev. 21:20*

τοπος.definition: a place, locality, Mt. 12:43; Lk. 6:17; a limited spot or ground, Mt. 24:15; 27:33; Jn. 4:20; Acts 6:13; a precise spot or situation, Mt. 28:6; Mk. 16:6; Lk. 14:9; a dwelling place, abode, mansion, dwelling, seat, Jn. 14:2, 3; Acts 4:31; a place of ordinary deposit, Mt. 26:52; a place, passage in a book, Lk. 4:17; place occupied, room, space, Lk. 2:7; 14:9, 22; place, opportunity, Acts 25:16; Heb. 12:17; place, condition, position, 1 Cor. 14:16

τοσουτος.definition: so great, so much, Mt. 8:10; 15:33; so long, of time, Jn. 14:9; pl. so many, Mt. 15:33

τοτε.definition: then, at that time, Mt. 2:17; 3:5; 11:20; then, Mt. 12:29; 13:26; 25:31; ἀπὸ τότε, from that time, Mt. 4:17; 16:21; ὁ τότε, which then was, 2 Pet. 3:6

τραπεζα.definition: a table, an eating table, Mt. 15:27; Mk. 7:28; Heb. 9:2; by impl. a meal, feast, Rom. 11:9; 1 Cor. 10:21; a table or counter of a money changer, Mt. 21:12; a bank, Lk. 19:23; by impl. pl. money matters, Acts 6:2

τραπεζιτης.definition: a money changer, broker, banker, who exchanges or loans money for a premium, Mt. 25:27*

τραχηλιζω.definition: pr. to grip the neck; to bend the neck back, so as to make bare or expose the throat, as in slaughtering animals, etc.; met. to lay bare in view, Heb. 4:13*

τραχηλος.definition: the neck, Mt. 18:6; Mk. 9:42; Lk. 15:20; 17:2; ἐπιθεῖναι ζυγὸν ἐπὶ τὸν τράχηλον, to put a yoke upon the neck of someone, met. to bind to a burdensome observance, Acts 15:10; 20:37; ὑποτιθέναι τὸν τράχηλον, to lay down one’s neck under the axe of the executioner, to imperil one’s life, Rom. 16:4*

τραχυς.definition: rough, rugged, uneven, Lk. 3:5; εἰς τραχεῖς τόπους, on a rocky shore, Acts 27:29*

τραχωνιτις.definition: Trachonitis, part of the tetrarchy of Herod Antipas, the north-easternmost habitable district east of the Jordan, Lk. 3:1*

τρεις.definition: Three Taverns, the name of a station on the Appian Way in Acts 28:15 (Τριῶν ταβερνῶν). The Latin taberna is an inn or shop

τρεμω.definition: to tremble, be agitated from fear, Mk. 5:33; Lk. 8:47; by impl. to fear, be afraid, 2 Pet. 2:10*

τρεφω.definition: to nourish; to feed, support, cherish, provide for,

τρεχω.definition: to run, Mt. 27:48; 28:8; to run a race, 1 Cor. 9:24; met. 1 Cor. 9:24, 26; Heb. 12:1; in NT to run a certain course of conduct, Gal. 5:7; to run a course of exertion, Rom. 9:16; Gal. 2:2; Phil. 2:16; to run, to progress freely, to advance rapidly, 2 Thess. 3:1

τρημα.definition: an aperture, hole, eye of a needle, Lk. 18:25*

τριβολος.definition: pr. three-pronged; a thistle, thorn, Mt. 7:16; Heb. 6:8*

τριβος.definition: a beaten track; a road, highway, Mt. 3:3; Mk. 1:3; Lk. 3:4*

τριετια.definition: the space of three years, Acts 20:31*

τριζω.definition: to creak, grating sound; to gnash, grind the teeth, Mk. 9:18*

τριμηνος.definition: the space of three months, Heb. 11:23*

τρις.definition: three times, thrice, Mt. 26:34, 75; ἐπὶ τρίς, to the extent of thrice, as many as three times, Acts 10:16; 11:10

τριστεγον.definition: the third floor, third story, Acts 20:9*

τριτον.definition: the accusative singular neuter form of tritos (G5569) used adverbially the third time, for the third time, Mk. 14:41; Lk. 23:22

τριτος.definition: third, Mt. 20:3; 27:64; ἐκ τρίτου, the third time, for the third time, Mt. 26:44; τὸ τρίτον, i.e. μέρος, the third part, Rev. 8:7, 12;

τριχινος.definition: of hair, made of hair, Rev. 6:12*

τρομος.definition: pr. a trembling, quaking; trembling from fear, fear, terror, agitation of mind, Mk. 16:8; anxious, under solemn responsibility, 1 Cor. 2:3; reverence, veneration, awe, 2 Cor. 7:15; Eph. 6:5; Phil. 2:12*

τροπη.definition: a turning round; a turning back, change, mutation, Jas. 1:17*

τροπος.definition: a turn; mode, manner, way, Jude 7; ὁν τρόπον, + καθ’ ὁν τρόπον, in which manner, as, even as, Mt. 23:37; Acts 15:11; κατὰ μηδένα τρόπον, in no way, by no means, 2 Thess. 2:3; ἐν παντὶ τρόπῳ, and παντὶ τρόπῳ in every way, by every means, Phil. 1:18; 2 Thess. 3:16; turn of mind or action, habit, disposition, Heb. 13:5

τροποφορεω.definition: to bear with the disposition, manners, and conduct of any one, to put up with, Acts 13:18*

τροφη.definition: nourishment, food, Mt. 3:4; Lk. 12:23; Jn. 4:8; Acts 9:19; Jas. 2:15; provision, Mt. 24:45; sustenance, maintenance, Mt. 10:10; met. nourishment of the mind, of spiritual nourishment, Heb. 5:12, 14

τροφιμος.definition: Trophimus, pr. name, of Ephesus, a friend of Paul, Acts 20:4; 21:29; 2 Tim. 4:20*

τροχια.definition: a track, way, path, met. Heb. 12:13*

τροχος.definition: pr. a runner; anything spherical, a wheel; drift, course, with which signification the word is usually written τρόχος, Jas. 3:6*

τρυγαω.definition: to harvest, gather, fruits, and spc. grapes, Lk. 6:44; Rev. 14:18, 19*

τρυμαλια.definition: a hole, perforation; eye of a needle, Mk. 10:25*

τρυπημα.definition: a hole; eye of a needle, Mt. 19:24*

τρωας.definition: Troas, a city on the coast of Phrygia, near the site of ancient Troy, Acts 16:8, 11; 20:5f.; 2 Cor. 2:12; 2 Tim. 4:13*. See PhotoGuide.

τρωγω.definition: pr. to crunch; to eat, Mt. 24:38; from the Hebrew, ἄρτον τρώγειν, to take food, partake of a meal, Jn. 6:54, 56-58; 13:18*

τυγχανω.definition: to hit an object; to attain to, to obtain, acquire, enjoy, Lk. 20:35; Acts 24:2; 26:22; 27:3; 2 Tim. 2:10; Heb. 8:6; 11:35; intrans. to happen, fall out, chance; common, ordinary, Acts 19:11; 28:2; as an adv., it may be, perchance, perhaps, 1 Cor. 16:6; εἰ τύχοι, as it so happens, as the case may be, 1 Cor. 14:10; 15:37*

τυμπανιζω.definition: pr. to beat a drum; to drum upon; in NT to torture, beat to death with rods and clubs, Heb. 11:35*

τυπος.definition: pr. an impress; a print, mark, of a wound inflicted, Jn. 20:25; a delineation; an image, statue, Acts 7:43; a formula, scheme, Rom. 6:17; form, Acts 23:25; a figure, counterpart, 1 Cor. 10:6; an anticipative figure, type, Rom. 5:14; a model pattern, Acts 7:44; Heb. 8:5; a moral pattern, Phil. 3:17; 1 Thess. 1:7; 2 Thess. 3:9; 1 Tim. 4:12; Tit. 2:7; 1 Pet. 5:3*

τυπτω.definition: to beat, strike, smite, Mt. 24:49; 27:30; to beat the breast, as expressive of grief or strong emotion, Lk. 18:13; 23:48; in NT met. to wound or shock the conscience of any one, 1 Cor. 8:12; from the Hebrew, to smite with evil, punish, Acts 23:3

τυριος.definition: a Tyrian, an inhabitant of Tyre, Acts 12:20*

τυρος.definition: Tyre, a celebrated and wealthy commercial city of Phoenicia, Mt. 11:21; 15:21; Mk. 7:24; Acts 21:3, 7. See PhotoGuide.

τυφλος.definition: blind, Mt. 9:27, 28; 11:5; 12:22; met. mentally blind, Mt. 15:14; 23:16

τυφλοω.definition: to blind, render blind; met. Jn. 12:40; 2 Cor. 4:4; 1 Jn. 2:11*

τυφοω.definition: to besmoke; met. to possess with the fumes of conceit; pass. to be demented with conceit, puffed up, 1 Tim. 3:6; 6:4; 2 Tim. 3:4; 1 Tim. 6:4*

τυφω.definition: to raise a smoke; pass. to emit smoke, smoke, smoulder, Mt. 12:20*

τυφωνικος.definition: stormy, tempestuous; with ἄνεμος it means hurricane, typhoon, whirlwind, Acts 27:14*

τυχικος.definition: Tychicus, pr. name, a friend or companion of Paul, Acts 20:4; Eph. 6:21; Col. 4:7; 2 Tim. 4:12; Tit. 3:12; Eph. subscr.; Col. subscr.*

υακινθινος.definition: hyacinthine, resembling the hyacinth in color, dark blue, Rev. 9:17*

υακινθος.definition: a hyacinth, a gem resembling the color of the hyacinth flower, dark blue, Rev. 21:20*

υαλινος.definition: made of glass; glassy, translucent, Rev. 4:6; 15:2*

υαλος.definition: a transparent stone, crystal; also, glass, Rev. 21:18, 21*

υβριζω.definition: to run riot; trans. to outrage, to treat in an arrogant or spiteful manner, Mt. 22:6; Lk. 11:45; 18:32; Acts 14:5; 1 Thess. 2:2*

υβρις.definition: insolence; shame, insult, outrage, 2 Cor. 12:10; damage by sea, Acts 27:10, 21*

υβριστης.definition: an overbearing, violent person, Rom. 1:30; 1 Tim. 1:13*

υγιαινω.definition: to be sound, in health, Lk. 5:31; 7:10; to be safe and sound, Lk. 15:27; 3 Jn. 2; met. to be healthful or sound in faith, doctrine, etc., Tit. 1:9, 13; 2:1, 2; sound, pure, uncorrupted, 1 Tim. 1:10; 6:3; 2 Tim. 1:13; 4:3*

υγιης.definition: sound, in health, Mt. 12:13; 15:31; met. of doctrine, sound, pure, wholesome, Tit. 2:8

υγρος.definition: pr. wet, moist, humid; used of a tree, full of sap, fresh, green, Lk. 23:31*

υδρια.definition: a water pot pitcher, Jn. 2:6, 7; a bucket, pail, Jn. 4:28*

υδροποτεω.definition: to be only a water drinker, 1 Tim. 5:23*

υδωρ.definition: water, Mt. 3:11, 16; 14:28, 29; 17:15; Jn. 5:3, 4, 7; watery fluid, Jn. 19:34; ὕδωρ ζῶν, living water, fresh flowing water, Jn. 4:11; met. of spiritual refreshment, Jn. 4:10; 7:38

υιοθεσια.definition: adoption, a placing in the condition of a son, Rom. 8:15, 23; 9:4; Gal. 4:5; Eph. 1:5*

υιος.definition: a son, Mt. 1:21, 25; 7:9; 13:55 freq.; a legitimate son, Heb. 12:8; a son artificially constituted, Acts 7:21; Heb. 11:24; a descendant, Mt. 1:1, 20; Mk. 12:35; in NT the young of an animal, Mt. 21:5; a spiritual son in respect of conversion or discipleship, 1 Pet. 5:13; from the Hebrew, a disciple, perhaps, Mt. 12:27; a son as implying connection in respect of membership, service, resemblance, manifestation, destiny, etc., Mt. 8:12; 9:15; 13:38; 23:15; Mk. 2:29; 3:17; Lk. 5:34; 10:6; 16:8; 20:34, 36; Jn. 17:12; Acts 2:25; 4:36; 13:10; Eph. 2:2; 5:6; Col. 3:6; 1 Thess. 5:5; 2 Thess. 2:3; υἱὸς θεοῦ, κ.τ.λ., son of God in respect of divinity, Mt. 4:3, 6; 14:33; Rom. 1:4; also, in respect of privilege and character, Mt. 5:9, 45; Lk. 6:35; Rom. 8:14, 19; 9:26; Gal. 3:26; ὁ υἱὸς τοῦ θεοῦ, κ.τ.λ., a title of the Messiah, Mt. 26:63; Mk. 3:11; 14:61; Jn. 1:34, 50; 20:31; υἱὸς ἀνθρώπου, a son of man, a man, Mk. 3:28; Eph. 3:5; Heb. 2:6; ὁ υἱὸς τοῦ ἀνθρώπου, a title of the Messiah, Mt. 8:20 freq.; as also, ὁ υἱὸς Δαβίδ, (Δαύιδ) Mt. 12:23

υλη.definition: wood, a forest; in NT firewood, a mass of fuel, Jas. 3:5*

υμνεω.definition: to hymn, praise, celebrate or worship with hymns, Acts 16:25; Heb. 2:12; absol. to sing a hymn, Mt. 26:30; Mk. 14:26*

υμνος.definition: a song; a hymn, song of praise to God, Eph. 5:19; Col. 3:16*

υπαγω.definition: to lead or bring under; to lead or bring from under; draw on or away; in NT intrans. to go away, depart, Mt. 8:4, 13; 9:6; ὕπαγε ὀπίσω μου, Get behind me! Away! Begone! Mt. 4:10; 16:23; to go, Mt. 5:41; Lk. 12:58; to depart life, Mt. 26:24

υπακοη.definition: a hearkening to; obedience, Rom. 5:19; 6:16; 1 Pet. 1:14; submissiveness, Rom. 16:19; 2 Cor. 7:15; submission, Rom. 1:5; 15:18; 16:26; 2 Cor. 10:5; Heb. 5:8; 1 Pet. 1:2, 22; compliance, Phlm. 21

υπακουω.definition: to give ear; to listen, Acts 12:13; to obey, Mt. 8:27; Mk. 1:27; in NT to render submissive acceptance, Acts 6:7; Rom. 6:17; 2 Thess. 1:8; Heb. 5:9; absol. to be submissive, Phil. 2:12

υπανδρος.definition: bound to a man, married, Rom. 7:2*

υπαντησις.definition: a meeting, act of meeting, Mt. 8:34; 25:1; Jn. 12:13*

υπαρξις.definition: goods possessed, substance, property, Acts 2:45; Heb. 10:34*

g5225.definition: to begin; to come into existence; to exist; to be, subsist, Acts 19:40; 28:18; to be in possession, to belong, Acts 3:6; 4:37; goods, possessions, property, Mt. 19:21; Lk. 8:3; to be, Lk. 7:25; 8:41

υπεικω.definition: to yield, give way; absol. to be submissive, Heb. 13:17*

υπεναντιος.definition: over against; contrast, adverse, Col. 2:14; ὁ ὑπεναντίος, an opponent, adversary, Heb. 10:27*

υπερ.definition: (1) gen., above, over; met. in behalf of, Mt. 5:44; Mk. 9:40; Jn. 17:19; instead of beneficially, Phlm. 13; in maintenance of, Rom. 15:8; for the furtherance of, Jn. 11:4; 2 Cor. 1:6, 8; for the realization of, Phil. 2:13; equivalent to περί, about, concerning, with the further signification of interest or concern in the subject, Acts 5:41; Rom. 9:27; 2 Cor. 5:12; 8:23; 2 Thess. 2:1. (2) acc., over, beyond; met. beyond, more than, Mt. 10:37; 2 Cor. 1:8; used after comparative terms, Lk. 16:8; 2 Cor. 12:13; Heb. 4:12. (3) in NT as an adv., in a higher degree, in fuller measure, 2 Cor. 11:23

υπεραιρω.definition: to raise or lift up above or over; mid. to lift up one’s self; met. to be over-elated, 2 Cor. 12:7 (2x); to bear one’s self arrogantly, to rear a haughty front, 2 Thess. 2:4*

υπερακμος.definition: past the bloom of life, past one’s prime, 1 Cor. 7:36*

υπερανω.definition: can function as an improper prep., above, over, far above; of place, Eph. 4:10; Heb. 9:5; of rank, dignity, Eph. 1:21*

υπερβαινω.definition: to overstep; to wrong, transgress, 1 Thess. 4:6*

υπερβαλλω.definition: pr. to cast or throw over or beyond, to overshoot; met. to surpass, excel; surpassing, 2 Cor. 3:10; 9:14; Eph. 1:19; 2:7; 3:19*

υπερβολη.definition: pr. a throwing beyond, an overshooting; extraordinary amount or character, transcendency, 2 Cor. 12:7; 4:7; καθ’ ὑπερβολήν, adverbially, exceedingly, extremely, Rom. 7:13; 2 Cor. 1:8; Gal. 1:13; a far better way, 1 Cor. 12:31; beyond all measure, 2 Cor. 4:17*

υπερεκεινα.definition: BDAG 1032, list as an adverb used with the gen., others list as an improper prep., beyond, 2 Cor. 10:16*

υπερεκπερισσου.definition: in over abundance; beyond all measure, superabundantly, Eph. 3:20; 1 Thess. 3:10; 5:13*

υπερεκχυννω.definition: to pour out above measure or in excess; pass. to run over, overflow, Lk. 6:38*

υπερεχω.definition: to hold above; intrans. to stand out above, to overtop; met. to surpass, excel, Phil. 2:3; 4:7; τὸ ὑπερέχον, excellence, preeminence, Phil. 3:8; to be higher, superior, Rom. 13:1; 1 Pet. 2:13*

υπερηφανος.definition: assuming, haughty, arrogant, Lk. 1:51; Rom. 1:30; 2 Tim. 3:2; Jas. 4:6; 1 Pet. 5:5*

υπερλιαν.definition: in the highest degree, preeminently, especially, superlatively, 2 Cor. 11:5; 12:11*

υπερνικαω.definition: to overpower in victory; to be abundantly victorious, prevail mightily, Rom. 8:37*

υπερογκος.definition: pr. swollen, overgrown; of language, swelling, pompous, boastful, 2 Pet. 2:18; Jude 16*

υπεροχη.definition: prominence; met., excellence, rare quality, 1 Cor. 2:1; eminent station, authority, 1 Tim. 2:2*

υπερπερισσευω.definition: to superabound; to abound still more, Rom. 5:20; mid. to be abundantly filled, overflow, 2 Cor. 7:4*

υπερπερισσως.definition: superabundantly, most vehemently, above all measure, Mk. 7:37*

υπερπλεοναζω.definition: to superabound, be in exceeding abundance, over exceed, 1 Tim. 1:14*

υπερφρονεω.definition: to have lofty thoughts, be elated, haughty, Rom. 12:3*

υπερωον.definition: the upper part of a house, upper room, or chamber, Acts 1:13; 9:37, 39; 20:8*

υπεχω.definition: pr. to hold under; to render, undergo, suffer, Jude 7*

υπηκοος.definition: giving ear; obedient, submissive, Acts 7:39; 2 Cor. 2:9; Phil. 2:8*

υπηρετεω.definition: to subserve, Acts 13:36; to relieve, supply, Acts 20:34; to render kind offices, Acts 24:23*

υπηρετης.definition: pr. an under-rower, a rower, one of a ship’s crew; a minister, attendant, servant; an attendant on a magistrate, officer, Mt. 5:25; an attendant or officer of the Sanhedrin, Mt. 26:58; an attendant, or servant of a synagogue, Lk. 4:20; a minister, attendant, assistant in any work, Lk. 1:2; Jn. 18:36

υπνος.definition: sleep, Mt. 1:24; Lk. 9:32; Jn. 11:13; Acts 20:9; met. spiritual sleep, religious slumber, Rom. 13:11*

υπο.definition: (1) gen., under; hence, used to express influence, causation, agency; by, Mt. 1:22 freq.; by the agency of, at the hands of, 2 Cor. 11:24; Heb. 12:3. (2) acc., under, with the idea of motion associated, Mt. 5:15; under, Jn. 1:49; 1 Cor. 10:1; under subjection to, Rom. 6:14; 1 Tim. 6:1; of time, at, about, Acts 5:21

υποβαλλω.definition: to cast under; met. to suggest, instigate, Acts 6:11*

υπογραμμος.definition: pr. a copy to write after; met. an example for imitation, pattern, 1 Pet. 2:21*

υποδειγμα.definition: a token, intimation; an example, model, proposed for imitation or admonition, Jn. 13:15; Heb. 4:11; Jas. 5:10; 2 Pet. 2:6; a copy, Heb. 8:5; 9:23*

υποδεικνυμι.definition: also spelled ὑποδεικνύω, to indicate, Acts 20:35; to intimate, suggest, show, prove, Mt. 3:7; Lk. 3:7; 6:47; 12:5; Acts 9:16*

υποδεχομαι.definition: to give reception to; to receive as a guest, welcome, entertain, Lk. 10:38; 19:6; Acts 17:7; Jas. 2:25*

υποδεω.definition: to bind under, mid. to bind under one’s self, put on one’s own feet, Acts 12:8; to shoe, Eph. 6:15; pass. to be shod, Mk. 6:9*

υποδημα.definition: anything bound under; a sandal, Mt. 3:11; 10:10

υποδικος.definition: under a legal process; also, under a judicial sentence; under verdict to an opposed party in a suit, liable to penalty, Rom. 3:19*

υποζυγιον.definition: an animal subject to the yoke, a beast of burden; in NT spc. an ass, donkey, Mt. 21:5; 2 Pet. 2:16*

υποζωννυμι.definition: to gird under, of persons; to undergird a ship with cables, chains, etc., Acts 27:17*

υποκατω.definition: can function as an improper prep., under, beneath, underneath, Mk. 6:11; 7:28; met. Heb. 2:8

υποκρινομαι.definition: to answer, respond; to act a part upon the stage; hence, to assume a counterfeit character; to pretend, feign, Lk. 20:20*

υποκρισις.definition: a response, answer; an over-acting personification, acting; hypocrisy, simulation, Mt. 23:28; Mk. 12:15; Lk. 12:1; Gal. 2:13; 1 Tim. 4:2; 1 Pet. 2:1*

υποκριτης.definition: the giver of an answer or response; a stageplayer, actor; in NT a moral or religious counterfeit, a hypocrite, Mt. 6:2, 5, 16; 7:5

υπολαμβανω.definition: to take up, by placing one’s self underneath what is taken up; to catch away, withdraw, Acts 1:9; to take up discourse by continuation; hence, to answer, Lk. 10:30; to take up a notion, to think, suppose, Lk. 7:43; Acts 2:15; receive as a guest, 3 Jn. 8*

υπολειπω.definition: to leave remaining, leave behind; pass. to be left surviving, Rom. 11:3*

υποληνιον.definition: a vat, placed under the press, ληνός, to receive the juice, Mk. 12:1*

υπομενω.definition: intrans. to remain or stay behind, when others have departed, Lk. 2:43; trans. to bear up under, endure, suffer patiently, 1 Cor. 13:7; Heb. 10:32; absol. to continue firmly, hold out, remain constant, persevere, Mt. 10:22; 24:13

υπομιμνησκω.definition: remember, remind, Jn. 14:26; Tit. 3:1; 2 Pet. 1:12; Jude 5; to suggest recollection of, remind others of, 2 Tim. 2:14; 3 Jn. 10; to call to mind, recollect, remember, Lk. 22:61*

υπομνησις.definition: a putting in mind, act of reminding, 2 Pet. 1:13; 3:1; remembrance, recollection, 2 Tim. 1:5*

υπομονη.definition: patient endurance, 2 Cor. 12:12; Col. 1:11; patient awaiting, Lk. 21:19; a patient frame of mind, patience, Rom. 5:3, 4; 15:4, 5; Jas. 1:3; perseverance, Rom. 2:7; endurance in adherence to an object, 1 Thess. 1:3; 2 Thess. 3:5; Rev. 1:9; ἐν ὑπομονῇ and δι’ ὑπομονῆς, constantly, perseveringly, Lk. 8:15; Rom. 8:25; Heb. 12:1; an enduring of affliction, etc., the act of suffering, undergoing, etc., 2 Cor. 1:6; 6:4

υπονοεω.definition: to suspect; to suppose, deem, Acts 13:25; 25:18; 27:27*

υποπλεω.definition: to sail under; to sail under the lee, or, to the south of, an island, etc., Acts 27:4, 7*

υποπνεω.definition: to blow gently, as the wind, Acts 27:13*

υποστασις.definition: pr. a standing under; a taking of a thing upon one’s self; an assumed position, an assumption of a specific character, 2 Cor. 11:17; an engagement undertaken with regard to the conduct of others, a vouching, 2 Cor. 9:4; or of one’s self, a pledged profession, Heb. 3:14; an assured impression, a mental realizing, Heb. 11:1; a substructure, basis; subsistence, essence, Heb. 1:3*

υποστελλω.definition: pr. to let down, to stow away; to draw back, withdraw, Gal. 2:12; mid. to shrink back, recoil, Heb. 10:38; to keep back, suppress, conceal, Acts 20:20, 27*

υποστρεφω.definition: to turn back, return, Mk. 14:40; Lk. 1:56; 2:39, 43, 45

υποστρωννυω.definition: to stow under, spread underneath, Lk. 19:36*

υποταγη.definition: subordination, 1 Tim. 3:4; submissiveness, obedience, 2 Cor. 9:13; Gal. 2:5; 1 Tim. 2:11*

υποτασσω.definition: to place or arrange under; to subordinate, 1 Cor. 15:27; to bring under influence, Rom. 8:20; pass. to be subordinated, 1 Cor. 14:32; to be brought under a state or influence, Rom. 8:20; mid. to submit one’s self, render obedience, be submissive, Lk. 2:51; 10:17

υποτιθημι.definition: to place under; to lay down the neck beneath the sword of the executioner, to set on imminent risk, Rom. 16:4; mid. to suggest, recommend to attention, 1 Tim. 4:6*

υποτρεχω.definition: to run under; as a nautical term, to sail under the lee of, Acts 27:16*

υποτυπωσις.definition: a sketch, delineation; a form, formula, presentment, sample, 2 Tim. 1:13; a pattern, a model representation, 1 Tim. 1:16*

υποφερω.definition: to bear under; to bear up under, support, sustain, 1 Cor. 10:13; to endure patiently, 1 Pet. 2:19; to undergo, 2 Tim. 3:11*

υπωπιαζω.definition: pr. to strike one upon the parts beneath the eye; to beat black and blue; hence, to discipline by hardship, coerce, 1 Cor. 9:27; met. to weary by continual importunities, pester, Lk. 18:5*

υς.definition: a hog, swine, boar, sow, 2 Pet. 2:22*

υσσωπος.definition: hyssop, in NT, however, not the plant usually so named, but probably the caper plant; a bunch of hyssop, Heb. 9:19; a hyssop stalk, Jn. 19:29*

υστερεω.definition: to be behind in place or time, to be in the rear; to fall short of, be inferior to, 2 Cor. 11:5; 12:11; to fail of, fail to attain, Heb. 4:1; to be in want of, lack, Lk. 22:35; to be wanting, Mk. 10:21; absol. to be defective, in default, Mt. 19:20; 1 Cor. 12:24; to run short, Jn. 2:3; mid. to come short of a privilege or standard, to miss, Rom. 3:23; absol. to come short, be below standard, 1 Cor. 1:7; to come short of sufficiency, to be in need, want, Lk. 15:14; 2 Cor. 11:9; Phil. 4:12; Heb. 11:37; to be a loser, suffer detriment, 1 Cor. 8:8; in NT ὑστερεῖν ἀπό, to be backwards with respect to, to slight, Heb. 12:15*

υστερημα.definition: a shortcoming, defect; personal shortcoming, 1 Cor. 16:17; Phil. 2:30; Col. 1:24; 1 Thess. 3:10; want, need, poverty, penury, Lk. 21:4; 2 Cor. 8:14; 9:12; 11:9*

g5306.definition: posterior in place or time; subsequent, later, last, finally, Mt. 21:31; 1 Tim. 4:1

υψηλος.definition: high, lofty, elevated, Mt. 4:8; 17:1; τὰ ὑψηλά, the highest heaven, Heb. 1:3; upraised, Acts 13:17; met. highly esteemed, Lk. 16:15; φρονεῖν τὰ ὑψηλά, to have lofty thoughts, be proud, arrogant, Rom. 12:16

υψηλοφρονεω.definition: to have lofty thoughts, be proud, haughty, 1 Tim. 6:17*

υψιστος.definition: highest, loftiest, most elevated; τὰ ὕψιστα, from the Hebrew, the highest heaven, Mt. 21:9; Mk. 11:10; met. ὁ ὕψιστος, the Most High, Mk. 5:7

υψος.definition: height, Eph. 3:18; Rev. 21:16; met. exaltation, dignity, eminence, Jas. 1:9; from the Hebrew, the height of heaven, Lk. 1:78; 24:49; Eph. 4:8*

υψοω.definition: to raise aloft, lift up, Jn. 3:14; 8:28; met. to elevate in condition, uplift, exalt, Mt. 11:23; 23:12; Lk. 1:52

υψωμα.definition: height, Rom. 8:39; a towering of self-conceit, presumption, 2 Cor. 10:5*

φαιλονης.definition: a thick cloak for travelling, with a hood, 2 Tim. 4:13*

φαινω.definition: to cause to appear, bring to light; absol. to shine, Jn. 1:5; 5:35; 2 Pet. 1:19; 1 Jn. 2:8; Rev. 1:16; 8:12; 21:23; mid./pass. to be seen, appear, be visible, Mt. 1:20; 2:7, 13, 19; τὰ φαινόμενα, things visible, things obvious to the senses, Heb. 11:3; φαίνομαι, to appear, seen, be in appearance, Mt. 23:27; Lk. 24:11; to appear in thought, seen in idea, be a notion, Mk. 14:64

φαλεκ.definition: Peleg, also spelled Φάλεγ, pr. name, indecl., Lk. 3:35*

φανερος.definition: apparent, manifest, clear, known, well-known, Mk. 4:22; 6:14; Gal. 5:19; in outward guise, externally, Rom. 2:28

φανεροω.definition: to bring to light, to set in a clear light; to manifest, display, Jn. 2:11; 7:4; 9:3; to show, Rom. 1:19; 2 Cor. 7:12; to declare, make known, Jn. 17:6; to disclose, Mk. 4:22; 1 Cor. 4:5; Col. 4:4; to reveal, Rom. 3:21; 16:26; Col. 1:26; to present to view, Jn. 21:1, 14; pass. to make an appearance, Mk. 16:12, 14; spc. of Christ, to be personally manifested, Jn. 1:31; Col. 3:4; 1 Pet. 1:20; 5:4; 1 Jn. 3:5; to be laid bare, appear in true character, 2 Cor. 5:10, 11

φανερως.definition: manifestly; clearly, plainly, distinctly, Acts 10:3; openly, publicly, Mk. 1:45; Jn. 7:10*

φανερωσις.definition: a disclosure, clear display, 2 Cor. 4:2; an outward evidencing of a latent principle, active exhibition, 1 Cor. 12:7*

φανταζω.definition: to render visible, cause to appear; pass. to appear, be seen; τὸ φανταζόμενον, the sight, spectacle, Heb. 12:21*

φαντασια.definition: pr. a rendering visible; a display; pomp, parade, Acts 25:23*

φαραω.definition: Pharaoh, pr. name, indecl., Acts 7:10, 13, 21; Rom. 9:17; Heb. 11:24*

φαρες.definition: Perezs, pr. name, indecl., Mt. 1:3; Lk. 3:33*

φαρισαιος.definition: a Pharisee, a follower of the sect of the Pharisees, a numerous and powerful sect of the Jews, distinguished for their ceremonial observances, and apparent sanctity of life, and for being rigid interpreters of the Mosaic law; but who frequently violated its spirit by their traditional interpretations and precepts, to which they ascribed nearly an equal authority with the OT Scriptures, Mt. 5:20; 12:2; 23:14

φαρμακεια.definition: employment of drugs for any purpose; sorcery, magic, enchantment, Rev. 18:23; Gal. 5:20*

φαρμακον.definition: a drug; an enchantment; magic potion, charm, Rev. 9:21*

φαυλος.definition: vile, refuse; evil, wicked; Jn. 3:20; 5:29; Rom. 9:11; 2 Cor. 5:10; Tit. 2:8; Jas. 3:16*

φειδομαι.definition: to spare; to be tender of, Rom. 8:32; to spare, in respect of hard dealing, Acts 20:29; Rom. 11:21; 1 Cor. 7:28; 2 Cor. 1:23; 13:2; 2 Pet. 2:4, 5; absol. to forbear, abstain, 2 Cor. 12:6*

φερω.definition: to bear, carry, Mk. 2:3; to bring, Mt. 14:11, 18; to conduct, Mt. 17:17; Jn. 21:18; to bear, endure, Rom. 9:22; Heb. 12:20; 13:13; to uphold, maintain, conserve, Heb. 1:3; to bear, bring forth, produce, Mk. 4:8; Jn. 12:24; 15:2; to bring forward, advance, allege, Jn. 18:29; Acts 25:7; 2 Pet. 2:11; to offer, ascribe, Rev. 21:24, 26; absol. used of a gate, to lead, Acts 12:10; pass. to be brought within reach, offered, 1 Pet. 1:13; to be brought in, to enter, Heb. 9:16; to be under a moving influence, to be moved, 2 Pet. 1:21; mid. to rush, sweep, Acts 2:2; to proceed, come forth, have utterance, 2 Pet. 1:17, 18, 21; to proceed, make progress, Heb. 6:1; used of a ship, to drive before the wind, Acts 27:15, 17

φευγω.definition: absol. to flee, take to flight, Mt. 2:13; 8:33; to shrink, stand fearfully aloof, 1 Cor. 10:14; to make escape, Mt. 23:33; trans. to shun, 1 Cor. 6:18; 1 Tim. 6:11; 2 Tim. 2:22; to escape, Heb. 11:34

φημη.definition: pr. a celestial or oracular utterance; an utterance; fame, rumor, report, Mt. 9:26; Lk. 4:14*

φημι.definition: to utter; to say, speak, Mt. 8:8; 14:8; 26:34, 61; to say, allege, affirm, Rom. 3:8

φθανω.definition: come before, precede, 1 Thess. 4:15; absol. to advance, make progress, 2 Cor. 10:14; Phil. 3:16; to come up with, come upon, be close at hand, Mt. 12:28; Lk. 11:20; 1 Thess. 2:16; to attain an object of pursuit, Rom. 9:31*

φθεγγομαι.definition: to emit a sound; to speak, Acts 4:18; 2 Pet. 2:16, 18*

φθειρω.definition: to spoil, ruin, 1 Cor. 3:17; 2 Cor. 7:2; to corrupt, morally deprave, 1 Cor. 15:33; 2 Cor. 11:3

φθονος.definition: envy, jealously, spite, Mt. 27:18; Mk. 15:10; Rom. 1:29; Gal. 5:21; Phil. 1:15; 1 Tim. 6:4; Tit. 3:3; Jas. 4:5; 1 Pet. 2:1*

φθορα.definition: corruption, decay, ruin, corruptibility, mortality, Rom. 8:21; 1 Cor. 15:42; meton. corruptible, perishable substance, 1 Cor. 15:50; killing, slaughter, 2 Pet. 2:12; spiritual ruin, Gal. 6:8; Col. 2:22; met. moral corruption, depravity, 2 Pet. 1:4; 2:19*

φιλαγαθος.definition: a lover of goodness, or, of the good, a fosterer of virtue, Tit. 1:8*

φιλαδελφεια.definition: Philadelphia, a city of Lydia, near Mount Tmolus, Rev. 1:11; 3:7*. See PhotoGuide.

φιλαδελφια.definition: brotherly love; in NT love of the Christian brotherhood, Rom. 12:10; 1 Thess. 4:9; Heb. 13:1; 1 Pet. 1:22; 2 Pet. 1:7*

φιλαδελφος.definition: brother-loving; in NT loving the members of the Christian brotherhood, 1 Pet. 3:8*

φιλανθρωπια.definition: philanthropy, love of mankind, Tit. 3:4; benevolence, humanity, Acts 28:2*

φιλεω.definition: pr. to manifest some act or token of kindness or affection; to kiss, Mt. 26:48; Mk. 14:44; Lk. 22:47; to love, regard with affection, have affection for, Mt. 10:37; Jn. 5:20; to like, be fond of, delight in a thing, Mt. 23:6; Rev. 22:15; to cherish inordinately, set store by, Jn. 12:25

φιληδονος.definition: pleasure-loving; a lover of pleasure, 2 Tim. 3:4*

φιλημων.definition: Philemon, pr. name, Phlm. 1; subscr. and title*

φιλιππησιος.definition: a Philippian, a citizen of Φίλιπποι, Philippi, Phil. 4:15; title*

φιλιπποι.definition: Philippi, a considerable city of Macedonia, east of Amphipolis, Acts 16:12; 20:6; Phil. 1:1; 1 Thess. 2:2; 1 & 2 Cor. subscr.*. See PhotoGuide.

φιλιππος.definition: Philip, pr. name . (1) Philip, the Apostle, Mt. 10:3. (2) Philip, the Evangelist, Acts 6:5. (3) Philip, son of Herod the Great and Mariamne, Mt. 14:3 . (4) Philip, son of Herod the Great and Cleopatra, Mt. 16:13; Lk. 3:1

φιλοθεος.definition: God-loving, pious; a lover of God, 2 Tim. 3:4*

φιλονεικια.definition: a love of contention; rivalry, contention, Lk. 22:24*

φιλονεικος.definition: fond of contention; contentious, disputatious, 1 Cor. 11:16*

φιλοξενια.definition: kindness to strangers, hospitality, Rom. 12:13; Heb. 13:2*

φιλοξενος.definition: kind to strangers, hospitable, 1 Tim. 3:2; Tit. 1:8; 1 Pet. 4:9*

φιλοπρωτευω.definition: to love or desire to be first or chief, affect pre-eminence, 3 Jn. 9*

φιλος.definition: loved, dear; devoted; Acts 19:31; as a subst., a friend, Lk. 7:6; 11:5, 6, 8; a congenial associate, Mt. 11:19; Lk. 7:34; Jas. 4:4; used as a word of courteous appellation, Lk. 14:10

φιλοσοφια.definition: a love of science; systematic philosophy; in NT the philosophy of the Jewish gnosis, Col. 2:8*

φιλοσοφος.definition: pr. a lover of science, a systematic philosopher, Acts 17:18*

φιλοτεκνος.definition: loving one’s children, duly parental, Tit. 2:4*

φιλοτιμεομαι.definition: pr. to be ambitious of honor; by impl. to exert one’s self to accomplish a thing, use one’s utmost efforts, endeavor earnestly, Rom. 15:20; 2 Cor. 5:9; 1 Thess. 4:11*

φιλοφρονως.definition: with kindly feeling or manner, courteously, Acts 28:7*

φιμοω.definition: to muzzle, 1 Tim. 5:18; met. and by impl. to silence, put to silence; pass. to be silent, speechless, Mt. 22:12, 34; 1 Pet. 2:15; Mk. 1:25; trop. pass. to be hushed, as winds and waves, Mk. 4:39; Lk. 4:35*

φλογιζω.definition: to set in a flame, kindle, inflame, Jas. 3:6 (2x)*

φλυαρεω.definition: to talk folly or nonsense; in NT trans., bring unjustified charges against, 3 Jn. 10*

φοβεομαι.definition: has an active form, φοβέω (G5828), but only occurs as a passive (deponent) in our literature, to fear, dread, Mt. 10:26; 14:5; to fear reverentially, to reverence, Mk. 6:20; Lk. 1:50; Acts 10:2; Eph. 5:33; Rev. 11:18; to be afraid to do a thing, Mt. 2:22; Mk. 9:32; to be reluctant, to scruple, Mt. 1:20; to fear, be apprehensive, Acts 27:17; 2 Cor. 11:3; 12:20; to be fearfully anxious, Heb. 4:1; absol. to be fearful, afraid, alarmed, Mt. 14:27; 17:6, 7; Mk. 16:8; to be fearfully impressed, Rom. 11:20

φοβητρον.definition: something which inspires terror; terrible sight or event, Lk. 21:11*

φοβος.definition: fear, terror, affright, Mt. 14:26; Lk. 1:12; astonishment, amazement, Mt. 28:8; Mk. 4:41; trembling concern, 1 Cor. 2:3; 2 Cor. 7:15; meton. a terror, an object or cause of terror, Rom. 13:5; reverential fear, awe, Acts 9:31; Rom. 3:18; respect, deference, Rom. 13:7; 1 Pet. 2:18

φοινικη.definition: Phoenice, Phoenicia, a country on the east of the Mediterranean, between Palestine and Syria, anciently celebrated for commerce, Acts 11:19; 15:3; 21:2*

φοινιξ.definition: Phoenix, Phoenice, a city, with a harbor, on the southeast coast of Crete, Acts 27:12*

φονευς.definition: a homicide, murderer, Mt. 22:7; Acts 3:14; 7:52; 28:4; 1 Pet. 4:15; Rev. 21: 8; 22:15*

φονευω.definition: to put to death, kill, stay, Mt. 23:31, 35; absol. to commit murder, Mt. 5:21

φονος.definition: a killing, slaughter, murder, Mt. 15:19; Mk. 7:21; 15:7

φορεω.definition: to bear; to wear, Mt. 11:8; Jn. 19:5; Rom. 13:4; 1 Cor. 15:49; Jas. 2:3

φορον.definition: a forum, marketplace; Φόρον Ἀππίου, Forum Appii, the name of a small town on the Appian way, according to Antoninus, forty-three Roman miles from Rome, or about forty English miles, Acts 28:15*

φορος.definition: tribute, tax, strictly such as is laid on dependent and subject people, Lk. 20:22; 23:2; Rom. 13:6, 7*

φορτιζω.definition: to load, burden; met. Mt. 11:28; Lk. 11:46*

φορτιον.definition: a load, burden; of a ship, freight, cargo, Acts 27:10; met. a burden of imposed precepts, etc., Mt. 11:30; 23:4; Lk. 11:46 (2x); of faults, sins, etc., Gal. 6:5*

φραγμος.definition: a fence, hedge; a hedgeside path, Mt. 21:33; Mk. 12:1; Lk. 14:23; met. a parting fence, Eph. 2:14*

φραζω.definition: pr. to propound in distinct terms, to tell; in NT to explain, interpret, expound, Mt. 15:15*

φρασσω.definition: to fence in; by impl. to obstruct, stop, close up, Heb. 11:33; met. to silence, put to silence, Rom. 3:19; 2 Cor. 11:10*

φρεαρ.definition: a well, cistern, Lk. 14:5; Jn. 4:11, 12; a pit, Rev. 9:1, 2*

φρεναπαταω.definition: to deceive the mind; to deceive, impose on, Gal. 6:3*

φρην.definition: pr. the diaphragm, midriff; the mind, intellect, understanding, 1 Cor. 14:20 (2x)*

φρισσω.definition: to be ruffled, to bristle; to shiver, shudder from fear, Jas. 2:19*

φρονεω.definition: to think, to mind; to be of opinion, Acts 28:22; Phil. 1:7; to take thought, be considerate, Phil. 4:10; to entertain sentiments or inclinations of a specific kind, to be minded, Rom. 12:16; 15:5; 1 Cor. 13:11; 2 Cor. 13:11; Gal. 5:10; Phil. 2:2; 3:16; 4:2; to be in a certain frame of mind, Rom. 12:3; Phil. 2:5; to imagine, entertain conceit, 1 Cor. 4:6; to heed, pay regard to, Rom. 14:6; to incline to, be set upon, mind, Mt. 16:23; Mk. 8:33; Rom. 8:5; Phil. 3:15, 19; Col. 3:2

φρονημα.definition: frame of thought, will, aspirations, Rom. 8:6, 7, 27*

φρονησις.definition: a thoughtful frame, sense, rightmindedness, Lk. 1:17; intelligence, Eph. 1:8*

φρονιμος.definition: considerate, thoughtful, prudent, discreet, Mt. 7:24; 10:16; 24:45; 25:2, 4, 8, 9; Lk. 12:42; sensible, wise, Rom. 11:25; 12:16; 1 Cor. 4:10; 10:15; 2 Cor. 11:19*

φροντιζω.definition: to be considerate, be careful, Tit. 3:8*

φρουρεω.definition: to keep watch; trans. to guard, watch, with a military guard, 2 Cor. 11:32; to keep in a condition of restraint, Gal. 3:23; to keep in a state of settlement or security, Phil. 4:7; 1 Pet. 1:5*

φρυασσω.definition: pr. to snort, neigh, stamp, etc.; as a high-spirited horse; hence, to be noisy, fierce, insolent, and tumultuous, to rage, tumultuate, Acts 4:25*

φρυγανον.definition: a dry twig, branch, etc., Acts 28:3*

φρυγια.definition: Phrygia, an inland province of Asia Minor, Acts 2:10; 16:6; 18:23; 1 Tim. subscr.*

φυλακη.definition: a keeping watch, ward, guard, Lk. 2:8; a place of watch, Rev. 18:2; a watch, guard, body of guards, Acts 12:10; ward, custody, imprisonment, 2 Cor. 6:5; 11:23; Heb. 11:36; prison, 1 Pet. 3:19; a place of custody, prison, Mt. 14:10; 25:39, 44; a watch or division, of the night, which in the time of our Savior was divided into watches of three hours each, called ὀψέ, μεσονύκτιον, ἀλεκτοροψωνία and πρωία, or πρωί, Mt. 14:25; 24:43; Mk. 6:48; Lk. 12:38 (2x)

φυλακιζω.definition: to deliver into custody, put in prison, imprison, Acts 22:19*

φυλακτηριον.definition: the station of a guard or watch; a preservative, safeguard; hence, a phylactery or amulet, worn about the person; from which circumstance the word is used in the NT as a term for the Jewish Tephillin or prayer-case, which took their rise from the injunction in Deut. 6:8; 11:18; Mt. 23:5*

φυλασσω.definition: to be on watch, keep watch, Lk. 2:8; to have in keeping, Acts 20:20; to have in custody, Acts 28:16; to keep under restraint, confine, Lk. 8:29; Acts 12:4; 23:35; to guard, defend, Lk. 11:21; to keep safe, preserve, Jn. 12:25; 17:12; 2 Thess. 3:3; 2 Pet. 2:5; Jude 24; to keep in abstinence, Acts 21:25; 1 Jn. 5:21; to observe a matter of injunction or duty, Mk. 10:20; Lk. 11:28; Acts 7:53; 16:4; 21:24; mid. to be on one’s guard, beware, Lk. 12:15; 2 Tim. 4:15; 2 Pet. 3:17

φυλη.definition: a tribe, Mt. 19:28; 24:30; Lk. 2:36; a people, nation, Rev. 1:7; 5:9

φυραμα.definition: that which is mingled and reduced to a uniform consistence, by kneading, beating, treading, etc.; a mass of potter’s clay, Rom. 9:21; of dough, 1 Cor. 5:6, 7; Gal. 5:9; met. Rom. 11:16*

φυσικος.definition: natural, agreeable to nature, Rom. 1:26, 27; following the instinct of nature, as animals, 2 Pet. 2:12*

φυσιοω.definition: to inflate puff up; met. to inflate with pride and vanity, 1 Cor. 8:1; pass. to be inflated with pride, to be proud, vain, arrogant, 1 Cor. 4:6, 18, 19; 5:2; 13:4; Col. 2:18*

φυσις.definition: essence, Gal. 4:8; native condition, birth, Rom. 2:27; 11:21, 24; Gal. 2:15; Eph. 2:3; native species, kind, Jas. 3:7; nature, natural frame, 2 Pet. 1:4; nature, native instinct, Rom. 2:14; 1 Cor. 11:14; nature, prescribed course of nature, Rom. 1:26*

φυσιωσις.definition: pr. inflation; met. inflation of mind, pride, 2 Cor. 12:20*

φυτεια.definition: plantation, the act of planting; a plant, met. Mt. 15:13*

φυτευω.definition: to plant, set, Mt. 21:33; Lk. 13:6; 17:6, 28; 20:9; met. Mt. 15:13; Mk. 12:1; to plant the Gospel, 1 Cor. 3:6, 7, 8; 9:7*

φυω.definition: to generate, produce; pass. to be generated, produced; of plants, to germinate, sprout, Lk. 8:6, 8; intrans. to germinate, spring or grow up, Heb. 12:15*

φωλεος.definition: a den, lair, burrow, Mt. 8:20; Lk. 9:58*

φωνεω.definition: to sound, utter a sound; of the cock, to crow, Mt. 26:34, 74, 75; to call, or cry out, exclaim, Lk. 8:8, 54; 16:24; 23:46; to call to, Mt. 27:47; Mk. 3:31; to call, Jn. 13:13; to call, summon, Mt. 20:32; to invite to a feast, Lk. 14:12

φωνη.definition: a sound, Mt. 24:31; Jn. 3:8; Rev. 4:5; 8:5; a cry, Mt. 2:18; an articulate sound, voice, Mt. 3:3, 17; 17:5; 27:46, 50; voice, speech, discourse, Jn. 10:16, 27; Acts 7:31; 12:22; 13:27; Heb. 3:7, 15; tone of address, Gal. 4:20; language, tongue, dialect, 1 Cor. 14:10

φως.definition: light, Mt. 17:2; 2 Cor. 4:6; daylight, broad day, Mt. 10:27; Lk. 12:3; radiance, blaze of light, Mt. 4:16; Acts 9:3; 12:7; an instrument or means of light, a light, Mt. 6:23; Acts 16:29; a fire, Mk. 14:54; Lk. 22:56; from the Hebrew, the light of God’s presence, 2 Cor. 11:14; 1 Tim. 6:16; met. the light of Divine truth, spiritual illumination, Lk. 16:8; Jn. 3:19; Rom. 13:12; Eph. 5:8; 1 Pet. 2:9; 1 Jn. 1:7; 2:8, 9, 10; a source or dispenser of spiritual light, Mt. 5:14; Jn. 1:4, 5, 7, 8, 9; 8:12; 9:5; pure radiance, perfect brightness, 1 Jn. 1:5

φωστηρ.definition: a cause of light, illuminator; a light, luminary, star, Phil. 2:15; radiance, or, luminary, Rev. 21:11*

φωσφορος.definition: light-bringing; i.e. ἀστήρ, Lucifer, the morning star, met. 2 Pet. 1:19*

φωτεινος.definition: radiant, lustrous, Mt. 17:5; enlightened, illuminated, Mt. 6:22; Lk. 11:34, 36 (2x)*

φωτιζω.definition: to light, give light to, illuminate, shine upon, Lk. 11:36; Rev. 18:1; 21:23; met. to enlighten spiritually, Jn. 1:9; Eph. 1:18; 3:9; Heb. 6:4; 10:32; to reveal, to bring to light, make known, 1 Cor. 4:5; 2 Tim. 1:10; intrans. shine, Rev. 22:5*

φωτισμος.definition: illumination; a shining forth, bringing to light, enlightenment, 2 Cor. 4:4, 6*

χαιρω.definition: to rejoice, be glad, be joyful, be full of joy, Mt. 2:10; 5:12; 18:13; Mk. 14:11; Rom. 12:12; 2 Cor. 2:3; a term of salutation, Hail! Mt. 26:49; λέγω χαίρειν, to greet, 2 Jn. 10:11; an epistolary forth, Health! Acts 15:23

χαλαω.definition: to slacken; to let down, lower, Mk. 2:4; Lk. 5:4, 5; Acts 9:25; 27:17, 30; 1 Cor. 11:33*

χαλδαιος.definition: a Chaldean, a native of Chaldea, a country of central Asia, which seems to have included Mesopotamia, Acts 7:4*

χαλεπος.definition: hard, rugged; furious, ferocious, Mt. 8:28; difficult, trying, 2 Tim. 3:1*

χαλιναγωγεω.definition: pr. to guide with a bridle; met. to bridle, control, sway, Jas. 1:26; 3:2*

χαλκευς.definition: pr. a coppersmith; hence, genr. a worker in metals, smith, 2 Tim. 4:14*

χαλκηδων.definition: chalcedony, the name of a gem, generally of a whitish, bluish, or gray color, susceptible of a high and beautiful polish, and of which there are several varieties, as the onyx, modern carnelian, etc., Rev. 21:19*

χαλκιον.definition: a vessel, copper, brazen utensil, Mk. 7:4*

χαλκολιβανον.definition: orichalcum, fine bronze, a factitious metal of which there were several varieties, the white being of the highest repute, or, deep-tinted frankincense, Rev. 1:15; 2:18*

χαλκος.definition: copper, also, bronze, Rev. 18:12; a brazen musical instrument, 1 Cor. 13:1; copper money, Mt. 10:9; money in general, Mk. 6:8; 12:41*

χαλκους.definition: contracted form of χάλκεος, made of copper, brass, or bronze, Rev. 9:20*

χαμαι.definition: on the ground, to the earth, Jn. 9:6; 18:6*

χανααν.definition: Canaan, the ancient name of Palestine, Acts 7:11; 13:19

χαρα.definition: joy, gladness, rejoicing, Mt. 2:10; 13:20, 44; 28:8; meton, joy, cause of joy, occasion of rejoicing, Lk. 2:10; Phil. 4:1; 1 Thess. 2:19, 20; bliss, Mt. 25:21, 23

χαραγμα.definition: an imprinted mark, Rev. 13:16, 17; 14:9, 11; 16:2; 19:20; 20:4; sculpture, Acts 17:29*

χαραξ.definition: a stake; a military palisade, rampart, formed from the earth thrown out of the ditch, and stuck with sharp stakes or palisades, Lk. 19:43*

χαριζομαι.definition: to gratify; to bestow in kindness, grant as a free favor, Lk. 7:21; Rom. 8:32; to grant the deliverance of a person in favor to the desire of others, Acts 3:14; 27:24; Phlm. 22; to sacrifice a person to the demand of enemies, Acts 25:11; to remit, forgive, Lk. 7:42; 2 Cor. 2:7, 10

χαριν.definition: the acc. sg form of the noun χάριν which can be used as an improper prep., on account of, Lk. 7:47; Eph. 3:1, 14; 1 Jn. 3:12; for the sake of, in order to, Gal. 3:19; Tit. 1:5, 11; Jude 16; on the score of, 1 Tim. 5:14*

χαρις.definition: pleasing show, charm; beauty, gracefulness; a pleasing circumstance, matter of approval, 1 Pet. 2:19, 20; kindly bearing, graciousness, Lk. 4:22; a beneficial opportunity, benefit, 2 Cor. 1:15; Eph. 4:29; a charitable act, generous gift, 1 Cor. 16:3; 2 Cor. 8:4, 6; an act of favor, Acts 25:3; favor, acceptance, Lk. 1:30, 52; Acts 2:47; 7:10, 46; free favor, free gift, grace, Jn. 1:14, 16, 17; Rom. 4:4, 16; 11:5, 6; Eph. 2:5, 8; 1 Pet. 3:7; free favor specially manifested by God towards man in the Gospel scheme, grace, Acts 15:11; Rom. 3:24; 5:15, 17, 20, 21; 6:1; 2 Cor. 4:15; a gracious provision, gracious scheme, grace, Rom. 6:14, 15; Heb. 2:9; 12:28; 13:9; gracious dealing from God, grace, Acts 14:26; 15:40; Rom. 1:7; 1 Cor. 1:4; 15:10; Gal. 1:15; a commission graciously devolved by God upon a human agent, Rom. 1:5; 12:3; 15:15; 1 Cor. 3:10; 2 Cor. 1:12; Gal. 2:9; Eph. 3:8; grace, graciously bestowed divine endowment or influence, Lk. 2:40; Acts 4:33; 11:23; Rom. 12:6; 2 Cor. 12:9; grace, Acts 11:43; Rom. 5:2; Gal. 5:4; 2 Pet. 3:18; an emotion correspondent to what is pleasing or kindly; sense of obligation, Lk. 17:9; a grateful frame of mind, 1 Cor. 10:30; thanks, Lk. 6:32, 33, 34; Rom. 6:17; 1 Cor. 15:57; χάριν or χάριτας καταθέσθαι, to oblige, gratify, Acts 24:27; 25:9

χαρισμα.definition: a free favor, free gift, Rom. 5:15, 16; 6:23; 2 Cor. 1:11; benefit, Rom. 1:11; a divinely conferred endowment, 1 Cor. 12:4, 9, 28, 30, 31

χαριτοω.definition: to favor, visit with favor, to make an object of favor, to gift, Eph. 1:6; pass. to be visited with free favor, be an object of gracious visitation, Lk. 1:28*

χαρραν.definition: Charran, a city in the northern part of Mesopotamia, Acts 7:2, 4*. See PhotoGuide.

χειλος.definition: a lip, and pl. τὰ χείλη, the lips, Mt. 15:8; Mk. 7:6; Rom. 3:13; Heb. 13:15; 1 Pet. 3:10; trop. χεῖλος τῆς θαλάσσης, the seashore, Heb. 11:12; meton. language, dialect, 1 Cor. 14:21*

χειμαζω.definition: to excite a tempest, toss with a tempest; pass. to be storm-tossed, Acts 27:18*

χειμων.definition: stormy weather, Mt. 16:3; a storm, tempest, Acts 27:20; winter, Mt. 24:20; Mk. 13:18; Jn. 10:22; 2 Tim. 4:21*

χειρ.definition: a hand, Mt. 3:12; 4:6; 8:15 freq.; from the Hebrew, χεὶρ Κυρίου, a special operation of God, Acts 11:21; 13:3; ἐν χειρί, by agency, Acts 7:35; Gal. 3:19

χειραγωγεω.definition: to lead by the hand, Acts 9:8; 22:11*

χειραγωγος.definition: one who leads another by the hand, Acts 13:11*

χειρογραφον.definition: handwriting; a written form, literal instrument, as distinguished from a spiritual dispensation, Col. 2:14*

χειροποιητος.definition: made by hand, artificial, material, Mk. 14:58; Acts 7:48; 17:24; Eph. 2:11; Heb. 9:11, 24*

χειροτονεω.definition: to stretch out the hand; to constitute by voting; to appoint, constitute, Acts 14:23; 2 Cor. 8:19*

χειρων.definition: worse, Mt. 9:16; more severe, Jn. 5:14; Heb. 10:29

χερουβ.definition: also spelled Χερουβείν and Χερουβίμ, indecl. cherub, a two-winged figure over the ark of the covenant, Heb. 9:5*

χιλιαρχος.definition: commander of a thousand men; hence, genr. a commander, military chief, Mk. 6:21; Rev. 6:15; 19:18; spc. a legionary tribune, Acts 21:31, 32, 33, 37; the prefect of the temple, Jn. 18:12

χιλιας.definition: the number one thousand, a thousand, Lk. 14:31; Acts 4:4

χιτων.definition: a tunic, vest, the inner garment which fitted close to the body, having armholes, and sometimes sleeves, and reaching below the knees, worn by both sexes, Mt. 5:40; 10:10; pl. χιτῶνες, clothes, garments in general, Mk. 14:63

χλαμυς.definition: chlamys, a type of cloak; a Roman military commander’s cloak, Mt. 27:28, 31*

χλωρος.definition: pale green; green, verdent, Mk. 6:39; Rev. 8:7; 9:4; pale, sallow, Rev. 6:8*

χοινιξ.definition: a choenix, an Attic measure for things dry, being the 48th part of a medimnus, consequently equal to the 8th part of the Roman modius, and nearly equivalent to about one quart, being considered a sufficient daily allowance for the sustenance of one man, Rev. 6:6 (2x)*

χοιρος.definition: pr. a young swine; a swine, hog, or sow, Mt. 8:30, 31, 32

χολαω.definition: pr. to be melancholy; used later as an equivalent to χολοῦμαι, to be angry, incensed, Jn. 7:23*

χολη.definition: the bile, gall; in NT a bitter ingredient, as wormwood, Mt. 27:34; χολὴ πικρίας, intense bitterness, met. thorough disaffection to divine truth, utter estrangement, Acts 8:23*

χοραζιν.definition: also spelled Χωραζίν and Χοραζείν, Chorazin, a town of Galilee, probably near Bethsaida and Capernaum, indecl., Mt. 11:21; Lk. 10:13*. See PhotoGuide.

χορηγεω.definition: to lead a chorus; at Athens, to defray the cost of a chorus; hence, to supply funds; to supply, furnish, 2 Cor. 9:10; 1 Pet. 4:11*

χορταζω.definition: pr. to feed or fill with grass, herbage, etc., to fatten; used of animals of prey, to satiate, gorge, Rev. 19:21; of persons, to satisfy with food, Mt. 14:20; 15:33, 37; met. to satisfy the desire of any one, Mt. 5:6

χορτασμα.definition: pasture, provender for cattle; food, provision, sustenance, for men, Acts 7:11*

χορτος.definition: an enclosure; pasture ground; fodder for beasts; in NT herbage, grass, Mt. 6:30; 14:19; a plant of corn, Mt. 13:26; Mk. 4:28

χους.definition: uncontracted form χόος, dust, acc., χοῦν, Mk. 6:11; Rev. 18:19*

χραομαι.definition: to use, make use of, employ, Acts 27:17; 1 Cor. 7:31; to take advantage of, 1 Cor. 7:21; 9:12, 15; to use, to treat, behave towards, Acts 27:3; 2 Cor. 13:10

χρεια.definition: use; need, necessity, requisiteness, Eph. 4:29; Heb. 7:11; personal need, an individual want, Acts 20:34; Rom. 12:13; Phil. 2:25; 4:16, 19; χρείαν ἔχω, to need, require, want, Mt. 6:8; 14:16; Mk. 2:25; Jn. 2:25; ἐστὶ χρεία, there is need, Lk. 10:42; τὰ πρὸς τὴν χρείαν, necessary things, Acts 28:10; a necessary business, affair, Acts 6:3

χρη.definition: impersonal verb, there is need or occasion, it is necessary, it is requisite; it becomes, it is proper, Jas. 3:10*

χρηζω.definition: to need, want, desire, Mt. 6:32; Lk. 11:8; 12:30; Rom. 16:2; 2 Cor. 3:1*

χρημα.definition: anything useful, or needful; pl. wealth, riches, Mk. 10:23; Lk. 18:24; money, Acts 8:18, 20; 24:26; sg. price, Acts 4:37*

χρηματιζω.definition: to have dealings, transact business; to negotiate; to give answer on deliberation; in NT to utter a divine communication, Heb. 12:25; pass. to be divinely instructed, receive a revelation or warning from God, Mt. 2:12, 22; Lk. 2:26; Acts 10:22; Heb. 8:5; 11:7; intrans. to receive an appellation, Acts 11:26; Rom. 7:3*

χρηματισμος.definition: in NT a response from God, a divine communication, oracle, Rom. 11:4*

χρησις.definition: use, employment; manner of using, Rom. 1:26, 27*

χρηστευομαι.definition: to be gentle, benign, kind, 1 Cor. 13:4*

χρηστος.definition: useful, profitable; good, agreeable, Lk. 5:39; easy, as a yoke, Mt. 11:30; gentle, benign, kind, obliging, gracious, Lk. 6:35; Eph. 4:32; Rom. 2:4; 1 Pet. 2:3; good in character, disposition, etc., virtuous, 1 Cor. 15:33*

χρηστοτης.definition: pr. goodness, kindness, gentleness, Rom. 2:4; 11:22(3x); 2 Cor. 6:6; Gal. 5:22; Col. 3:12; Tit. 3:4; kindness shown, beneficence, Eph. 2:7; goodness, virtue, Rom. 3:12*

χρισμα.definition: pr. anything which is applied by smearing; ointment; in NT an anointing, in the reception of spiritual privileges, 1 Jn. 2:20, 27*

χριστιανος.definition: a Christian, follower of Christ, Acts 11:26; 26:28; 1 Pet. 4:16*

χριστος.definition: pr. anointed; ὁ Χριστός, the Christ, the Anointed One, i.e. Μεσσίας, the Messiah, Mt. 1:16, 17; Jn. 1:20, 25, 42; meton. Christ, the word or doctrine of Christ, 2 Cor. 1:19; 21; Eph. 4:20; Christ, a truly Christian frame of doctrine and affection, Rom. 8:10; Gal. 4:19; Christ, the Church of Christ, 1 Cor. 12:12; Christ the distinctive privileges of the Gospel of Christ, Gal. 3:27; Phil. 3:8; Heb. 3:14

χριω.definition: to anoint; in NT to anoint, by way of instituting to a dignity, function, or privilege, Lk. 4:18; Acts 4:27; 10:38; 2 Cor. 1:21; Heb. 1:9*

χρονιζω.definition: to spend time; to linger, delay, be long, Mt. 24:48; 25:5; Lk. 1:21; 12:45; Heb. 10:37*

χρονος.definition: time, whether in respect of duration or a definite point of its lapse, Mt. 2:7; 25:19 freq.; an epoch, era, marked duration, Acts 1:7; 1 Thess. 5:1

χρονοτριβεω.definition: to spend time, waste time, linger, delay, Acts 20:16*

χρυσιον.definition: gold, Heb. 9:4; 1 Pet. 1:7; Rev. 3:18; 21:18, 21; spc. gold when coined or manufactured; golden ornaments, 1 Tim. 2:9; 1 Pet. 3:3; Rev. 17:4; 18:16; gold coin, money, Acts 3:6; 20:33; 1 Pet. 1:18*

χρυσοδακτυλιος.definition: having rings of gold on the fingers, Jas. 2:2*

χρυσολιθος.definition: chrysolite, a name applied by the ancients to all gems of a gold color; spc. the modern topaz, Rev. 21:10*

χρυσοπρασος.definition: a chrysoprase, a species of gem of a golden green color like that of a leek, Rev. 21:20*

χρυσος.definition: gold, Mt. 2:11; 23:16, 17; meton. gold ornaments, 1 Tim. 2:9; gold coin, money, Mt. 10:9

χρυσους.definition: golden, made of or adorned with gold, 2 Tim. 2:20; Heb. 9:4; Rev. 1:12, 13, 20; 9:13, 20, 21:15

χρυσοω.definition: to gild, overlay with gold, adorn or deck with gold, Rev. 17:4; 18:16*

χρως.definition: the skin; the body surface; Acts 19:12*

χωλος.definition: crippled in the feet, limping, halting, lame, Mt. 11:5; 15:30, 31; met. limping, weak, spiritually, Heb. 12:13; maimed, deprived of a foot, for ἀναπηρός, Mk. 9:45

χωρα.definition: space, room; a country, region, tract, province, Mk. 5:10; Lk. 2:8; a district, territory, suburbs, Mt. 8:28; meton. the inhabitants of a country, region, etc., Mk. 1:5; Acts 12:20; the country, as opposed to the city or town, Lk. 21:21; a field, farm, Lk. 12:16; Jn. 4:35

χωρεω.definition: to make room, either by motion or capacity; to move, pass, Mt. 15:17; to proceed, go on, 2 Pet. 3:9; to progress, make way, Jn. 8:37; trans. to hold as contents, contain, afford room for, Mk. 2:2; Jn. 2:6; 21:25; met. to give mental admittance to, to yield accordance, Mt. 19:11, 12; to admit to approbation and esteem, to regard cordially, 2 Cor. 7:2*

χωριζω.definition: to divide, separate, Mt. 19:6; Mk. 10:9; Rom. 8:35, 39; to dissociate one’s self, to part, 1 Cor. 7:10, 11, 15; to withdraw, depart, Acts 1:4; 18:1, 2; Phlm. 15; to be aloof, Heb. 7:26*

χωριον.definition: a place, spot; Mt. 26:36; Mk. 14:32; a field, farm, estate, domain, Jn. 4:5; Acts 1:18, 19(2x); 4:34; 5:3, 8; 28:7*

χωρις.definition: can function as an improper prep., apart, Jn. 20:7; apart from, parted from, Jn. 15:5; Jas. 2:18, 20, 26; alien from, Eph. 2:12; apart from, on a distinct footing from, 1 Cor. 11:11; apart from, distinct from, without the intervention of, Rom. 3:21, 28; 4:6; apart from the company of, independently of, 1 Cor. 4:8; Heb. 11:40 without the presence of, Heb. 9:28; without the agency of, Jn. 1:3; Rom. 10:14; without the employment of, Mt. 13:34; Mk. 4:34; Heb. 7:20, 21; 9:7, 18, 22; without, Lk. 6:49; Phil. 2:14; 1 Tim. 2:8; 5:21; Phlm. 14; Heb. 10:28; 11:6; 12:8, 14; clear from, Heb. 7:7; irrespectively of, Rom. 7:8, 9; without reckoning, besides, Mt. 14:21; 15:38; 2 Cor. 11:28; with the exception of, Heb. 4:15

χωρος.definition: Corus, or Caurus, the northwest wind; meton, the northwest quarter of the heavens, Acts 27:12*

ψαλλω.definition: to move by a touch, to twitch; to touch, strike the strings or chords of an instrument; absol. to play on a stringed instrument; to sing to music; in NT to sing praises, Rom. 15:9; 1 Cor. 14:15; Eph. 5:19; Jas. 5:13*

ψαλμος.definition: impulse, touch of the chords of a stringed instrument; in NT a sacred song, psalm, Lk. 20:42; 24:44; Acts 1:20; 13:33; 1 Cor. 14:26; Eph. 5:19; Col. 3:16*

ψευδαδελφος.definition: a false brother, a pretend Christian, 2 Cor. 11:26; Gal. 2:4*

ψευδαποστολος.definition: a false apostle, pretend minister of Christ, 2 Cor. 11:13*

ψευδης.definition: false, lying, Acts 6:13; Rev. 2:2; in NT pl. maintainers of religious falsehood, corrupters of the truth of God, Rev. 21:8*

ψευδοδιδασκαλος.definition: a false teacher, one who teaches false doctrines, 2 Pet. 2:1*

ψευδομαρτυρεω.definition: to bear false witness, give false testimony, Mt. 19:18; Mk. 10:19; 14:56, 57; Lk. 18:20*

ψευδοπροφητης.definition: a false prophet, one who falsely claims to speak by divine inspiration, whether as a foreteller of future events, or as a teacher of doctrines, Mt. 7:15; 24:24; Mk. 13:22; Acts 13:6; 1 Jn. 4:1; Rev. 16:13

ψευδος.definition: falsehood, Jn. 8:44; Eph. 4:25; 2 Thess. 2:9, 11; 1 Jn. 2:21, 27; in NT religious falsehood, perversion of religious truth, false religion, Rom. 1:25; the practices of false religion, Rev. 14:15; 21:27; 22:15*

ψευδοχριστος.definition: a false Christ, pretend Messiah, Mt. 24:24; Mk. 13:22*

ψευσμα.definition: a falsehood, lie; in NT untruthfulness, Rom. 3:7*

ψευστης.definition: one who utters a falsehood, a liar, Jn. 8:44, 55; Rom. 3:4; 1 Tim. 1:10; Tit. 1:12; 1 Jn. 1:10; 2:4, 22; 4:20; 5:10*

ψηλαφαω.definition: to feel, handle, Lk. 24:39; to feel or grope for or after, as persons in the dark, Acts 17:27; Heb. 12:18; 1 Jn. 1:1*

ψηφιζω.definition: to reckon by means of pebbles, compute by counters; hence genr. to compute, reckon, calculate, Lk. 14:28; Rev. 13:18*

ψηφος.definition: a small stone, pebble; a pebble variously employed, especially in a ballot; hence, a vote, suffrage, Acts 26:10; a pebble or stone; probably given as a token, Rev. 2:17 (2x)*

ψιθυρισμος.definition: a whispering; a calumnious whispering, gossip, 2 Cor. 12:20*

ψιθυριστης.definition: a whisperer; a whisperer, gossip, Rom. 1:29*

ψιχιον.definition: a morsel, crumb, bit, Mt. 15:27; Mk. 7:28*

ψυχη.definition: breath; the principle of animal life; the life, Mt. 2:20; 6:25; Mk. 3:4; Lk. 21:19; Jn. 10:11; an inanimate being, 1 Cor. 15:45; a human individual, soul, Acts 2:41; 3:23; 7:14; 27:37; Rom. 13:1; 1 Pet. 3:20; the immaterial soul, Mt. 10:28; 1 Pet. 1:9; 2:11, 25; 4:19; the soul as the seat of religious and moral sentiment, Mt. 11:29; Acts 14:2, 22; 15:24; Eph. 6:6; the soul, as a seat of feeling, Mt. 12:18; 26:38; the soul, the inner self, Lk. 12:19

ψυχικος.definition: pertaining to the life or soul; in NT animal, as distinguished from spiritual subsistence, 1 Cor. 15:44, 46; occupied with mere animal things, animal, sensual, 1 Cor. 2:14; Jas. 3:15; Jude 19*

ψυχω.definition: to breathe; to cool; pass. to be cooled; met. of affection, Mt. 24:12*

ψωμιζω.definition: pr. to feed by morsels; hence, genr. to feed, supply with food, Rom. 12:20; to bestow in supplying food, 1 Cor. 13:3*

ψωχω.definition: to rub in pieces, as the ears of grain, Lk. 6:1*

ωδε.definition: here, in this place, Mt. 12:6, 41; ὡδε ἠ ὡδε, here or there, Mt. 24:23; τὰ ὡδε, the state of things here, Col. 4:9; met. herein, in this thing, Rev. 13:10, 18; to this place, Mt. 8:29; 14:18

ωδη.definition: an ode, song, hymn, Eph. 5:19; Col. 3:16; Rev. 5:9; 14:3; 15:3*

ωδιν.definition: the spasms or pains, of a woman in travail, a birth pang, 1 Thess. 5:3; pl. met. birth throes, preliminary troubles to the development of a catastrophe, Mt. 24:8; Mk. 13:8; from the Hebrew, a stringent band, a snare, noose, Acts 2:24*

ωδινω.definition: to be in travail, Gal. 4:27; Rev. 12:2; met. to travail with, suffer birth pangs, to make effort to bring to spiritual birth, Gal. 4:19*

ωρα.definition: a limited portion of time, marked out by part of a settled routine or train of circumstances; a season of the year; time of day, Mt. 14:15; Mk. 6:35; 11:11; an hour, Mt. 20:3; Jn. 11:9; in NT an eventful season, 1 Jn. 2:18 (2x); Rev. 3:10; 14:7; due time, Jn. 16:21; Rom. 13:11; a destined period, hour, Mt. 26:45; Mk. 14:35; Jn. 2:4; 7:30; a short period, Mt. 26:40; Jn. 5:35; 2 Cor. 7:8; Gal. 2:5; 1 Thess. 2:17; Phlm. 15; a point of time, time, Mt. 8:13; 24:42; Lk. 2:38

ωραιος.definition: timely, seasonable; in prime, blooming; in NT beautiful, Mt. 23:27; Acts 3:2, 10; Rom. 10:15*

ωρυομαι.definition: to howl; to roar, as a lion, 1 Pet. 5:8*

ως.definition: conjunction formed from the relative pronoun ὅς, used as a comparative part. and conj., as, correlatively, Mk. 4:26; Jn. 7:46; Rom. 5:15; as, like as, Mt. 10:16; Eph. 5:8; according as, Gal. 6:10; as, as it were, Rev. 8:8; as, Lk. 16:1; Acts 3:12; before numerals, about, Mk. 5:13; conj. that, Acts 10:28; how, Rom. 11:2; when, Mt. 28:9; Phil. 2:23; as an exclamatory particle, how, Rom. 10:15; equivalent to ὥστε, accordingly, Heb. 3:11; also, on condition that, provided that, Acts 20:24; ὡς εἰπεῖν, so to speak, Heb. 7:9

ωσαννα.definition: Hosanna! save now, help now, Mt. 21:9, 15; Mk. 11:9, 10; Jn. 12:13*

ωσαυτως.definition: just so, in just the same way or manner, likewise, Mt. 20:5; 21:30

ωσει.definition: as if; as it were, as, like, Mt. 3:16; 9:36; with terms of number or quantity, about, Mt. 14:21; Lk. 1:56; 22:41, 59

ωσπερει.definition: just as if; as it were, 1 Cor. 15:8*

ωστε.definition: so that, so as that, so as to, Mt. 8:24; Mk. 2:12; Acts 14:1; Gal. 2:13; as an illative particle, therefore, consequently, Mt. 12:12; 23:31

ωτιον.definition: in NT simply equivalent to οὖς, an ear, Mt. 26:51; Lk. 22:51; Jn. 18:26*

ωφελεια.definition: help; profit, gain, advantage, benefit, Rom. 3:1; Jude 16*

ωφελεω.definition: to help, profit, benefit, accomplish, Mt. 27:24; Mk. 7:11; Rom. 2:25; be of value, Jn. 6:63

ωφελιμος.definition: profitable, useful, beneficial; serviceable, 1 Tim. 4:8 (2x); 2 Tim. 3:16; Tit. 3:8*
